I responded that I have two credit cards -- I give the one with XXXX to my son who lived in XXXX  for emergency case. I did not know why it translate to this agent to I give out my Home Depot card. After that I had been calling numerous times to the bank to fix the issue, but no response.Then certainly my Best Buy store card got charge $ XXXX something. This time I think the bank fabricated these charge or someone charged. I told the bank agent that I stop use this store card for a while and I had $ XXXX credit on this card. Nothing resolve just run around this issue.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Credit monitoring or identity theft protection services
Sub-issue: Didn't receive services that were advertised
Consumer complaint narrative:
Date : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX at XXXX Subject : TransUnion XXXX XXXX XXXX Case Number XXXX - Credit Restoration To : TransUnion XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Hello VP of Transunion XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX purchased TransUnion XXXX XXXX years back with 100 % full identity theft restoration services. Yet unfortunately, I've still been hampered by identity theft and stolen event issues on my credit report, which have become significant barriers to moving forward. These identity theft stolen event issues are covered under the identity theft insurance at {$34.00} per month or {$340.00} per year ( plus tax ). Despite this, I find myself grappling with unresolved identity theft issues, compounded by discriminatory practices within the system as identity theft issues have escalated impacting my daily transactions and ability to obtain new credit e.g. my XXXX Bank application was recently declined due to an incomplete credit file. They told me to fix the identity theft issues and reapply later. In addition, an emergency ambulatory medical collection was put on my credit report, after my family was targeted and assaulted after leaving a XXXX ; and the driver was able to avoid jail time ( XXXX ) after violating 18 US Code Section 1389 on an honorable Veterans dependents. Years prior, to the injustices in XXXX XXXX XXXX, a driver tried to hit me with a vehicle off XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA - vehicular manslaughter attempt in broad daylight as I was trying to get my mail- the male driver attempted twice to try and hit me with the grey station wagon and I saw a XXXX XXXX  directing him to do so across XXXX XXXX parked at the Bank. I received a weird chain letter ( attached ) as well a XXXX address fraud letter which I reported to the USPS XXXX XXXX Prior to all of this the identity theft stemmed from when my purse was stolen, at a New York XXXX XXXX XXXX which contributed significantly to identity theft issues. - all of my credit cards, checks, student and military ID, GOES pass, everything was in my purse which was under the passenger side seat of my XXXX XXXX XXXX males got out of a XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, broke into my vehicle and drove off. XXXX was bold enough to use my XXXX card to purchase himself cigarettes and an expensive watch. I reported the GOES pass theft to XXXX. I filed the XXXX. However these actions which should have resolved my identity theft years ago have been ongoing XXXX to present. My family has been severely harmed by terrorism campaigns, vandalism to real estate, my vehicle vandalized. Attacks to my retail transactions and I have filed numerous FTC complaints. Scammers sending me unwanted threatening text messages. I have been sent highly triggering, disturbing racketeering emails to my XXXX which violate Can-Spam ( XXXX have been received just this month ) and I filed numerous FCC complaints which did not help. I have been sent racketeering emails from hotels. Impersonators have used my information at XXXX, a XXXX company called XXXX, I have been sent threatening marketing about death, XXXX, life insurance policies that I never applied for and even someone attempted to get an XXXX XXXX  in my name. I have also dealt with XXXX violations at Veteran Affairs which I reported to the XXXX at VA, XXXX accessing my XXXX  Veteran medical records. Given these circumstances and my ongoing investment in identity theft insurance, I am requesting the removal of the detrimental identity theft harms from my credit report. I believe I over qualify for restoration, and I request for your urgent attention to rectify this situation. It is concerning that, despite my diligence in protecting my identity and my commitment to addressing these issues through formal channels, I continue to face barriers that undermine my financial stability and overall well-being. The negative impacts of these unresolved matters extend beyond mere credit scores ; and request you to consider the gravity of my sensitive and life threatening situation. The compounded effects of identity theft I have faced over the years, demand a serious approach to restoring my identity and integrity. I seek to have these negative harms removed/deleted and request that you share the corrected and completed file with XXXX and TransUnion to ensure that such injustices do not continue to affect my family in the future. 

I demand the immediate deletion of inaccurate and fraudulent information on my credit report and to stop the ongoing, unauthorized charges related to your Restoration Services. Despite providing you with all necessary documentation over the years and clearly identifying the accounts that are both fraudulent and outdated, you have failed to remove these items from my credit report and are continuing to charge me {$34.00} per month ( or {$340.00} per year ) for services that have not been rendered. 

-- -- -- -- The accounts in question should have been removed under federal law : Fraudulent accounts resulting from identity theft occurred when my purse was stolen. The thief used XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX ( BofA ) card to purchase cigarettes and a watch, and XXXX confirmed that the thief was caught on camera at a liquor store. This account should have been deleted from my credit report years ago. I have been back and forth with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) as well regarding stolen identity events and I am done with their toxic, deceptive and discriminatory tactics as well. This situation amounts to XXXX practices and harassment. Additionally, XXXX is fully aware that my vehicle was vandalized in a hate-motivated terrorism campaign. Keeping these accounts on my credit report is intentionally obstructing my ability to obtain loan approval and move away from a toxic situation - stuck since XX/XX/XXXX to present with my dependents. The failure to act has led me to conclude that TransUnion is systematically and intentionally preventing me from moving forward, impeding my ability to improve my financial standing. I believe these actions represent not only an unjust violation of the laws of the land but also potentially politically motivated hate and deceptive practices designed to harm my financial well-being. 

Several discrepancies, including fraudulent accounts and outdated negative items, have harmed my creditworthiness; preventing me from obtaining credit - most recently I was denied credit by XXXX XXXX, XXXX and XXXX XXXX. Despite my previous efforts to bring these issues to your attention, these inaccuracies remain unresolved. The continued presence of these items on my report has directly contributed to a credit denials. This is not only a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), but it has also caused significant harm to my financial well-being. 

I am also requesting the immediate removal of my personal information from all illegal blacklists and fraudulent databases associated with my identity. As a victim of identity theft, my personal data has been misused and included in illegal dark list, hit list, watch list and unauthorized blacklists which have negatively impacting my financial standing and credit, in violation of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( XXXX ), which provides for penalties of up to {$25000.00} per violation - I have been violated for years. I am demanding the immediate removal of all inaccurate and fraudulent accounts from my credit report, in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and my rights as a victim of identity theft. Under the FCRA, the penalties include up to {$1000.00} per violation, plus actual damages for any harm caused by the violation, such as denial of credit and emotional distress. Additionally, punitive damages may apply, up to {$500000.00} or 1 % of the companys net worth. Furthermore, accounts older than 7 years, as per the FCRA, should have been deleted but remain. I trust you will act swiftly and in accordance with the law to correct these injustices. I expect the inaccurate items to be deleted from my report immediately. You are taking my money and failing to take any action to resolve these issues. I have been dealing with these discriminatory and deceptive practices for years, and enough is enough.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy. 

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
EXPERIAN is in clear violation of the law. Under 15 USC 1681 of consumer reports, THE LAW CLEARLY STATES : ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 1 ) In response to the order of a court having jurisdiction to issue such an order, a subpoena issued in connection with proceedings before a Federal grand jury, or a subpoena issued in accordance with section 5318 of title 31 or section 3486 of title 18.

( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

Did I give you written instructions to furnish this on my credit report???

Furthermore, the FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT 15 USC 1681 ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) Exclusions from a consumer credit report clearly states : ( 2 ) EXCLUSIONS- except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ). The term consumer report does not include- ( A ) Subject to section 1681s-3 of this title, any- ( i ) Report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumers and the person making the report. 
Transaction : In business law, a transaction is an event associated with business dealings conducted between two or more parties that involve the formation and performance of an obligation or contract. 
THE LAW CLEARLY STATES : Transactions or experiences between the consumer ( me ) and the person making the report is NOT INCLUDED ON MY CONSUMER REPORT.

Delete the above late payment from my consumer report, this agency is in violation of 15 USC 1681. 

The reporting of this account violates multiple provisions under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other consumer protection laws, including but not limited to : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is reporting incorrectly. I request that this inaccurate item be immediately investigated. The account must be removed/updated to show my true credit history.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am formally disputing the reported late payment on my account, as I believe this information to be inaccurate. The FCRA mandates that all data furnished to credit reporting agencies must meet stringent standards of accuracy and verifiability. 

I respectfully request that the creditor or data furnisher conduct a thorough investigation into this matter and provide concrete evidence substantiating the claim of a late payment. In the absence of such verifiable evidence, I urge that the disputed information be promptly corrected or removed from my credit report in compliance with the provisions of the FCRA. 

This issue is of significant concern, as inaccurate reporting has far-reaching implications on creditworthiness, and I trust that due diligence will be exercised to ensure adherence to the law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I obtained this personal loan in XXXX of XXXX. I did not go through XXXX XXXX 's main website. At the time I used XXXX XXXX to apply for the loan. XXXX XXXX was the one that came up. They approved me for a loan and I paid for the loan, no problem up until now. 
I did what most people do, just pay the loan off as normal, making the minimum payment. Despite XXXX XXXX XXXX  high interest rates and most of the money going to interest, never had an issue paying on time. I kept up my agreement of the loan. Even in XXXX years time, I have paid a significant amount to this loan. 
Fast forward XXXX years later. What I learned, I probably would have never caught if it weren't for the next chain of events. I applied for a home loan with another institution in XXXX of XXXX. XXXX XXXX does not do home loans I believe. They pulled my credit to see where my debts are. The representative of the bank told me everything was good to go. She did not see this error on my credit report. It was only caught by the underwriter. They saw that the XXXX XXXX loan was not updated since XXXX of XXXX. Of course they questioned it and wanted to know what's going on with this loan and what is the actual amount of the loan. The bank for the home loan used a third-party verification company to verify the loan because it was not updated in over a year. The verification company got a hold of someone at XXXX XXXX, who told them over the phone that my loan was paid in full, closed, and in good standing. But when Iogin to the website, it shows a balance that I owe. 
One thing I want to point out is that XXXX XXXX keeps a banner on their page saying it's upgrading their system. This has been on their site ever since I have gotten this loan. So at least two years and counting. The not reporting the credit bureaus is one thing, but telling a third-party verification company that my account is paid in full is a bit suspicious. It would be one thing if I was close to finish paying off the loan and the system needed time to update, but that's not the case for me. 
I have a copy of the verification companies report they gave to the bank because the bank gave it to me and it says what XXXX XXXX told them via them calling XXXX XXXX 's XXXX ( XXXX ) number.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX RE : XXXX To whom it may concern, I, XXXX XXXX, never gave { XXXX XXXX } any verbal or written consent to report anything on my consumer report. No consent is Identity Theft. A copy of the law is attached with this dispute. 
You also do not have any permissible purpose to furnish my personal information to any third party. 
THIS IS IDENITY THEFT!!! PER 15 USC 1681Q YOU MUST HAVE WRITTEN INSTRUSCTION TO REPORT THIS ACCOUNT LIST BELOW. IM DEMANDING YOU PROVIDE ME MY WRITTEN SIGNATURE WHERE I GAVE YOU PERMISSION TO REPORT TO MY CONSUMER REPORT TO SHARE MY PERSONAL INFORMATION. YOU RECIEVED MY INFORAMTION FROM A SECONDARY REPORTING AGENCY. 
PER TITLE 18 USC 1028A THIS IS AGGRAVATED IDENITY THEFT AND I DEMAND THIS ENITRE ACCOUNT BE DELETED FROM MY CONSUMER REPORT AND FROM YOUR DATA BASE. IM EXCERCISING MY RIGHTS. 
As a consumer, I am demanding a deletion of the following account : XXXX XXXX 15 USC 1681b Permissible purpose of consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. 
PLEASE SEND ME AN UPDATED REPORT SHOWING THIS ACCOUNT BEING DELETED FROM YOUR DATA SYSTEM IMEDIATELY I am concerned about the validity and accuracy of your recent investigation of these accounts that are reporting on my credit report. Last month I requested an investigation because I felt the item was not being reported legally. Couple of days ago I received a letter stating that your investigation was complete. Please explain to me how you conducted your investigation! 
1.Please explain to me what your representatives uncovered to lead them to believe that you are reporting this item as it legally should be reported? 
2.What certified documents were reviewed to conclude your investigation? 
3.Please provide a complete copy of all of the information that was transmitted to the data furnisher as part of the investigation. 
4.What did it cost your company to obtain the documents needed to complete your investigation? 
5.Please provide proof of your timely procurement of certified documents. 
6.Did you speak directly to any agent of the company that was reporting the information to confirm the accuracy of what you are reporting? 
7. If yes to above : a.Who did you speak to? b.On what date? 
4 c.How long was the conversation? 
d.What was their position? 
e.What telephone number did you call? 
f. What is the name of the employee of your company that spoke directly to the above party? 
g.What is the position of the employee of your company that spoke directly to the above party? 
h.How long has that employee been employed by your company? 
i.What formal training was provided to this employee to investigate items of this kind? 
j.Was there any email or written communication between members of your company and the above party? 
8.If so, please provide copies of all correspondence ; supply copies of any and all conclusive documentation to prove that you have in fact conducted a reasonable investigation of the account in question.

9.Provide the date of the commencement of delinquency 10.Provide the SPECIFIC date reporting that these items will cease Enclosed with your response to the above questions I respectfully request a notarized affidavit confirming the information that is provided is true and correct as per my civil rights granted under several federal laws. This information should not come as a form letter response. 
My initial dispute was detailed and directly related to the account in question. A template response will not be an acceptable response. If you can not supply ALL of the above information in a timely manner as detailed in several laws, including but not limited to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I must immediately demand the permanent removal of this item from my credit report. 
This erroneous entry is detrimental to my overall credit rating and has caused me severe financial and emotional distress. If you choose not to provide the above requested deletion or requested/required documentation of your investigation, I will pursue the enforcements of my constitutional rights via federal court proceedings. 
As you are well aware this information will come out through my formal discovery process, and necessary depositions. I have recently studied constitutional consumer protection laws along with civil/federal court procedures. I will represent myself prose and will formally request a jury trial. 
Please respond accordingly, XXXX XXXX

After an hour I saw that I had XXXX taken out of my account. I called fraud at regions and they told me someone opened a joint account and transferred all of my money into the joint account and then took the money. They also said I had to visit a local branch. When I went in they said they didnt notice this when I came in two hours prior and someone opened a joint account online somehow and they could not tell me anything else. All the bank did was put a red flag on my online banking. Never called to see about fraud.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute and Request for Removal of Fraudulent Charge-Off Accounts from Experian Credit Report Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint and request the immediate removal of fraudulent charge-off accounts from my Experian credit report. As a victim of identity theft, I have been subjected to unauthorized accounts and transactions that have adversely affected my credit standing. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Experian 's policies, these fraudulent entries must be removed to ensure the accuracy and integrity of my credit report. 

The details of the fraudulent accounts are as follows : XXXX. XXXX XXXX Number : XXXX - Balance : {$5900.00} - Balance Updated : XX/XX/XXXX - Credit Limit : {$5000.00} - Account Status : Closed - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX - Account Type : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Number : XXXX - Balance : {$1300.00} - Balance Updated : XX/XX/XXXX - Credit Limit : {$1000.00} - Account Status : Closed - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX - Account Type : Credit Card XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Number : XXXX - Balance : {$16000.00} - Balance Updated : XX/XX/XXXX - Credit Limit : {$15000.00} - Account Status : Closed - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX - Account Type : Credit Card XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Number : XXXX - Balance : {$21000.00} - Balance Updated : XX/XX/XXXX - Credit Limit : {$20000.00} - Account Status : Closed - Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX - Account Type : Credit Card This information is the result of identity theft and does not accurately reflect my credit history. I have also taken steps to have these accounts suppressed by XXXX XXXX XXXX, where they were deemed unverifiable. I have attached a copy of the identity theft report filed with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), as well as the documentation from XXXX, for your reference. 

Under the FCRA, consumers are entitled to dispute any inaccurate information on their credit reports and to request its removal if proven to be fraudulent. Despite my previous attempts to resolve this matter directly with Experian, these fraudulent charge-off accounts continue to appear on my credit report, causing significant harm to my financial reputation. 

In light of the above, I kindly request the CFPB to intervene and ensure that Experian promptly investigates these disputed accounts and removes them from my credit report. I have attached copies of my identity theft report filed with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), police reports, and any other relevant documentation to substantiate my claim. 

I trust that the CFPB will take swift and appropriate action to rectify this issue, ensuring that my credit report is accurate and reflects only legitimate transactions. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681.

15 U.S.C 1681 section 602 A. States I have the right to privacy.

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Credit Report Inaccuracies Dear Sir/Madam , I am writing to formally dispute inaccuracies in my credit report as provided by the XXXX major credit bureaus : XXXX, Experian, and XXXX. It has come to my attention that my credit card account, which is in good standing with a perfect payment history, has been deleted from my credit report, effectively shortening my credit history. 

Details of the account are as follows : - **Account Number : ** XXXX - **Account Type : ** Revolving Account Opened XX/XX/XXXX - **Status : ** XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - **Payment History : ** No late payments, paid as agreed I have received multiple letters from all three bureaus requesting additional identification, despite having already provided all necessary information. This continual request for information is unnecessary as I have verified that my records are complete. 

The actions taken by the credit bureaus may constitute a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) regarding willful non-compliance. As my credit report reflects, all three bureaus have acknowledged my account status as " OK, '' and there are no discrepancies in my payment history. 

I kindly request an immediate investigation into this matter and urge you to ensure that my account is accurately represented in my credit report. Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, CFPB PLEASE HAVE THIS ACCOUNT REINSTATED

Your cooperation and prompt attention are legally required. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 
Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency generates a consumer report, it must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information related to the individual to whom the report pertains.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, following a reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any disputed information by a consumer, an item is determined to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable, the consumer reporting agency must ( i ) promptly delete the disputed item from the consumer 's file, or appropriately modify the information based on the reinvestigation results; and ( ii ) promptly inform the furnisher of the information that the item has been modified or deleted from the consumer 's file. 
Please remove the following items from my credit report immediately : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Good day! 
I am reaching out regarding several concerning accounts in my credit report that require investigation for a lawful resolution. Upon review, I identified inaccuracies and inconsistencies that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The violations I have noted include : Violation of Timely Payments Regulations Violation of Finance Charge Determination Violation of United States Code Law ( TILA 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( b ) billing error ) I request that you provide proper evidence showing that I was late on this account, in compliance with Section 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) Ai, 15 USC 1666b, and 1637 ( b ). If you can not supply the required evidence, you can not deem payment as late, which constitutes a violation of Section 15 USC 1681s-2. Please update the account as " PAID '' or " PAID AS AGREED. '' Additionally, I am filing this complaint due to the multiple inaccuracies in my report, which have negatively impacted my ability to secure credit. The violations that need prompt attention are : FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance FCRA Section 603 ( 4 ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms Violation of Credit Report Permissible Purposes Privacy Act violations U.S.C 552a ( g ) ( 1 ) ( A ) USC 1692e I demand verifiable proof, specifically the original consumer contract with my signature, for the accounts listed. Under the FCRA, unverified accounts must be removed if you can not provide this proof. Therefore, I insist that the accounts be VERIFIED or REMOVED immediately. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Your Address ] [ City, State, ZIP Code ] [ Date ] VyStar Credit Union XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX XXXX : Dispute of 30-Day Late Payment Reporting for XX/XX/year> To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of a 30-day late payment for XX/XX/year>, as furnished by VyStar Credit Union to XXXX and XXXX. This dispute is made in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related regulations, which require furnishers of information to provide timely and accurate notice to consumers regarding negative information. 

Violation of Notice Requirements Pursuant to Section 623 of the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ) and 12 C.F.R. 1022.7, a financial institution must provide notice to the consumer no later than 30 days after furnishing negative information to a credit reporting agency ( CRA ). Specifically : After providing the initial notice, the institution is not required to send additional notices if subsequent negative information is reported about the same account or transaction. 

VyStar Credit Union failed to comply with this requirement. I did not receive proper notice within 30 days of the negative information being furnished to XXXX and XXXX. This failure to follow federal law has resulted in inaccurate and unfair reporting on my consumer credit file. 

Request for Immediate Action I demand that VyStar Credit Union : XXXX. Remove the XXXX late payment for XX/XX/year> from XXXX and XXXX. 
XXXX. Provide evidence that the notice of negative information was sent to me in compliance with 12 C.F.R. 1022.7 and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 7 ). 

Failure to comply with this request will result in further action, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and pursuing remedies under the FCRA. 



Conclusion VyStar Credit Unions failure to adhere to federal law has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness. I request immediate rectification of this matter to prevent further damage.

I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and require the creditor to comply with applicable laws.

The Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) - 12 U.S.C. 5481 et seq. - addresses the harm caused to consumers by unfair, deceptive, or abusive practices, particularly in credit reporting. The CFPA empowers the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to regulate these practices, known as UDAAPs ( Unfair, Deceptive, or Abusive Acts or Practices ), in consumer financial products. Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally address concerns regarding my account with your institution. Specifically, despite fully paying off a this account. I believe Navy Federal Credit Union is violating my rights under federal consumer protection laws. The reported information is inaccurate and should be deleted for the following reasons : 1. Incorrect Balance and Past Due Amount : This account was paid in full. The balance and past-due amounts are incorrect. 
2. Incorrect Payment History : The reported payment history rating does not reflect the accounts actual payment record. 
3. Misclassification as a Charge-Off/Collection : This account is not a charge-off or collection. It has been fully paid and should be reported as PAID. 
4. Incorrect Remarks Field : The remarks field is misleading and inaccurate. Please delete all remarks associated with this account. 
The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a violation of the FACT Act and the FCRA, which mandate that credit reporting agencies ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the data they report. 

I am requesting that this account be reviewed and updated to reflect the following changes : I request the immediate removal of this account from all credit reporting agencies. 


Details of Violations 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Navy Federal has inaccurately reported my paid charge-off as unresolved to credit reporting agencies. 

Additionally, the account has not been updated to accurately reflect its paid status, despite my requests to rectify the issue. 

2. Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) : Your institution has engaged in practices that may be considered unfair, deceptive, or abusive by failing to ensure accurate reporting and withholding proper resolution information. 

I request the immediate removal of this account from all credit reporting agencies. I am writing to formally address the tangible losses I have experienced as a direct result of the inaccuracies in my credit report. These violations have led to the denial of loans and higher interest rates, significantly impacting my financial well-being. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am requesting statutory damages of {$1000.00} for each violation. Additionally, I am seeking compensation for monetary damages, including punitive damages, to address the harm caused by these errors.

I have attached a copy of FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
" I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding unauthorized accounts that persist on my credit report despite my repeated efforts to have them removed. These accounts are causing significant damage to my financial reputation and overall well-being. It is evident that the inclusion of these fraudulent items violates 15 USC 1681b regarding permissible purposes, as the credit bureaus have no legitimate reason to report them without my explicit consent. Please refer to the attached file detailing these items I am disputing.

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence, which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. ''

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX may have violated specific privacy laws and regulations by sharing your personal information without your consent. Here are some relevant laws that may apply : 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The FCRA regulates how consumer reporting agencies handle personal data. If XXXX failed to ensure the accuracy of your information or shared it without permissible purpose, it could be in violation. 
Section 604 ( a ) : Specifies the limited purposes for which consumer reports may be shared, requiring explicit consent in most cases. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : The XXXX requires financial institutions and entities handling sensitive data to protect consumer information and provide notices about information-sharing practices. 
Privacy Rule ( 16 CFR Part 313 ) : Mandates disclosure and consent requirements for sharing personal data. 
XXXX. State Privacy Laws : Depending on your state, XXXX may have violated laws like the California Consumer Privacy Act ( CCPA ) or Arizonas Consumer Fraud Act if you reside in these states. 
CCPA ( California ) : Gives consumers the right to know what information is collected, opt out of its sale, and request deletion. 
XXXX. Unauthorized Use and Consent : Tort Law ( Invasion of Privacy ) : Publishing false or private information without consent can constitute an invasion of privacy, including false light or public disclosure of private facts.

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall- ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( i ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, the list of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 
Account name : XXXX : XXXX  XXXX Bankruptcy, Experian : XXXX  XXXX Bankruptcy, XXXX : XXXX  XXXX Bankruptcy, XXXX : XXXX, Experian : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, Experian : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, Experian : XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, XXXX, Experian : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, Experian : XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, Experian : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, Experian : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, Experian : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX, Experian : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, Experian : XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, Experian XXXX XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, Experian XXXX XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, Experian : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX, Experian : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX, Experian : XXXX, XXXX : XXXX According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates, according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

According to 15 USC 1681 5, they are supposed to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

According to 15 USC 1681s-2, they are supposed not to furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

15 U.S.C. 1681B ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Unauthorized Inquiries on Credit Reports To Whom It May Concern : I am filing this complaint against XXXX, Experian, and XXXX regarding unauthorized inquiries on my credit reports that I have repeatedly attempted to address without resolution. I believe these unauthorized inquiries may be connected to a data breach in which my personal information was exposed. I filed an FTC Identity Theft Report ( Report XXXX : XXXX ) to document this breach. 

Background : Upon reviewing my credit reports, I noticed several inquiries that I did not authorize. These inquiries have negatively impacted my credit score and financial standing. I have sent dispute letters to the credit bureaus, outlining the specific unauthorized inquiries and requesting their prompt removal. However, my attempts to resolve this issue through phone calls have been unsuccessful, as I was unable to get a representative on the phone. 

Details of Unauthorized Inquiries XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Experian : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Actions Taken : XXXX. Sent dispute letters to XXXX, Experian, and XXXX requesting the removal of unauthorized inquiries. 
XXXX. Filed an FTC Identity Theft Report ( Report XXXX : XXXX ) due to the exposure of my personal information in a data leak. 
XXXX. Attempted multiple phone calls to the credit bureaus but was unable to reach a representative. 

Resolution Sought : I request that the CFPB investigate this matter and ensure that XXXX, Experian, and XXXX take the following actions : 1. Remove all unauthorized inquiries listed above from my credit reports.

2. Implement measures to prevent further unauthorized access to my credit information.

3. Provide confirmation in writing once the inquiries have been removed.

I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to a resolution that restores the accuracy and integrity of my credit reports. 

**Sincerely, ** XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA XXXX Email : XXXX -- -

This CFPB complaint has been filed to request pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you, the XXXX credit reporting agency , reporting information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint. This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of a installment account opened at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX under the account number XXXX, an auto loan account opened at XXXX on XXXX XXXX, XXXX under the account number XXXX, a personal credit card account opened at XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under the account number XXXX. 

These accounts have resulted in several fraudulent hard inquiries and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I've attached a list of the hard inquiries in question as well as a copy of the consumer FICO credit report maintained by you which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, or hard inquiries as reported. The aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries appearing on my consumer credit report maintained by you were not opened, made, or initiated by me. All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. I have attached a copy of FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. As well as several items shared without my written permission.

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

15 U.S. Code 1681b ( a ) Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

I did not give my written permission to anyone before my information was shared and in some cases sold to third parties.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Formal Dispute and Demand for Permanent Removal of Fraudulent Account To Whom It May Concern, I am formally disputing the accuracy and legitimacy of the account listed under XXXX XXXX XXXX which is reflected as a charge-off on my credit report. This account is entirely fraudulent, as I have previously provided comprehensive documentation proving that : 1. The vehicle was never repossessed, as falsely claimed. 2. The vehicle was stolen and involved in fraudulent activity by third parties associated with the dealership, which has been documented and reported. 3. I was never informed of any repossession, rebuild, or resale of the vehicle. Given the overwhelming evidence, XXXX XXXX XXXX is knowingly perpetuating this fraudulent charge-off by allowing it to remain on my credit report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) guidelines, it is illegal to report false or inaccurate information on a consumers credit file. I demand the immediate and permanent removal of this account from my credit report. Failure to do so will leave me no choice but to escalate this matter by filing a formal complaint with the CFPB and pursuing legal action to protect my consumer rights. I expect written confirmation of this accounts removal within 15 days of this notice. Civil Court Case Number at my Justice of Peace against XXXX XXXX with XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX T exas Attorney General Office : XXXX FTC Report XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Formal Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Reporting Account XXXX I am writing to XXXX dispute the inaccurate information reported on my credit report regarding the account with XXXX XXXX referenced as XXXX The account is listed as a repossession and charge-off, but this information is incorrect due to the fraudulent circumstances surrounding the transaction and the subsequent theft of the vehicle. Details of Dispute : Account Holder : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Issue : The XXXX XXXX XXXX Series financed under this account was sold to me under fraudulent circumstances by individuals who later stole the vehicle. These events make the loan terms and subsequent repossession invalid. XXXX Requested : I request that this account be investigated and corrected on my credit report to reflect the fraudulent activity and remove any derogatory marks, including the charge-off and repossession. Supporting Documentation : I have enclosed the following documents to substantiate my claim : 1. A copy of the police report documenting the fraud and theft. 2. A copy of the Court Case Number 3. Any additional correspondence with XXXX XXXX regarding the dispute. I kindly request that your agency investigate this matter promptly and remove this incorrect information from my credit report in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Please notify me of the results of your investigation in writing. This has now been settled in a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and will be investigated. If additional information is needed to process my dispute, please contact me at XXXX or XXXX I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violation : If the bank reported the fraudulent loan to credit bureaus and failed to correct the information after you disputed it, they may have violated the FCRA. This law requires creditors to ensure the accuracy of information they report and investigate disputes promptly. 2. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Violation : If the bank failed to properly verify the identity of the applicant or disclose the terms of the loan as required under TILA, they could be in violation. Lenders are responsible for ensuring borrowers identities to prevent unauthorized accounts. 3. Identity Theft Laws Violation : If the bank was negligent in protecting your personal information or failed to implement sufficient safeguards to prevent identity theft, they could be held accountable under federal or state identity theft laws. 4. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Violation : This law requires financial institutions to protect consumer data. If the bank mishandled your personal information and that led to the fraudulent loan, they may have violated the GLBAs privacy and safeguard provisions. 5. Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) Violation : If the fraudulent account was used to deny you credit or financial opportunities and the bank failed to properly investigate or take corrective action, they could be in violation of the ECOA. 6. Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) - Fraudulent Endorsement or Contracts Violation : Under the UCC, financial institutions have a duty to ensure contracts, such as auto loans, are legitimate. If the bank failed to verify the authenticity of the signatures or loan details, they could be held liable. 7. State Consumer Protection Laws Violation : Most states have consumer protection laws that prohibit unfair or deceptive business practices. If the bank acted negligently or failed to respond appropriately to your claims, they may have violated these laws. Possible Bank-Specific Misconduct If the bank failed to investigate adequately, ignored evidence of fraud, or continued collection efforts after you reported the fraudulent loan, they may also have engaged in : Negligence : Failing to take reasonable steps to prevent or address the fraud. Bad Faith : Acting in a way that is contrary to fair dealing and honest practices. XXXX XXXX XXXX Formal Demand for Resolution of Fraudulent Loan and Resulting Damages To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally demand resolution of a fraudulent and unethical situation involving the vehicle loan associated with my name, XXXX. The actions taken by XXXX XXXX, as outlined below, have caused me significant financial losses, damage to my credit, and emotional distress. The men who opened this loan knew that because of my age and no prior auto loan history that I was the perfect target to fraudulently obtain and maintain an illegal loan. Summary of Events : XXXX. I made a down payment of {$3000.00} and paid $ XXXX for four months on a vehicle that was fraudulently sold to me. XXXX. I paid a total of {$920.00} in insurance premiums during this period. XXXX. The vehicle was illegally repossessed by the dealership and sold at auction for {$4100.00}, yet XXXX XXXX reported this as a charge-off on my credit report, causing substantial harm for 20 months. XXXX. XXXX XXXX  failed to contact me or address the fraudulent activity until I filed a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). Impact of XXXX XXXX  Actions : Financial Losses : A total of {$6000.00} in payments and expenses. Credit Damage : My credit has been negatively impacted for 20 months, leading to financial strain and potential loan denials. Emotional Distress : This situation caused undue stress, leading to depressive episodes and significant emotional hardship. Demand for Relief : T o resolve this matter and avoid further legal action, I am demanding : 1. Reimbursement of all financial losses totaling {$6000.00}. 2. Compensation for credit damage in the amount of {$10000.00}, or an appropriate amount based on your valuation. 3. Compensation for emotional distress in the amount of {$10000.00}. 4. Removal of the fraudulent loan and charge-off from my credit report. All consideration is respected however this matter should be taken seriously before I move forward legally. Response Deadline : I expect a written response to this letter, including your proposed resolution, no later than XX/XX/XXXX If I do not receive an acceptable response, I will have no choice but to escalate this matter further through legal action, filing complaints with regulatory agencies, or both. Conclusion : This matter is urgent and has caused significant hardship. I trust that XXXX XXXX will act in good faith to resolve it promptly. Dear XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I am contacting you regarding a fraudulent auto loan in my name connected to a XXXX XXXX vehicle. After discovering this account on my credit report, I investigated and uncovered significant evidence indicating that this loan was opened fraudulently without my knowledge or consent. Background of the Fraud : On XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased a XXXX XXXX through a third-party dealership in XXXX, Texas, XXXXperated by XXXX XXXX XXXX In XX/XX/XXXX, the vehicle was unlawfully taken under the pretense of repair and never returned. On XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered that XXXX XXXX XXXX reported the loan as charged-off, claiming the vehicle had been repossessed, rebuilt, and resold. This is untrue, as the vehicle was stolen, and I was never notified of any repossession or sale. Action Taken : I have already reported this matter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and have sent a demand letter requesting resolution & monetary relief. Evidence strongly suggests that fraudulent activity between XXXX XXXX, the dealership, and possibly your company facilitated the creation of this account and illegally ran it as a charge off for 20 months without contacting me. There is no proof of communication to me at this time for which my landlord at this address stated he never received ant letters from XXXX XXXX  Request for Immediate Action : I am requesting that XXXX XXXX XXXX 1. Remove the fraudulent account from my credit report immediately. 2. Issue written confirmation that I bear no liability for this loan. 3. Provide any documentation your company has related to the origination and handling of this account. ( For my purposes ) If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will have no choice but to escalate legal action. Evidence of fraud will support my case, including any negligence or willful misconduct by your company in approving this loan without verifying my consent. Please consider this email an urgent notice of dispute under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and respond no later than XX/XX/XXXX. I can be reached at XXXX or XXXX should you require additional information. I look forward to your prompt response. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX All documentation is for your records proving my claim that this is fraud. I am still seeking monetary relief from XXXX XXXX for my financial losses emotional distress and credit damage before I take legal action. I will be forwarding this email to a lawyer of mine who has been informed of illegal activities at hand. Thank you

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
[ XXXX XXXX ] [ XXXX XXXX XXXX ] [ XXXX, XXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ XXXX ] Date : [ XXXX XXXX ] To : [ XXXX  XXXX ] [ XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] Re : Dispute of Collections Account # XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally dispute the collections account listed on my credit report under the account number referenced above. Under 15 U.S. Code 1681i, I have the right to dispute any information on my credit report that I believe to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable. 

I demand that you conduct a full investigation of this account in compliance with Section 1681i ( a ), which requires that the information be verified, corrected, or deleted if it can not be substantiated. As per Section 1681s-2, it is also the responsibility of the furnisher of information to ensure the accuracy of the data they are providing to the credit bureaus. 

Furthermore, under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), a collections account must be fully validated with supporting documentation from the original creditor. If such validation can not be provided, this account must be removed from my credit report immediately. 

I expect this matter to be resolved within 30 days as required by law, and I look forward to your timely response.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Identity Theft Dispute Pursuant to FCRA 605B To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as a formal demand to rectify and suppress all fraudulent and unauthorized information on my credit report, as detailed herein and pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 605B. I demand immediate action to address the aforementioned inaccuracies. Your compliance is expected to prevent further harm and uphold your obligations under federal law.

Pursuant to FCRA 605B, you are legally required to block all fraudulent accounts and remove unauthorized inquiries within 4 days of receiving this dispute and the herein-mentioned documentation. 

As previously referenced, I was a victim of the XXXX data breach, XXXX of the largest breaches in history, which compromised the personal information of millions of individuals, including sensitive data such as Social Security numbers and financial records. This breach most definitely played a critical role in the unauthorized access and misuse of my personal information, resulting in the fraudulent accounts and inquiries outlined below. 

Fraudulent Accounts ( I dispute the following ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX The harm caused by these unrecognized and unauthorized accounts and inquiries has been significant, severely damaging my creditworthiness, financial stability, and mental well-being. These inaccuracies have magnified the financial and emotional toll on my family as we recover from a natural disaster. A strong storm hit our area on a rainy day, causing the roof of our home to rupture and sustain significant damage. As a result, rainwater poured into the house, damaging the structure, our belongings, and essential property. The aforementioned fraudulent accounts and inquiries have further delayed my ability to rebuild stability and provide for my family. 

It is also critical to note that, in my efforts to resolve these inaccuracies, I hired multiple reputable credit repair companies, fully authorized to act on my behalf as permitted by law. Despite this, the credit bureaus employed various cunning and obstructive methods to stall their work, disregarding my lawful authorization and delaying necessary corrections to my credit report. Such actions have magnified the harm caused by the herein-detailed inaccuracies and undermined my rights under the FCRA. 

Failure to address this matter in a timely and lawful manner will result in formal complaints to the 1Attorney General 's office, as well as potential legal action to seek damages for the harm caused.

Enclosed, you will find the following supporting documents for your records and in compliance with your identification requirements : 1. A copy of my FTC Identity Theft Report ( # XXXX ). 


2. A copy of my government-issued ID.

3. Proof of address.

Please direct all correspondence regarding this dispute to my email address at XXXX. I request written confirmation that the requested actions have been completed within 4 days of your receipt of this letter, as required under FCRA 605B. Failure to comply herein constitutes a violation of federal law and will result in escalated legal actions.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. 

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing in response to CFPB Complaint XXXX. As of this date, the claim status is open on the CFPB site. However, Experian sent a response on XXXX stating all information in the report is correct and their investigation was concluded. This appears to be a rather quick investigation given the complaint was filed on XXXX. I am requesting a reinvestigation as well the source used to verify each line item disputed on the report. 

The following is the contents of the attached letter. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Re : Disputing Accuracy of Credit Report Dear Experian, I am writing to formally request a reinvestigation of the below listed items in my credit report that I previously disputed and believe to be inaccurate. I have reviewed the outcome of your initial investigation, but I believe the information remains incorrect or incomplete. The Dispute Results Report ( Report Number is : XXXX, Investigation ID is : 01 ) you provided by email states the following information was found to be correct after your investigation. However, I am simply astounded by the amount of incorrect information found in this document. 

First, let us identify the glaring item of concern your report includes a Social Security number variation of XXXX. I have never been assigned or requested an alternate social security number from the Social Security Administration. I also have not used an alternate social security number with any business entity. 

Your report includes the following addresses associated with my social security number : Address Address identification number Residence Type XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX My correct and current address is included at the top of this letter . I have not resided at or used any of the addresses included in this report for any business purposes. The fact that some of the addresses are similar but include different variations reinforces the inaccuracy of this report. I am disputing all addresses and request that they be removed from this report. 

Each of the Potentially negative items listed on this credit report contains inaccurate information. I am again disputing the correctness of each item listed below. 

Account name Account number Recent balance Date opened Status XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Please reference the following US Code regarding the handling of disputed information found in this credit report and proper course of action by Experian and each furnisher of this information.

According to 15 U.S. Code 1681e - Compliance procedures, ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

Regarding the treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information, according to 15 U.S. Code 1681i - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general If, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation ; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer. 

I am requesting an explanation of the reasonable method followed by Experian to verify the accuracy of information and the business entity that verified the correctness for each item listed in this correspondence. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
CFPB Complaint against Credit Reporting Agencies Text ( Separate complaint filed with all bureaus : Experian, XXXX, and XXXX ) : What happened ( statement of pertinent facts ) : Consumer Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Social Security Number : XXXX Consumer Date of Birth : Contents of Complaint : This CFPB complaint has been filed to request, pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), that you, the XXXX credit reporting agency , block the fraudulent information appearing on my consumer credit report. This information is the result of identity theft and fraud, and I request this block to be applied within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint. 

The fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of : account XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX account number : XXXX balance of {$590.00}. 

A XXXX account on XX/XX/XXXX account number : XXXX balance {$590.00}. 

A XXXX XXXX XXXX account on XX/XX/XXXX account number : XXXX. 

XXXX XXXX account opened in XXXX account number : XXXX balance {$70.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX  account number : XXXX date opened on XX/XX/XXXX A XXXX account number : XXXX XXXX opened on XX/XX/XXXX balance of : {$560.00} An account Creditor Name is : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXs Collection account number : XXXX opened on XX/XX/XXXX balance of : {$590.00} A XXXX XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX balance of : {$590.00} A XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX A XXXX XXXX XXXX account number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX balance of : {$1200.00} A XXXX account number : XXXX opened XX/XX/XXXX balance of {$590.00} A list of unauthorized inquiries on the credit report : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX date requested requested XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX date requested on XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX date requested on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX via XXXX requested on XX/XX/XXXX These accounts have resulted in several fraudulent hard inquiries and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. 

I have attached a list of the hard inquiries in question, as well as a copy of the consumer FICO credit report maintained by you, which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items. I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, or hard inquiries as being mine. These fraudulent accounts, collections, and hard inquiries appearing on my consumer credit report maintained by you were not opened, made, or initiated by me. 

All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. I have attached a copy of the FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint ( # private case number ) as proof from the U.S. Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute several negative accounts on my credit report, as I believe these accounts are the result of identity theft. I have recently discovered unauthorized transactions and accounts opened in my name that I did not initiate. This fraudulent activity has caused significant harm to my credit history and financial well-being. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this dispute and provide me with a timeline for the resolution process. You can contact me at the provided phone number or email address if you require any additional information.

I urge the immediate removal of this account under the specified regulations unless verifiable evidence is provided to confirm its authenticity. Delaying action only adds to the frustration caused by the failure to adhere to regulatory standards and ensure fairness and accuracy.
