Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX [ Your Address ] [ City, State, ZIP Code ] [ Date ] XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX XXXX : Dispute of 30-Day Late Payment Reporting for XX/XX/year> To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of a 30-day late payment for XX/XX/year>, as furnished by XXXX XXXX XXXX to Equifax and XXXX. This dispute is made in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related regulations, which require furnishers of information to provide timely and accurate notice to consumers regarding negative information. 

Violation of Notice Requirements Pursuant to Section 623 of the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ) and 12 C.F.R. 1022.7, a financial institution must provide notice to the consumer no later than 30 days after furnishing negative information to a credit reporting agency ( CRA ). Specifically : After providing the initial notice, the institution is not required to send additional notices if subsequent negative information is reported about the same account or transaction. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to comply with this requirement. I did not receive proper notice within 30 days of the negative information being furnished to Equifax and XXXX. This failure to follow federal law has resulted in inaccurate and unfair reporting on my consumer credit file. 

Request for Immediate Action I demand that XXXX XXXX XXXX : 1. Remove the 30-day late payment for XX/XX/year> from Equifax and XXXX. 
2. Provide evidence that the notice of negative information was sent to me in compliance with 12 C.F.R. 1022.7 and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 7 ).

Failure to comply with this request will result in further action, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and pursuing remedies under the FCRA. 



Conclusion XXXX XXXX XXXX failure to adhere to federal law has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness. I request immediate rectification of this matter to prevent further damage.

Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I obtained this personal loan in XXXX of XXXX. I did not go through XXXX XXXX 's main website. At the time I used XXXX XXXX to apply for the loan. XXXX XXXX was the one that came up. They approved me for a loan and I paid for the loan, no problem up until now. 
I did what most people do, just pay the loan off as normal, making the minimum payment. Despite XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX high interest rates and most of the money going to interest, never had an issue paying on time. I kept up my agreement of the loan. Even in two years time, I have paid a significant amount to this loan. 
Fast forward two years later. What I learned, I probably would have never caught if it weren't for the next chain of events. I applied for a home loan with another institution in XXXX of XXXX. XXXX XXXX does not do home loans I believe. They pulled my credit to see where my debts are. The representative of the bank told me everything was good to go. She did not see this error on my credit report. It was only caught by the underwriter. They saw that the XXXX XXXX loan was not updated since XXXX of XXXX. Of course they questioned it and wanted to know what's going on with this loan and what is the actual amount of the loan. The bank for the home loan used a third-party verification company to verify the loan because it was not updated in over a year. The verification company got a hold of someone at XXXX XXXX, who told them over the phone that my loan was paid in full, closed, and in good standing. But when Iogin to the website, it shows a balance that I owe. 
One thing I want to point out is that XXXX XXXX keeps a banner on their page saying it's upgrading their system. This has been on their site ever since I have gotten this loan. So at least two years and counting. The not reporting the credit bureaus is one thing, but telling a third-party verification company that my account is paid in full is a bit suspicious. It would be one thing if I was close to finish paying off the loan and the system needed time to update, but that's not the case for me. 
I have a copy of the verification companies report they gave to the bank because the bank gave it to me and it says what XXXX XXXX told them via them calling XXXX XXXX 's XXXX ( XXXX ) number.

Consumer complaint narrative:
As per the guidance from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) the documents needed are a picture ID, a bill, and a letter from an advocacy group helping me due to XXXX XXXX debt bondage, which falls under trafficking according to Trafficking-Debt Final Rule 1002.142 ( b ) ( 4 ) -5 -- 1002.142 ( b ) ( 7 ). I have provided my ID along with the Polaris letter signed by other required documents that verifies me. I kindly request that you block this information from my credit report within XXXX business days, pursuant to section 605C of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I have given you my identification as well as the information requested from the list of acceptable items which only 2 are required per the Law. I have provided all needed documentation as well as a victim determination letter according to 1022.142 ( b ) ( 6 ).

To Whom It May Concern, Please consider this letter a formal dispute of the alleged debt pursuant to the FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). I also request verification, validation, and the name and address of the original creditor pursuant to 15 U.S. C. 1692g ( b ). According to, 15 U.S. Code 1681 The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. Under, 15 U.S Code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer reports ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ) any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report und the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the WRITTEN INSTRUCTION of the consumer to whom it relates. I NEVER gave any consumer reporting agency WRITTEN CONSENT to report anything on my consumer report which violates my rights as a federal protected consumer. NO CONSENT IS IDENTITY THEFT. As a consumer I am demanding the deletion of the inquiries listed IMMEDIATELY.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request the deletion of an unverifiable account from my credit report under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. Specifically, this pertains to the account identified as a {$720.00} charge-off with XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX 
After disputing this account with XXXX, their investigation was completed on XX/XX/year>. Following the investigation, XXXX deleted this account from my credit report, as the information could not be verified. If XXXX has removed the account due to its unverifiability, I urge you to take similar action and remove this account from my credit report promptly. 
Under the FCRA, all credit reporting agencies are required to ensure that the information on consumer reports is accurate, complete, and verifiable. Specifically : Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies conduct a reasonable investigation of disputed information.

If the disputed information can not be verified as accurate, Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) requires the credit
reporting agency to delete it from the consumers credit file.

Furthermore, under Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), furnishers of information must not provide information that they know or have reasonable cause to believe is inaccurate. 
Since XXXX has deemed this account unverifiable and deleted it, I expect the same resolution from your agency. If this unverifiable debt is not removed within 30 days from the receipt of this letter, I reserve the right to pursue further legal action under the FCRA. 
Failure to comply with FCRA requirements may subject your organization to statutory damages, actual damages, court costs, and reasonable attorney fees under Section 616 and Section 617 of the FCRA. Additionally, if willful noncompliance is found, I may be entitled to punitive damages.

To ensure a clear record of this request, I have attached the relevant documentation, including confirmation from XXXX regarding the deletion of the account. 
Please confirm in writing that this account has been deleted from my credit report or provide a detailed explanation of your investigation findings. I expect a response within the time frame outlined by the FCRA. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Enclosures : 1. Copy of confirmation from XXXX regarding account deletion 2. Copy of my credit report showing the disputed account ( if applicable ) 3. Any additional supporting documentation

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against Equifax for Inaccurate Credit Reporting and Violation of FCRA Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), I am filing a formal complaint against Equifax for the second time for their failure to accurately report information on my credit report and for violating multiple provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) despite a reinvestigation being initiated. 

Account Details : Creditor : [ XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ] Account Number : XXXX Type : Auto Loan Status : Charged-Off Summary of the Issue : Equifax has failed to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of my credit report after a reinvestigation was initiated, resulting in the following discrepancies : Conflicting Account Status : The account is marked as " Open '' while simultaneously showing a " Charge-Off '' status. 
An account can not be both open and charged off... This account was PREVIOUSLY closed Incorrect Payment History After Charge-Off : The account was " charged off '' in XX/XX/XXXX. 
However, late payments continue to be reported monthly through XX/XX/XXXX, which is inaccurate as no further payments are due or expected after a charge-off. 

Inaccurate Balance Reporting : The Reported Balance is {$5100.00}, while the Highest Balance is incorrectly shown as {$0.00}. 
These inconsistencies reflect improper reporting practices... The previous bal reported was XXXX Failure to Properly Reinvestigate the Dispute : Despite marking the account with the remark " Consumer Disputes- Reinvestigation in Progress, '' Equifax has introduced new reporting errors instead of correcting the previously disputed ones. 

This is FRUSTRATING and currently hurting my score and reliability with other creditors : Why mark the account " Reinvestigation in process '' but updated the account information that does not match the account status and payments?!? 
Equifax is not doing their due diligence and is STALLING. 

Equifax are violating the FCRA 1681e ( b ) : Failure to ensure maximum possible accuracy in reporting consumer information.

FCRA 1681i ( a ) : Failure to conduct a proper reinvestigation of disputed information.

FCRA 1681s-2 ( b ) : Failure of the furnisher to accurately update disputed information after reinvestigation.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request the deletion of an unverifiable account from my credit report under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. Specifically, this pertains to the account identified as a {$720.00} charge-off with XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX 
After disputing this account with XXXX their investigation was completed on XX/XX/2024. Following the investigation, XXXX deleted this account from my credit report, as the information could not be verified. If XXXX has removed the account due to its unverifiability, I urge you to take similar action and remove this account from my credit report promptly. 
Under the FCRA, all credit reporting agencies are required to ensure that the information on consumer reports is accurate, complete, and verifiable. Specifically : Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies conduct a reasonable investigation of disputed information.

If the disputed information can not be verified as accurate, Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) requires the credit reporting agency to delete it from the consumers credit file. 
Furthermore, under Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), furnishers of information must not provide information that they know or have reasonable cause to believe is inaccurate. 
Since XXXX has deemed this account unverifiable and deleted it, I expect the same resolution from your agency. If this unverifiable debt is not removed within 30 days from the receipt of this letter, I reserve the right to pursue further legal action under the FCRA. 
Failure to comply with FCRA requirements may subject your organization to statutory damages, actual damages, court costs, and reasonable attorney fees under Section 616 and Section 617 of the FCRA. Additionally, if willful noncompliance is found, I may be entitled to punitive damages. 
To ensure a clear record of this request, I have attached the relevant documentation, including confirmation from XXXX regarding the deletion of the account. 
Please confirm in writing that this account has been deleted from my credit report or provide a detailed explanation of your investigation findings. I expect a response within the time frame outlined by the FCRA. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Enclosures : 1. Copy of confirmation from XXXX regarding account deletion 2. Copy of my credit report showing the disputed account ( if applicable ) 3. Any additional supporting documentation

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Dispute and Demand for Permanent Removal of Fraudulent Account To Whom It May Concern, I am formally disputing the accuracy and legitimacy of the account listed under XXXX XXXX XXXX which is reflected as a charge-off on my credit report. This account is entirely fraudulent, as I have previously provided comprehensive documentation proving that : 1. The vehicle was never repossessed, as falsely claimed. 
2. The vehicle was stolen and involved in fraudulent activity by third parties associated with the dealership, which has been documented and reported. 
3. I was never informed of any repossession, rebuild, or resale of the vehicle. 

Given the overwhelming evidence, XXXX XXXX XXXX is knowingly perpetuating this fraudulent charge-off by allowing it to remain on my credit report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) guidelines, it is illegal to report false or inaccurate information on a consumers credit file. 

I demand the immediate and permanent removal of this account from my credit report. Failure to do so will leave me no choice but to escalate this matter by filing a formal complaint with the CFPB and pursuing legal action to protect my consumer rights. 

I expect written confirmation of this accounts removal within 15 days of this notice. 
Civil Court Case Number at my Justice of Peace against XXXX XXXX with XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX T exas Attorney General Office : XXXX FTC Report Numbers : XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Equifax^ Formal Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Reporting Account XXXX I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information reported on my credit report regarding the account with XXXX XXXX,  referenced as XXXX The account is listed as a repossession and charge-off, but this information is incorrect due to the fraudulent circumstances surrounding the transaction and the subsequent theft of the vehicle. 
Details of Dispute : Account Holder : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Issue : The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  financed under this account was sold to me under fraudulent circumstances by individuals who later stole the vehicle. These events make the loan terms and subsequent repossession invalid. 
Resolution Requested : I request that this account be investigated and corrected on my credit report to reflect the fraudulent activity and remove any derogatory marks, including the charge-off and repossession. 
Supporting Documentation : I have enclosed the following documents to substantiate my claim : 1. A copy of the police report documenting the fraud and theft. 
2. A copy of the Court Case Number XXXX. Any additional correspondence with XXXX XXXX regarding the dispute. 
I kindly request that your agency investigate this matter promptly and remove this incorrect information from my credit report in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
Please notify me of the results of your investigation in writing. 
This has now been settled in a Justice of Peace Court and will be investigated. 
If additional information is needed to process my dispute, please contact me at XXXX or XXXX I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violation : If the bank reported the fraudulent loan to credit bureaus and failed to correct the information after you disputed it, they may have violated the FCRA. This law requires creditors to ensure the accuracy of information they report and investigate disputes promptly. 
2. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Violation : If the bank failed to properly verify the identity of the applicant or disclose the terms of the loan as required under TILA, they could be in violation. Lenders are responsible for ensuring borrowers identities to prevent unauthorized accounts. 
3. Identity Theft Laws Violation : If the bank was negligent in protecting your personal information or failed to implement sufficient safeguards to prevent identity theft, they could be held accountable under federal or state identity theft laws. 
4. Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) Violation : This law requires financial institutions to protect consumer data. If the bank mishandled your personal information and that led to the fraudulent loan, they may have violated the GLBAs privacy and safeguard provisions. 
5. Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) Violation : If the fraudulent account was used to deny you credit or financial opportunities and the bank failed to properly investigate or take corrective action, they could be in violation of the ECOA. 
6. Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) - Fraudulent Endorsement or Contracts Violation : Under the UCC, financial institutions have a duty to ensure contracts, such as auto loans, are legitimate. If the bank failed to verify the authenticity of the signatures or loan details, they could be held liable. 
7. State Consumer Protection Laws Violation : Most states have consumer protection laws that prohibit unfair or deceptive business practices. If the bank acted negligently or failed to respond appropriately to your claims, they may have violated these laws. 
Possible Bank-Specific Misconduct If the bank failed to investigate adequately, ignored evidence of fraud, or continued collection efforts after you reported the fraudulent loan, they may also have engaged in : Negligence : Failing to take reasonable steps to prevent or address the fraud. 
Bad Faith : Acting in a way that is contrary to fair dealing and honest practices. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX Formal Demand for Resolution of Fraudulent Loan and Resulting Damages To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally demand resolution of a fraudulent and unethical situation involving the vehicle loan associated with my name, XXXX. The actions taken by XXXX XXXX, as outlined below, have caused me significant financial losses, damage to my credit, and emotional distress. The men who opened this loan knew that because of my age and no prior auto loan history that I was the perfect target to fraudulently obtain and maintain an illegal loan. 
Summary of Events : 1. I made a down payment of {$3000.00} and paid $ XXXXmonth for four months on a vehicle that was fraudulently sold to me. 
2. I paid a total of {$920.00} in insurance premiums during this period. 
3. The vehicle was illegally repossessed by the dealership and sold at auction for {$4100.00}, yet XXXX XXXX reported this as a charge-off on my credit report, causing substantial harm for 20 months. 
4. XXXX XXXX  failed to contact me or address the fraudulent activity until I filed a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). 
Impact of XXXX XXXX Actions : Financial Losses : A total of {$6000.00} in payments and expenses. 
Credit Damage : My credit has been negatively impacted for 20 months, leading to financial strain and potential loan denials. 
Emotional Distress : This situation caused undue stress, leading to depressive episodes and significant emotional hardship. 
Demand for Relief : T o resolve this matter and avoid further legal action, I am demanding : 1. Reimbursement of all financial losses totaling {$6000.00}. 
2. Compensation for credit damage in the amount of {$10000.00}, or an appropriate amount based on your valuation. 
3. Compensation for emotional distress in the amount of {$10000.00}. 
4. Removal of the fraudulent loan and charge-off from my credit report. 
All consideration is respected however this matter should be taken seriously before I move forward legally. 
Response Deadline : I expect a written response to this letter, including your proposed resolution, no later than XX/XX/XXXX If I do not receive an acceptable response, I will have no choice but to escalate this matter further through legal action, filing complaints with regulatory agencies, or both. 
Conclusion : This matter is urgent and has caused significant hardship. I trust that XXXX XXXX will act in good faith to resolve it promptly. 
Dear XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I am contacting you regarding a fraudulent auto loan in my name connected to a XXXX XXXX vehicle. After discovering this account on my credit report, I investigated and uncovered significant evidence indicating that this loan was opened fraudulently without my knowledge or consent. 
Background of the Fraud : On XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased a XXXX XXXX through a third-party dealership in XXXX, Texas, operated by XXXX XXXX . 
In XX/XX/XXXX, the vehicle was unlawfully taken under the pretense of repair and never returned. 
On XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered that XXXX XXXX XXXX reported the loan as charged-off, claiming the vehicle had been repossessed, rebuilt, and resold. This is untrue, as the vehicle was stolen, and I was never notified of any repossession or sale. 
Action Taken : I have already reported this matter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and have sent a demand letter requesting resolution & monetary relief. Evidence strongly suggests that fraudulent activity between XXXX XXXX, the dealership, and possibly your company facilitated the creation of this account and illegally ran it as a charge off for 20 months without contacting me. There is no proof of communication to me at this time for which my landlord at this address stated he never received ant letters from XXXX XXXX. 
Request for Immediate Action : I am requesting that XXXX XXXX XXXX 1. Remove the fraudulent account from my credit report immediately. 
2. Issue written confirmation that I bear no liability for this loan. 
3. Provide any documentation your company has related to the origination and handling of this account. ( For my purposes ) If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will have no choice but to escalate legal action. Evidence of fraud will support my case, including any negligence or willful misconduct by your company in approving this loan without verifying my consent. 
Please consider this email an urgent notice of dispute under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and respond no later than XX/XX/XXXX. I can be reached at XXXX or XXXX should you require additional information. 
I look forward to your prompt response. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX All documentation is for your records proving my claim that this is fraud. I am still seeking monetary relief from XXXX XXXX for my financial losses emotional distress and credit damage before I take legal action. I will be forwarding this email to a lawyer of mine who has been informed of illegal activities at hand. Thank you

Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation ; and ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against Equifax for failing to comply with federal laws governing the handling of disputes under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related consumer protection statutes. Equifax has refused to properly investigate or remove fraudulent accounts reported to FTC Identify Theft on my credit file, causing significant harm and violating my rights. 

Background : On XX/XX/XXXX, Equifax informed me that XXXX of the fraudulent accounts I reported on XX/XX/XXXX to the FTC Identity Theft as fraud accounts were " verified '' per the debt collector, despite being flagged as fraudulent. This response came after 32 days of delay, resulting in an inconclusive decision and allowing the fraudulent accounts to remain on my credit report. 

CRAs Failure to Comply : Despite my clear and lawful dispute, Equifax either failed to perform an adequate investigation or improperly verified the accounts with the original creditors/debtors without validating their legitimacy. This constitutes a violation of my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), which requires Equifax to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information and delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable items. 

Harm Caused : The continued reporting of these fraudulent accounts is negatively impacting my credit score and financial well-being. Additionally, I have spent considerable time and resources attempting to correct this issue, only to encounter further delays and noncompliance by Equifax. 

Laws Violated : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) : Equifax failed to meet its obligation to reasonably investigate my dispute under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ). Equifax continued to report unverifiable and fraudulent information, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which mandates accurate reporting. Equifax willful noncompliance with its obligations constitutes a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681n, which provides for civil liability for willful violations, including damages, attorneys fees, and punitive damages.

Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ) : Equifax improperly relied on a creditor or debt collectors unverified claims without ensuring the accuracy of the account, potentially facilitating abusive debt collection practices. This constitutes a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1692k, which provides for civil liability for violations, including actual damages, statutory damages, and attorneys fees.

Consumer complaint narrative:
" I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding unauthorized accounts that persist on my credit report despite my repeated efforts to have them removed. These accounts are causing significant damage to my financial reputation and overall well-being. It is evident that the inclusion of these fraudulent items violates 15 USC 1681b regarding permissible purposes, as the credit bureaus have no legitimate reason to report them without my explicit consent. Please refer to the attached file detailing these items I am disputing. 
The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence, which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. So whenever there is a violation under the FCRA, it impairs the efficiency of the banking system. This is a violation of my privacy with my consumer report, since I control what is listed and what is not. In the event that any accounts are reported without my written consent, that is considered identity theft. ''

Consumer complaint narrative:
equifax is in clear violation of the law. Under 15 USC 1681 of consumer reports, THE LAW CLEARLY STATES : ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 1 ) In response to the order of a court having jurisdiction to issue such an order, a subpoena issued in connection with proceedings before a Federal grand jury, or a subpoena issued in accordance with section 5318 of title 31 or section 3486 of title 18.

( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

Did I give you written instructions to furnish this on my credit report???

Furthermore, the FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT 15 USC 1681 ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) Exclusions from a consumer credit report clearly states : ( 2 ) EXCLUSIONS- except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ). The term consumer report does not include- ( A ) Subject to section 1681s-3 of this title, any- ( i ) Report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumers and the person making the report. 
Transaction : In business law, a transaction is an event associated with business dealings conducted between two or more parties that involve the formation and performance of an obligation or contract.

THE LAW CLEARLY STATES : Transactions or experiences between the consumer ( me ) and the person making the report is NOT INCLUDED ON MY CONSUMER REPORT.

Delete the above late payment from my consumer report, this agency is in violation of 15 USC 1681. 

The reporting of this account violates multiple provisions under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other consumer protection laws, including but not limited to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am formally disputing the reported late payment on my account, as I believe this information to be inaccurate. The FCRA mandates that all data furnished to credit reporting agencies must meet stringent standards of accuracy and verifiability. 

I respectfully request that the creditor or data furnisher conduct a thorough investigation into this matter and provide concrete evidence substantiating the claim of a late payment. In the absence of such verifiable evidence, I urge that the disputed information be promptly corrected or removed from my credit report in compliance with the provisions of the FCRA. 

This issue is of significant concern, as inaccurate reporting has far-reaching implications on creditworthiness, and I trust that due diligence will be exercised to ensure adherence to the law.

Consumer complaint narrative: XXXX XXXX - late payments XXXX XXXX XXXX - late payments XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Validation of a Debt Request Pursuant to 15 USC 1692gb, Cease and Desist Pursaunt 15 USC 1692 ( C ) ( c ) I recently received communication from you attempting to collect the above-listed alleged debt. Your initial communication to me in attempt to collect the alleged debt was within 30 days ago. Please be advised that I hereby dispute the validity of the alleged debt listed above in its entirety. Further, I request verification of the alleged debt, specifically, a copy of a contract or agreement. Said contract or agreement must be with the original creditor and signed by all parties involved. You are illegally attempting to collect the above-listed alleged debt and money that I do not owe. Cease and desist all collection activity, including all reporting to consumer reporting agencies. Promptly request deletion of any and all prior reporting made to any consumer reporting agencies. If you comply with my requests above within 14 days, then you are excused from verification. Further more pursuant 15 USC 1692 ( e ) ( 3 ) False or misleading representations A debt collector may not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representation or means in connection with the collection of any debt. Without limiting the general application of the foregoing, the following conduct is a violation of this section : The false representation or implication that any individual is an attorney or that any communication is from an attorney. You XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX have no right under the law to send me any type of communication what so ever. Cease and Desist all communication immediately. Further More You XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Are attempting to collect an alleged debt where the so called original creditor has falsely represent the character other Violations under 15 USC 1692 e that you are implementing your self. Violation : 15 USC 1692b ( 5 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 2 ) ( A ) 15 USC 1692e ( 3 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 6 ) ( B ) 15 USC 1692 ( 9 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 10 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 11 ) This letter is CCed to the Bureau of Consumer Protection Finance as evidence may be provided to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). The CFPB is authorized to investigate this fully matter and receive any related information herein. Be advised, if you fail to comply with this demand letter, I may turn the matter over to an attorney ). Note I am a very litigious consumer, and I will proceed with legal action for all my consumer rights violations under this subchapter plus all remedies and actual damages as a result of your failure pursuant 15 USC 1692K. If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following Declaration, I will require at least 30 days to investigate this information, during which time all collection activity shall CEASE and Desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of information to a credit reporting repository/ agency that could be inaccurate or invalidated. If your office fails to respond to this validation request within 10 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my consumer report, and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. Was this debt assigned to a debt collector or purchased? ____ No ____Yes 9. Amount Paid if debt was purchased : 10. Commission for debt if collection efforts are successful : Please attach copies of the following : Agreement with your client that grants COLLECTION COMPANY NAME the authority to collect this alleged debt. Signed agreement Debtor has made with XXXX Collector, or other verifiable proof Debtor has a contractual obligation to pay Debt collector. Any agreement that bears the signature of Debtor, wherein agreed to pay Creditor. All statements while this account was open. Have any insurance claims been made by any creditor regarding this account? o Yes o No Have any Judgements been obtained by any creditor regarding this account? o Yes o No Please provide me the name and address of the bonding agent for COLLECTION COMPANY NAME, in case legal action becomes necessary : Date : ________________ _________________________ Authorized Signature of Creditor You must return this completed form along with copies of all requested information, assignments or other transfer agreements, which would establish your right to collect this alleged debt within 30 calendar days from the date of receipt of this letter. Your Claim can not and WILL NOT be considered if any portion of this form is not completed and returned with copies of all requested documents. This is a request for Validation made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Please allow 30 calendar days for processing after I receive this information. Thank You. cc : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau via fax XXXX cc : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX

PLEASE DELETE OFF MY REPORT I respectfully request your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. You contacted me by mail, on and identified the alleged debt as being the original creditor. Please supply the information below so that I can be fully informed : Why you think I owe the debt and to whom I owe it, including : The name and address of the creditor to whom the debt is currently owed, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed. 
If this debt started with a different creditor, provide the name and address of the original creditor, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed to that creditor at the time it was transferred. When you identify the original creditor, please provide any other name by which I might know them, if that is different from the official name. In addition, tell me when the current creditor obtained the debt and who the current creditor obtained it from. 
Provide verification and documentation that there is a valid basis for claiming that I am required to pay the debt to the current creditor. For example, can you provide a copy of the written agreement that created my original requirement to pay? 
If you are asking that I pay a debt that somebody else is or was required to pay, identify that person. Provide verification and documentation about why this is a debt that I am required to pay. The amount and age of the debt, including : A copy of the last billing statement sent to me by the original creditor. 
State the amount of the debt when you obtained it, and when that was. 
If there have been any additional interest, fees or charges added since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each added amount. In addition, explain how the added interest, fees or other charges are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or are permitted by law. 
If there have been any payments or other reductions since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each of them If there have been any other changes or adjustments since the last billing statement from the original creditor, please provide full verification and documentation of the amount you are trying to collect. Explain how that amount was calculated. In addition, explain how the other changes or adjustments are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law. 
Tell me when the creditor claims this debt became due and when it became delinquent. 
Identify the date of the last payment made on this account. 
Have you made a determination that this debt is within the statute of limitations applicable to it? Tell me when you think the statute of limitations expires for this debt, and how you determined that. Details about your authority to collect this debt. 
I would like more information about your firm before I discuss the debt with you. Does your firm have a debt collection license from my state? If not, say why not. If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 
If you are contacting me from a place outside my state, does your firm have a debt collection license from that place? If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 
I have asked for this information because I have some questions. I need to hear from you to make an informed decision about your claim that I owe this money. I am open to communicating with you for this purpose. In order to make sure that I am not put at any disadvantage, in the meantime please treat this debt as being in dispute and under discussion between us. 
PROVIDE ME WITH THE FOLLOWING AS WELL : 1. FULL DISCLOSURE I WAS NOT TOLD THAT YOU WERE ACTUALLY CREATING THE CREDIT WITH MY WET INK SIGNATURE 2. EQUAL CONSIDERATION THEY BROUGHT NOTHING OF VALUE TO THE TABLE AND HAS NOTHING TO LOSE 3. LAWFUL TERMS AND CONDITIONS BECAUSE YOURS WERE BASED ON FRAUD 4. THE WET INK SIGNATURES OF BOTH PARTIES I AM WRITING TO INFORM YOU THAT IM NOT IN DISPUTE WITH ANYTHING BUT I DEMAND THE FOLLOWING LISTED ABOVE BE PROVIDED IN ORDER FOR ME TO BE ABLE TO MAKE PAYMENT.

PLEASE RESPOND BACK WITHIN 10 DAYS OF THIS CERTIFIED LETTER.

IF YOU DO NOT RESPOND I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT TO BE FULLY DISCHARGED AND I WILL NEED IT IN WRITING SINCE YOU DID NOT RESPOND BY THE STATED ABOVE TERMS TO PROVIDE THE NECCESSARY EVIDENCE OF A LAWFUL DEBT WITHIN THE REASONABLE PERIOD OF TIME PROVIDE, I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT IS FULLY DISCHARDED. 
WITHOUT PREJUDICE XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: My credit report has certain accounts that I'm not familiar with. Since I never gave them permission, they could be the product of identity theft. Having previously discussed this with you, I'm writing to request that these accounts be promptly deleted from my report in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates that credit bureaus rectify erroneous information on consumer credit reports. These accounts have caused me stress because they are on my report. It's been difficult to deal with the impact because they don't represent my financial responsibility or credit history. I'm ready to take legal action to protect my rights and find a solution under the FCRA if we can't work this out. The inaccurate items that appear on my credit report have been a big obstacle for me. They're getting in the way of my important financial goals, like buying a house and taking care of my family. I hope we can resolve this issue quickly.

Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
[ XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] [ XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] [ XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ XXXX ] [ XXXX ] Equifax Inc. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Formal Complaint and Demand for Compensation for FCRA and FTC Violations COMPLIANCE DEPT. 

I am writing to address Equifaxs ongoing and egregious failures in handling my credit file disputes, which have escalated into a pattern of alarming and malicious inconsistencies. Equifaxs refusal to investigate and resolve the inaccuracies in my credit report has caused significant harm to my credit standing and violated multiple provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) regulations. 

Background and Timeline On XX/XX/year>, I initiated an FTC identity theft report and placed a fraud alert on my credit file following the discovery of fraudulent activity, including the use of a false name ( XXXX XXXX ) and an incorrect address ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). These inaccuracies are tied to a fraudulent XXXX XXXX tradeline, which has already been successfully disputed and cleared with both XXXX XXXX and the collection agency XXXX XXXX. 

Since then, I have provided Equifax with extensive, verifiable documentation to confirm my legal name ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ), my current address ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ), and my employment at XXXX and XXXX XXXX. This documentation includes : A lease agreement in XXXX  form. 
Both short-form and long-form birth certificates.

A W-2 form with my full Social Security Number.

A paycheck stub from my employer, XXXX. 
My marriage certificate. 

Despite accepting and processing this same information, XXXX and XXXX have updated my credit file without issue. However, Equifax has maliciously refused to make these corrections. 

Alarmingly Inconsistent Correspondence Between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/year>, I received XXXX pieces of correspondence from Equifax. These letters demonstrate a disturbing lack of consistency, which appears intentional and malicious : 1. In some letters, Equifax states that it is unable to locate my credit file, despite the fact that other correspondence acknowledges my dispute.

2. Other letters claim that the dispute I initiated through a Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) complaint is frivolous, without providing any evidence or explanation to support this determination. 
XXXX. Additional letters state that Equifax is unable to verify my identity, despite having received the same documents that XXXX and XXXX used to resolve my disputes. 

This blatant inconsistency in Equifaxs communication not only undermines the credibility of its dispute resolution process but also highlights Equifaxs refusal to take my case seriously.

Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Equifaxs actions constitute clear violations of the FCRA, including but not limited to : 1. Failure to Conduct a Reasonable Investigation ( 1681i ( a ) ) : Equifax has failed to conduct a proper investigation into my disputes, as evidenced by contradictory responses and its refusal to act on clear documentation.

2. Failure to Correct or Delete Inaccurate Information ( 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ) : Despite receiving verifiable proof, Equifax has not corrected the false name, address, or fraudulent tradeline in my credit file.

3. Failure to Notify Data Furnishers of My Dispute ( 1681i ( a ) ( 2 ) ) : Equifax is required to notify the original data furnishers of my disputes. Its failure to do so has allowed fraudulent information to persist on my file.

4. Deeming Legitimate Disputes as Frivolous ( 1681i ( a ) ( 3 ) ) : Equifax improperly labeled my dispute, initiated through the CFPB, as frivolous, in direct violation of the FCRAs requirements to assess disputes in good fait

h. 5. Failure to Provide Results or Verification ( 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) - ( 7 ) ) : Equifax has not provided clear or consistent results of its investigation or the methods it used to verify the inaccurate information on my credit report. 6. Failure to Honor Fraud Alerts ( 1681c-1 ) : Equifax has disregarded the fraud alert initiated on XX/XX/year>, failing to take the necessary precautions to protect my credit file from further misuse. 

Violations of FTC Guidelines Equifax has also failed to comply with FTC regulations, particularly the FTC Safeguards Rule, which requires credit reporting agencies to protect consumer data and ensure the accuracy of credit files. By rejecting legitimate documentation and mishandling my disputes, Equifax has neglected its duty to safeguard my information and provide a reliable resolution process.

Harm Caused by Equifaxs Negligence Equifaxs negligence and malicious actions have caused substantial harm, including : 1. Degradation of My Credit File : The presence of fraudulent and inaccurate information has negatively impacted my credit score, limiting my ability to obtain credit and pursue personal and business opportunities. 2. Emotional Distress : The contradictory an
d dismissive correspondence from Equifax has caused unnecessary stress and frustration.

3. Interference with Employment and Business Pursuits : The inaccurate information has hindered my ability to maintain financial stability and expand my business activities with XXXX XXXX. 

Demands for Resolution To address this matter, I demand the following actions from Equifax : 1. Immediate correction of my name and address to reflect XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 
2. Removal of the fraudulent XXXX XXXX tradeline and all associated inaccuracies from my credit file.

3. A detailed explanation of the investigation process and the reasons behind the contradictory correspondence I received.

4. Compensation for damages caused by Equifaxs negligence, including financial harm, emotional distress, and lost time.

5. Assurance that Equifax will comply with all applicable FCRA and FTC regulations in handling my credit file moving forward. 

Legal Consequences If Equifax fails to resolve these issues within 14 days, I will escalate this matter by filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my states Attorney Generals office. Additionally, I will pursue litigation to recover damages caused by Equifaxs blatant disregard for its legal obligations under the FCRA.

I trust that Equifax will take this matter seriously and respond promptly. Please contact me at [ your phone number ] or [ your email address ] to confirm receipt of this letter and provide updates on the resolution process. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX XXXX XXXX ]

Consumer complaint narrative:
Under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) subject to subsection ( f ) and except as provided in subsection ( g ), If the completeness or accuracy of any item of information contained in a consumer 's file at a consumer reporting agency is disputed by the consumer and the consumer notifies the agency directly or indirectly through a reseller, of such dispute, the agency shall, free of charge, conduct a reasonable reinvestigation to determine whether the disputed information is inaccurate and record the current status of the disputed information, or delete the item from the file in accordance with paragraph ( 5 ), before the end of the 30-day period beginning on the date on which the agency receives the notice of the dispute from the consumer or reseller.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This CFPB complaint has been filed to request pursuant to FCRA 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) that you, the credit reporting agency, block information appearing on my consumer credit report that is the result of identity theft and fraud within 4 business days of you receiving this complaint. This fraudulent, inaccurate, and false information consists of an account opened with XXXX XXXX XXXX on XX/XX/XXXX under account number XXXX with a charge off balance of {$290.00}, and an closed account with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX on XX/XX/XXXX. These accounts have resulted in several fraudulent hard inquiries and fraudulent collections appearing on my consumer FICO credit report. I've attached a list of the hard inquiries in question as well as a copy of the consumer FICO credit report maintained by you which shows the aforementioned fraudulent items.

I do not recognize the aforementioned accounts, collections, or hard inquiries as reported. The aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries appearing on my FICO consumer credit report maintained by you were not opened, made, or initiated by me. All of the aforementioned accounts, collections, and hard inquiries are the result of identity theft and fraud. I have attached a copy of FTC identity Theft Criminal Complaint # XXXX as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that all of the aforementioned consumer credit accounts, collections, and hard Inquires are the result or identity theft and fraud.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently, I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 
Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency generates a consumer report, it must follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information related to the individual to whom the report pertains.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, following a reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any disputed information by a consumer, an item is determined to be inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable, the consumer reporting agency must ( i ) promptly delete the disputed item from the consumer 's file, or appropriately modify the information based on the reinvestigation results; and ( ii ) promptly inform the furnisher of the information that the item has been modified or deleted from the consumer 's file. 
Please remove the following items from my credit report immediately : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as a formal notice under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), requiring you to cease all communication with me regarding the alleged debt associated with the account. In the amount of {$820.00} As stated under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), once you receive this written notice, you are legally obligated to stop all communication with me concerning this matter, except to : Notify me that your further collection efforts have been terminated ; Inform me of any specified remedies that may be invoked by you or the original creditor ; or Notify me of your intent to invoke a specified remedy. 
Furthermore, I am formally notifying you that I consider any updates to my credit report as a form of indirect communication regarding this account. If you continue to report, update, or otherwise communicate through credit reporting agencies, I will consider this a violation of the FDCPA. 

If this account is in dispute, I reserve the right to validate or challenge its accuracy, and I expect all collection activity to be suspended as per applicable laws. Any further communication with me outside the outlined exceptions or continued reporting on my credit report will result in formal complaints filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and legal action if necessary. 

Please confirm in writing within 14 days of receiving this letter that you have complied with my request to cease all communication and activity related to this account. 

You may only contact me to provide the requested confirmation or if legally required to inform me of one of the exceptions noted above. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Good day! 
I am reaching out regarding several concerning accounts in my credit report that require investigation for a lawful resolution. Upon review, I identified inaccuracies and inconsistencies that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The violations I have noted include : Violation of Timely Payments Regulations Violation of Finance Charge Determination Violation of United States Code Law ( TILA 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( b ) billing error ) I request that you provide proper evidence showing that I was late on this account, in compliance with Section 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) Ai, 15 USC 1666b, and 1637 ( b ). If you can not supply the required evidence, you can not deem payment as late, which constitutes a violation of Section 15 USC 1681s-2. Please update the account as " PAID '' or " PAID AS AGREED. '' Additionally, I am filing this complaint due to the multiple inaccuracies in my report, which have negatively impacted my ability to secure credit. The violations that need prompt attention are : FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance FCRA Section 603 ( 4 ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms Violation of Credit Report Permissible Purposes Privacy Act violations U.S.C 552a ( g ) ( 1 ) ( A ) USC 1692e I demand verifiable proof, specifically the original consumer contract with my signature, for the accounts listed. Under the FCRA, unverified accounts must be removed if you can not provide this proof. Therefore, I insist that the accounts be VERIFIED or REMOVED immediately.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Recently I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. As well as several items shared without my written permission.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

15 U.S. Code 1681b ( a ) Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

Sub-issue: Old information reappears or never goes away
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to dispute the charge-off account from XXXX reported on my credit file, in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. The account information is as follows : Account Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date of Charge-Off : XXXX XXXX  I dispute this account because XXXX never sent me a XXXX form, which is required by the IRS to report canceled debt. When I requested a XXXX form from XXXX, they stated that they do not send them out. I believe this is a violation of IRS regulations and the FCRA, which requires that credit bureaus ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information reported. This account was charged off on the following date XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX. Since then, the account has repeatedly been updated as a charge-off every month. This is an update on the payment history. A charged-off account should NOT include an active payment history. This inaccurate information falsely manipulates the statute of limitations. You failed to investigate this account properly and your neglect has violated my rights. I am demanding a deletion of the following account : XXXX Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), I request that you investigate this dispute and remove the charge-off account from my credit file, as it is inaccurate and incomplete.

Please provide me with a corrected copy of my credit report, as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ). 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Good day! 
I am reaching out regarding several concerning accounts in my credit report that require investigation for a lawful resolution. Upon review, I identified inaccuracies and inconsistencies that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The violations I have noted include : Violation of Timely Payments Regulations Violation of Finance Charge Determination Violation of United States Code Law ( TILA 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( b ) billing error ) I request that you provide proper evidence showing that I was late on this account, in compliance with Section 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) Ai, 15 USC 1666b, and 1637 ( b ). If you can not supply the required evidence, you can not deem payment as late, which constitutes a violation of Section 15 USC 1681s-2. Please update the account as " PAID '' or " PAID AS AGREED. '' Additionally, I am filing this complaint due to the multiple inaccuracies in my report, which have negatively impacted my ability to secure credit. The violations that need prompt attention are : FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance FCRA Section 603 ( 4 ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms Violation of Credit Report Permissible Purposes Privacy Act violations U.S.C 552a ( g ) ( 1 ) ( A ) USC 1692e I demand verifiable proof, specifically the original consumer contract with my signature, for the accounts listed. Under the FCRA, unverified accounts must be removed if you can not provide this proof. Therefore, I insist that the accounts be VERIFIED or REMOVED immediately.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Date : XX/XX/year> Subject : Complaint Against XXXX XXXX XXXX for Non-Response to Rescission of Signature To Whom It May Concern, I am filing this formal complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding their failure to respond to my rescission of signature notice within the legally required timeframe under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) and associated federal regulations. 

Background Information 1. Rescission of Signature Submission : XXXX OF XXXXsubmitted a Rescission of Signature to XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding a contract associated with my account [ Account Number or Reference ]. This rescission was tendered under my rights outlined in the Truth in Lending Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1635 ) and Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC 2-207, 3-603, and 3-306 ) due to the discovery of itemizations and contractual irregularities. 


XXXX. XXXX Non-Response Period : Under federal law, XXXX XXXX XXXX was required to respond to my rescission within 20 calendar days of receipt, either acknowledging the rescission or providing a written explanation rejecting the rescission along with supporting legal justification. To date, no response has been received. 



Complaint Details 1. Failure to Respond : XXXX XXXX XXXX has failed to provide any acknowledgment, acceptance, or rejection of my rescission of signature within the required timeframe. This constitutes a violation of the Truth in Lending Act and potentially other federal regulations governing consumer credit transactions. 


XXXX. Request for Notice of Non-Response : As part of this complaint, I am providing a Notice of Non-Response to XXXX XXXX XXXX, effectively declaring the contract void and unenforceable unless XXXX XXXX XXXX can provide evidence of their response to my rescission of signature within the legally required timeframe. 


XXXX. Request for Documentation : I formally request that XXXX XXXX XXXX provide written documentation detailing : Their response to my rescission of signature, if any. 

The specific legal basis, statutes, or terms that justify their response ( or lack thereof ). 




Resolution Requested I am seeking the following resolutions through this complaint : 1. A full and detailed response from XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding their failure to address my rescission of signature within 20 days. 


XXXX. A declaration that the contract is void and unenforceable due to their non-response, in accordance with applicable federal laws. 


XXXX. Compensation for any damages or adverse actions resulting from their failure to comply with the statutory requirements of the Truth in Lending Act. 



Supporting Documentation I have included the following documents with this complaint : A copy of the original rescission of signature letter submitted to XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Proof of delivery showing the date XXXX XXXX XXXX received the rescission. 

Copies of any related correspondence or communications with XXXX XXXX XXXX. 


Conclusion This complaint is submitted in good faith and with the expectation that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will investigate this matter and ensure that XXXX XXXX XXXX complies with federal law. I respectfully request timely acknowledgment of this complaint and a response outlining the next steps in this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Identity Theft Dispute Pursuant to FCRA 605B To Whom It May Concern, This letter serves as a formal demand to rectify and suppress all fraudulent and unauthorized information on my credit report, as detailed herein and pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 605B. I demand immediate action to address the aforementioned inaccuracies. Your compliance is expected to prevent further harm and uphold your obligations under federal law. 

Pursuant to FCRA 605B, you are legally required to block all fraudulent accounts and remove unauthorized inquiries within 4 days of receiving this dispute and the herein-mentioned documentation. 

As previously referenced, I was a victim of the XXXX data breach, one of the largest breaches in history, which compromised the personal information of millions of individuals, including sensitive data such as Social Security numbers and financial records. This breach most definitely played a critical role in the unauthorized access and misuse of my personal information, resulting in the fraudulent accounts and inquiries outlined below. 

Fraudulent Accounts ( I dispute the following ) : XXXX : Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Amount : {$1200.00} XXXX XXXX : Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Amount : {$560.00} XXXX XXXX XXXX  : Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Amount : {$0.00} XXXX : Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Amount : {$590.00} XXXX  XXXX XXXX : Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Amount : {$640.00} Unrelated Unauthorized Inquiries ( I dispute the following ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX : Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : Date of Inquiry : XX/XX/XXXX The harm caused by these unrecognized and unauthorized accounts and inquiries has been significant, severely damaging my creditworthiness, financial stability, and mental well-being. These inaccuracies have magnified the financial and emotional toll on my family as we recover from a natural disaster. A strong storm hit our area on a rainy day, causing the roof of our home to rupture and sustain significant damage. As a result, rainwater poured into the house, damaging the structure, our belongings, and essential property. The aforementioned fraudulent accounts and inquiries have further delayed my ability to rebuild stability and provide for my family. 

It is also critical to note that, in my efforts to resolve these inaccuracies, I hired multiple reputable credit repair companies, fully authorized to act on my behalf as permitted by law. Despite this, the credit bureaus employed various cunning and obstructive methods to stall their work, disregarding my lawful authorization and delaying necessary corrections to my credit report. Such actions have magnified the harm caused by the herein-detailed inaccuracies and undermined my rights under the FCRA. 

Failure to address this matter in a timely and lawful manner will result in formal complaints to the 1Attorney General 's office, as well as potential legal action to seek damages for the harm caused. 

Enclosed, you will find the following supporting documents for your records and in compliance with your identification requirements : 1. A copy of my FTC Identity Theft Report ( # XXXX ). 


2. A copy of my government-issued ID.

3. Proof of address. 



Please direct all correspondence regarding this dispute to my email address at XXXX. I request written confirmation that the requested actions have been completed within 4 days of your receipt of this letter, as required under FCRA 605B. Failure to comply herein constitutes a violation of federal law and will result in escalated legal actions. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as a formal notice under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), requiring you to cease all communication with me regarding the alleged debt associated with the account. In the amount of {$1100.00} As stated under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), once you receive this written notice, you are legally obligated to stop all communication with me concerning this matter, except to : Notify me that your further collection efforts have been terminated ; Inform me of any specified remedies that may be invoked by you or the original creditor ; or Notify me of your intent to invoke a specified remedy. 
Furthermore, I am formally notifying you that I consider any updates to my credit report as a form of indirect communication regarding this account. If you continue to report, update, or otherwise communicate through credit reporting agencies, I will consider this a violation of the FDCPA. 

If this account is in dispute, I reserve the right to validate or challenge its accuracy, and I expect all collection activity to be suspended as per applicable laws. Any further communication with me outside the outlined exceptions or continued reporting on my credit report will result in formal complaints filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and legal action if necessary. 

Please confirm in writing within 14 days of receiving this letter that you have complied with my request to cease all communication and activity related to this account. 

You may only contact me to provide the requested confirmation or if legally required to inform me of one of the exceptions noted above. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Discover Bank, I am writing to request that you remove the paid charged-off account associated with my name, XXXX XXXX XXXX and social security number XXXX from all three major credit reporting agencies XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Since the account number is unknown/unavailable, I request that you use my social security number and name to identify the account. 


As you are aware, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) requires that credit reporting agencies maintain accurate and complete information on consumers ' credit reports ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ). Furthermore, the FCRA states that credit reporting agencies must remove information that is no longer accurate or complete ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ). Additionally, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has issued guidance stating that credit reporting agencies should remove paid charged-off accounts from consumers ' credit reports ( CFPB Bulletin XXXX XXXX. This guidance is consistent with the FCRA 's requirement that credit reporting agencies maintain accurate and complete information. Moreover, the FCRA also requires that furnishers of credit information, such as Discover Bank, ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information furnished to credit reporting agencies ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ). As the furnisher of the credit information , Discover Bank has a responsibility to correct and update the information to reflect the payment of the charged-off account. In addition, the Credit Card Accountability Responsibility and Disclosure ( CARD ) Act of 2009 requires that creditors, such as Discover Bank, provide accurate and complete information to credit reporting agencies ( 15 U.S.C. 1666c ). The CARD Act also prohibits creditors from furnishing information to credit reporting agencies that is inaccurate or incomplete. Furthermore, the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) has stated that the removal of paid charged-off accounts from credit reports is a best practice for credit reporting agencies ( FTC Staff Report, " 40 Years of Experience with the Fair Credit Reporting Act '' ). The FTC has also emphasized the importance of accurate and complete information on credit reports ( FTC, " A Guide for Consumers : How to Dispute Credit Report Errors '' ). 


In my case, the charged-off account was paid in full on XX/XX/XXXX. Despite this, the account remains on my credit reports. 


I request that you take immediate action to remove this account from all three credit reporting agencies. As the furnisher of the credit information , Discover Bank has a responsibility to correct and update the information to reflect the payment of the charged-off account. 


I would appreciate it if you could provide me with written confirmation of the removal within 30 days. 


Sincerely, XXXX XXXX
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Issue: Problem with a purchase shown on your statement
Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, someone bought over {$3000.00} worth of goods from XXXX XXXX using my Direct Express debit card. The card was not lost or stolen. No one has my numbers or pin. 
I cancelled card immediately and called XXXX XXXX. They said the purchases were from a store in XXXX Alabama. ( I live in XXXX UTAH -- XXXX miles from XXXX. ) They could do nothing because the transaction ID numbers for the purchase that showed up on my Direct Express card had only XXXX digits. Their store needed XXXX. They can empty money out of my account with no question but can't help me because the numbers are wrong? 
Filed formal complaint with Direct Express. Their consumer support is a joke. There is one phone number. One. Period. The robot gives you six choices, none have to do with fraud or claim dispute. Managed to accidentally get a person after 45 minutes. 
Received on letter from them with form for complain. I filled it out and included all relevant pages of my account with DE and Fax 'd it to them the next day. 
Have had one phone call XXXX XXXX saying they had made partial, provisional restitution. Awaiting the 25 to 45 day investigation they will either restore some of the money or take the half they've paid me back. They say they will not communicate with me in any way. All I can do is watch my balance. 
You make one deal with a bank -- they can keep your money and use it, but they can't loose it. They lost it. Their actions are clearly designed to, delay, frustrate, obfuscate, etc in order to cause you to give up. Their procedures are opaque. Their pace glacial. Their intent is clear -- get you out of their hair and take your money. 
Direct Express is currently transitioning their contract to XXXX XXXX in New York. Congress took the contract away from them because, among other things, they are hacked regularly and their fraud department is in XXXX XXXX. ( According to XXXX XXXX, )

Sub-issue: Card was charged for something you did not purchase with the card
Consumer complaint narrative: In XXXX and XXXX of XXXX I had two charges for XXXX XXXX  both for {$530.00} equaling out to be over {$1000.00}. I started the dispute. In XXXX on the XXXX, XXXX months later citizens bank sent me a rebill and when I called about the dispute they sent a letter stating I ordered from this company, details with my name being XXXX. I had tried to explain I am not XXXX and I have never received any products from this company. Also not a realtor. They basically told me there was nothing they could do. XXXX XXXX. I just figured I couldnt do anything else. And since my husband has been terminally ill and between working and trying to take care of him and had to run my business I forgot.
