Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
RE : Questions about account limitations XXXX XX/XX/year> Dear XXXX, Thank you so much for reaching PayPal XXXX XXXX. We appreciate you for using PayPal in your business however our records show that following an in-depth review of the account, account activity and business model on XXXX XXXX you were informed that PayPal had taken the decision to end the business relationship with you and that your funds would be held for 180 days to minimize risk of loss to PayPal should buyers filed claims or chargebacks against payments you had received. 

For the safety and security of the PayPal network, we often review accounts for potential risks. After reviewing your account, we have decided to limit it permanently. We can confirm that the outcome of this decision will not be changed and has been carried out in accordance with our User Agreement. 

We are satisfied that all actions taken in this situation were correct and in accordance with PayPals agreed terms of use. 


Sincerely, XXXX PayPal XXXX XXXX PayPal XXXX XXXX PayPal. All rights reserved. 

From XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) Subject : RE : Questions about account limitations XXXX ( XXXX ) PayPal Customer Support : Dear XXXX Our Board sat to consider this situation. We were wondering why PayPal was so confident in denying XXXX XXXX XXXX access. We looked all our directors and the consultant we use. We have figured out the problem. Our XXXX XXXX in whose name the account was opened had her documents stolen last year and she put a watch on her SSN. 

I have been instructed to apologize to you and to PayPal for any untold thing that may have occurred. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX and objectives are bigger than XXXX person. The XXXX has asked that XXXX XXXX XXXX ( me ) ask the credit companies to release her SSN for you to access or that we change the person in whose name the account is operated. 

Let me know if this a path PayPal can take XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX operations will greatly be enhanced by a relationship with PayPal given both XXXX and XXXX use PAYPAL as the payment XXXX XXXX XXXX 

The thieves who stole my documentation will have succeeded greatly if my life is adversely affected by their actions Regards XXXX XXXX. 






Dear XXXX XXXX, Thank you for contacting PayPal XXXX XXXX. My name is XXXX XXXX and I am glad to assist you with limited account. 


We appreciate your interest in PayPal ; however, I have reviewed this for you, and I see that PayPal had made a strong and tough decision to permanently limit your account which means that you can no longer use this PayPal account for your transactions. I do apologize for providing this information to you. PayPal reserves the right to limit access to any account reported to be involved in possible fraudulent or high risk behavior. We review many factors before coming to a decision to restrict an account permanently. This is not something we do without proper consideration. We also can not disclose any specific reason as to why this account has been permanently restricted. PayPal 's investigation is confidential and proprietary. 



It's a good thing that there's no available balance on that account that will be held for 180 days since this is now the best opportunity to check for other payment processor outside PayPal to receive payments for your business. 



I appreciate your understanding on this matter. It is my pleasure to assist you. Thank you for choosing PayPal. 


Sincerely, XXXX XXXX PayPal XXXX XXXX PayPal. All rights reserved. 

From : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Questions about account limitations XXXX ( XXXX ) PayPal Customer Support : Hello You provide a proforma email. You did not address why you decided to limit our account even before we started. As a Nonprofit, given that XXXX and XXXX only use Paypal, you decision that XXXX XXXX XXXX can not use your services kneecapped our operations without cause. In the Non-profit ecosystem, Paypal is, in reality, a public utility We need this matter addressed since our donors and prospective donors would like to know where the challenges are XXXX XXXX XXXX,

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Sub-issue: Damage caused or loss of personal items in vehicle during the actual repossession
Consumer complaint narrative:
Credit Acceptance has a reputation for perfidy and unethical, illegal practices. They have been under intense scrutiny by the media and investigations by agencies such as, The Department of Justice, Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, The Federal Trade Commission and numerous state Attorney Generals. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX have made efforts to protect consumers from companies like Credit Acceptance by introducing The Dodd-Frank Act in XXXX. 

Credit Acceptance has made my life a nightmare due to their greed and cagey nature in dealing with consumers. I purchased a vehicle back in XXXX, using them a for a very high interest loan that made a affordable transaction virtually unaffordable. 

Subsequent actions by Credit Acceptance included, harassment, threats, deniability, and fraud. They also did not produce the proper paperwork or disclose pertinent information, making me look non-compliant before legal action was taken. Throughout my dealings with them, I constantly invoked my consumer rights which was disregarded. Credit Acceptance would not reveal information until I paid, which felt like extortion. 

Here is an email that was sent to my bank requesting a refund after I found out Credit Acceptance lied.

Good afternoon, Payment of {$520.00} plus {$3.00} processing fee on XX/XX/XXXX. 
Confirmation number XXXX. 

As far as my research goes, Credit Acceptance does not have a refund or cancellation policy. I spoke to someone from Credit Acceptances Redemption Department on Monday and he confirmed this. 

The summary of the credit dispute is as follows : I was led astray and became a victim of every deceptive method from credit acceptance since day one. I was diligently attempting to settle the impasse between myself and credit acceptance on numerous occasions but all they care about is money. They change have plenty of agents who are experts at being rude, harassing, lying, and overall being consummate unprofessionals. My car was repossessed without a notice to cure from Credit Acceptance and no note left by the repo agent to assure my car wasn't stolen which is illegal. 

Credit Acceptance gave me the runaround since XXXX about the whereabouts of the car and had their agents lie by having me believe they couldn't disclose information of the location ( XXXX ) until I paid them the {$520.00}. Because of this, I couldn't retrieve my personal items which were stolen and or destroyed by the towing company, according to credit acceptance. They are trying to absolve themselves from any responsibility when they facilitated everything to keep the car. 

I ended up paying the above amount just to keep credit acceptance from harassing and threatening me. Once I did, they immediately let me know where the car was. When I arrived to pick up the car it was full of scratches, dents, there was damage to the anti-theft system, mud all over the floorboards and all my personal items of value were missing. They even took the car manuals and original parts off the car. I called credit acceptance and they would not let me speak to a supervisor at first, when I finally did, I was told that they have no account of the car being damaged and they have inspection photos of the car after repossession, supposedly. They will not show me these photos. 

I paid credit acceptance to procure my vehicle in the same condition I had it before repossession. Sadly, this was not the case and since credit acceptance is feigning ignorance about what happened, I angrily refused to take the car. I will not pay for something I don't have. 

There is currently a investigation with Credit Acceptance regarding the damage of the vehicle. It is to my understanding that the money should be refunded and held in my account until Credit Acceptance concludes their investigation.

Read some of the reviewers whose stories are similar to mine dealing with credit acceptance.

https : //www.consumeraffairs.com/finance/credit_acceptance_corp.html Thanks, Furthermore, Credit Acceptance is constantly flagging my credit reports thus stifling my efforts to maintain a respectable XXXX XXXX. I have filed numerous disputes with all XXXX credit bureaus and currently still fighting with them. I have not conducted business with Credit Acceptance in 8 years.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against XXXX for failing to comply with federal laws governing the handling of disputes under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related consumer protection statutes. XXXX has refused to properly investigate or remove fraudulent accounts reported to FTC Identify Theft on my credit file, causing significant harm and violating my rights. 

Background : On XX/XX/XXXX, XXXX informed me that XXXX of the fraudulent accounts I reported on XX/XX/XXXX to the FTC Identity Theft as fraud accounts were " verified '' per the debt collector, despite being flagged as fraudulent. This response came after XXXX  days of delay, resulting in an inconclusive decision and allowing the fraudulent accounts to remain on my credit report. 

CRAs Failure to Comply : Despite my clear and lawful dispute, XXXX either failed to perform an adequate investigation or improperly verified the accounts with the original creditors/debtors without validating their legitimacy. This constitutes a violation of my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), which requires XXXX to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information and delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable items. 

Harm Caused : The continued reporting of these fraudulent accounts is negatively impacting my credit score and financial well-being. Additionally, I have spent considerable time and resources attempting to correct this issue, only to encounter further delays and noncompliance by XXXX. 

Laws Violated : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) : XXXX failed to meet its obligation to reasonably investigate my dispute under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ). XXXX continued to report unverifiable and fraudulent information, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which mandates accurate reporting. XXXX willful noncompliance with its obligations constitutes a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681n, which provides for civil liability for willful violations, including damages, attorneys fees, and punitive damages. 
Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ) : XXXX improperly relied on a creditor or debt collectors unverified claims without ensuring the accuracy of the account, potentially facilitating abusive debt collection practices. This constitutes a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1692k, which provides for civil liability for violations, including actual damages, statutory damages, and attorneys fees.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Dispute of Credit Report Inaccuracies Dear Sir/Madam , I am writing to formally dispute inaccuracies in my credit report as provided by the XXXX major credit bureaus : XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX. It has come to my attention that my credit card account, which is in good standing with a perfect payment history, has been deleted from my credit report, effectively shortening my credit history. 

Details of the account are as follows : - **Account Number : ** XXXX - **Account Type : ** Revolving Account Opened XX/XX/XXXX - **Status : ** XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - **Payment History : ** No late payments, paid as agreed I have received multiple letters from all three bureaus requesting additional identification, despite having already provided all necessary information. This continual request for information is unnecessary as I have verified that my records are complete. 

The actions taken by the credit bureaus may constitute a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) regarding willful non-compliance. As my credit report reflects, all three bureaus have acknowledged my account status as " OK, '' and there are no discrepancies in my payment history. 

I kindly request an immediate investigation into this matter and urge you to ensure that my account is accurately represented in my credit report. Thank you for your attention to this urgent matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, CFPB PLEASE HAVE THIS ACCOUNT REINSTATED

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: On the afternoon XX/XX/XXXX I contacted SoFi to report XXXX fraudulent charges totaling {$100.00} after I receive an alert from SoFi. The operator acknowledged my request but could not dispute the claims until the charges posted. The evening of XX/XX/XXXX, I checked my account again and notice that there were XXXX additional charges totaling {$4200.00} made against my account which completely drained my account to zero ( {$4300.00} combined ). I then contacted XXXX again that night to dispute those charges as well. Sofi then froze my account ( even though it was at {$0.00} by that point ). After speaking with a fraud XXXX at SoFi on XX/XX/XXXX, the XXXX charges were deemed as fraudulent and the charges were refunded, yet my account remained frozen. This account is the only money that I have. I dont have any credit cards. By freezing my only access to my money, I can not pay for food, rent, prescription medications, fuel, etc. when contacting SoFi to explain this, the only response I get is that the status of the account is restricted and they are unable to provide any additional information. My case had been submitted to the internal investigation department. Upon requesting a contact number for that department I was told that there is no way for me to contact them as they do not take outside calls. So here I sit, XXXX days from my original dispute submissions with no access to money and not even a reason why my account is still restricted, and no information on how long this process might take. I am being stone wall by the general service reps and SoFi is essentially holding my money hostage for reasons unknown. I need food. I need to pay rent. But no one at this bank seems to care.

Product: Checking or savings account
Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive enough information to verify debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Complainant Information : Name : XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, GA XXXX Complaint Against : Midland Credit Management XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, MI XXXX Subject : Dispute Regarding Alleged Debt and Failure to Validate Debt Details of the Complaint : I am submitting this complaint regarding an alleged debt reported by Midland Credit Management on my credit report. Upon discovering the entry, I formally disputed the validity of the debt in writing on XX/XX/year>, and requested validation under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

In my dispute letter, I requested the following from Midland Credit Management : 1. A copy of the original contract or purchase agreement creating the alleged debt. 2. Proof of the chain of ownership of the debt, including all assignments. 3. A full accounting history, including the date of the first delinquency and all payments. 4. Proof that any interest or fees added to the balance are lawful and agreed upon in the original terms. 5. Proof of compliance with Geo
rgia state licensing and third-party debt collection bonding requirements.

6. Proof of all legally required notices sent to me before reporting this debt to consumer reporting agencies.

I have reason to believe that this debt is invalid, and I requested the above information to verify its legitimacy. Additionally, I reviewed the licensing database at www.nmlsconsumeraccess.org and found that Midland Credit Management does not appear to have a license to collect debts in Georgia, where I reside.

To date, Midland Credit Management has not provided the requested documentation or validation of the debt. Furthermore, reporting this alleged debt without proper validation or notification may constitute " debt parking, '' a violation of consumer rights established in *FTC v. XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

XXXX XXXX : I request that the CFPB take the following actions : 1. Investigate Midland Credit Managements practices regarding the reporting and collection of this alleged debt. 
2. Require Midland Credit Management to provide complete validation of the debt or remove the item from my credit report immediately.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I am formally disputing the accuracy, ownership, and reporting of this collection account, which I have no knowledge of. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA, 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ), I am requesting immediate validation and investigation of this account. Furthermore, I am demanding compliance with all relevant federal laws governing the reporting and collection of consumer debts. Specifically, I request the following : 1. Validation of Debt ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) Provide complete and detailed validation of this debt, including : A copy of the original signed agreement or contract proving this account is mine. 
An itemized accounting of all charges, fees, and payments made to date, showing how the balance was calculated. 
Proof of your legal authority to collect this debt, including a copy of the assignment contract or bill of sale that establishes a valid chain of assignments. If the debt was sold multiple times, provide documentation for each transfer. 

2. Proof of Permissible Purpose ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) If you accessed my credit report, provide documentation showing that you had a permissible purpose to do so under the FCRA. Specifically, demonstrate that : You have a valid legal basis to access my consumer credit file. 
This account was reported or accessed in compliance with federal law. 

Unauthorized access to my credit file is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act and may result in legal consequences. 

3. Compliance with Privacy Laws ( 15 U.S.C. 6802 ) Under the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, you must demonstrate compliance with federal laws protecting my nonpublic personal information. Provide proof that : I was notified and provided consent for any disclosures of my information to third parties. 
Your possession and use of my personal information complies with all applicable privacy regulations. 

Failure to comply with these requirements constitutes an unlawful disclosure of personal information. 

4. Verification of Reporting Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) Under the FCRA, all information reported to credit bureaus must be accurate and complete. If you intend to verify this account, provide the following : A detailed explanation of the procedures followed to verify the accuracy of this information under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ). 
All documentation retrieved and reviewed during the investigation that proves this account is accurate. 

5. Method of Verification and Shortened Timeline ( FCRA 611 ) If you verify this account, I demand a detailed description of the method and procedure used to verify its accuracy. This includes : All documentation from the original creditor. 
A detailed breakdown of how the reported information was confirmed to be correct. 

You must provide this information to me within 15 days of verification ( or the legally required timeframe of 30 days under the FCRA ). If you can not verify this account, it must be removed from my credit report immediately under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ). 

6. Identity Theft Investigation ( 18 U.S.C. 1028A ) If this debt resulted from identity theft or fraud, I demand that you investigate under 18 U.S.C. 1028A. Provide evidence proving this account was not the result of fraudulent activity, including : All identification and information used to create the account. 
Proof that the account was lawfully opened and maintained. 

Failure to investigate or provide adequate documentation will result in further legal action. 

7. Compliance with Billing Procedures ( 15 U.S.C. 1666b ) If this account includes late payments, demonstrate compliance with the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1666b ). Specifically, provide proof that : Periodic billing statements, as required under 15 U.S.C. 1637 ( b ), were provided at least 21 days prior to the payment due date. 
Late payment reporting adhered to all federal guidelines. 

If these procedures were not followed, any late payment reporting is invalid and must be deleted. 

Cease and Desist Request ( FDCPA 805 ( c ) ) Under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), I formally request that you cease and desist all communication with me regarding this alleged debt. You may only contact me to provide : 1. Validation of the debt as requested above. 
2. Notice that you are terminating collection efforts.

3. Notification of legal actions you intend to take, if any.

Failure to comply with this request will result in immediate complaints to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state attorney generals office. 

Summary of Demands If you can not validate this debt, prove its accuracy, or demonstrate compliance with the laws listed above, you must : 1. Immediately delete this account from my credit report under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 5 ).

2. Cease all collection activity related to this account. 

Failure to comply with these demands will result in complaints to the appropriate regulatory agencies and may result in legal action for violations of federal law. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect to receive all requested documentation and responses within the legally mandated timeframe.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Regarding Unauthorized Transactions and Financial Institution 's Handling Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to formally lodge a complaint regarding unauthorized transactions on my Ace Elite Prepaid Debit Card account and the inadequate response by the issuing institution. 
Incident Details : Date of Unauthorized Transactions : XXXX XXXX XXXX Merchant Involved : XXXX Amounts and Timeline : {$0.00} ( initial test transaction ) XXXX XXXX {$500.00} ( completed ) XXXXXXXX XXXX {$300.00} ( completed ) XXXXXXXX XXXX  {$100.00} ( completed ) XXXXXXXX XXXX  {$100.00} ( declined due to insufficient funds ) XXXXXXXX XXXX These transactions occurred within minutes of each other, rapidly depleting my account balance. I did not authorize any of these transactions, nor have I ever used XXXX or purchased cryptocurrency in my lifetime. 
Actions Taken : Immediate Contact with Ace Elite : I called Ace Elite within minutes of receiving text alerts about the transactions. Despite my swift action, I was informed that they could not act while the transactions were still pending. However, the funds had already been deducted from my account.

Disputes Raised : I formally disputed the transactions with Ace Elite and requested a freeze or reversal. I was told I must wait for the transactions to clear before further action could be taken, leaving my account vulnerable. 
FTC Complaint : I submitted a complaint to the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), outlining the suspected fraudulent activity and the possibility that my information was compromised by an online merchant or third-party vendor using mirroring software to intercept payment data. 
Suspected Fraud Source : I suspect the compromise originated from an online merchant/vendor that had access to both my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Ace Elite Card information. These cards were used with select subscription-based services, narrowing the potential breach point to specific vendors. 
Request for Immediate Assistance : I am seeking your assistance to : Investigate Ace Elites handling of this situation, including their delay in addressing the fraudulent transactions.

Determine why Ace Elite failed to act on an obvious pattern of suspicious activity.

Ensure the return of my stolen funds totaling {$900.00}. 
Take steps to prevent future occurrences of such incidents, including stricter oversight of merchants handling sensitive consumer data. 
Supporting Documents : I have attached the following : Transaction alerts and details. 
Correspondence with Ace Elite.

Copy of my FTC complaint.

Any additional relevant evidence.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I hope for a resolution that includes the recovery of my funds and assurance that Ace Elite and associated institutions will take stronger measures to protect consumers. 
Sincerely,

The payment was processed through automated phone system. 
Despite making the payment on time, I was still charged a late fee of {$29.00}. 
Reason for My Request : According to the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), late fees should not be assessed when payments are made on or before the due date. Additionally, as a consumer, I ensured the payment was made within the time frame outlined in my account agreement. If there were issues with the processing time on Comenity Bank 's end, that should not be attributed to me as the account holder. 

I kindly request that Comenity Bank credit the late fee back to my account as I complied with all payment deadlines. 

Requested Resolution : A reversal of the late fee charged to my account. 
Clarification on how this issue occurred and confirmation that my account is in good standing. 
Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. I appreciate the CFPBs support in helping resolve issues like these fairly and in accordance with applicable laws.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: On the XXXX of XXXX, 2024, my daughter received a message from USAA stating that her account PIN number for online access to her savings account ( jointly owned with me ) had been changed. She did not initiate any PIN change. By the time she was able to get back into her account and change the PIN back to something she knew and get access to see what was going on, she saw that a XXXX transfer of {$580.00} to XXXX had taken place, leaving her with only {$0.00} in her account. Since this transfer took place without either authorized account owners action or even any knowledge of the transaction, it seems obvious that fraud and theft was involved. My expectation was that we would be able to have this obviously fraudulent transaction reversed. My daughter could not get through to you in a timely manner, so I endured the hold times and reported the fraud to USAA. I followed up on that report when we found more evidence of fraud against XXXX in the form of identity theft, in that XXXX reported that there was an XXXX XXXX in XXXX that was logged into her email account. ( She logged it out and changed her password, of course. ) The only response we got from USAA was 2 nearly identical letters stating that there was no fraudulent activity detected and that no further action would be taken. This is, of course, outrageous.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX I was a victim of identity theft and bank fraud. As a result of the theft, the fraudster was able to create accounts using my information. After I pulled my credit reports I noticed one of the fraudulent accounts listed Upgrade , Inc. as the creditor. This was listed as an installment account in the amount of {$26000.00}. I contacted my local law enforcement and filed a report with the FTC regarding the identity theft. 

After submitting a dispute with the credit bureaus the account was initially removed my credit report. As of XXXX ( almost 4 months after the initial dispute ) it was added back to my report with the following remarks " Completed investigation of FCRA dispute-consumer disagreed ; UNPAID BALANCE CHARGED OFF ''. This false reporting resulted in a huge negative drop in my XXXX XXXX and will negatively effect my future financial endeavors. 

I contacted the company through their support channel and over the phone to remove the fraudulent account from my report. They were not able to provide reasons as to why the claim was 'unsubstantiated ' but said that they would send an email instead. I have not received any additional information from the company.

Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: Shortly after opening an account online with Charles Schwab I began having issues logging into my online banking. I received an error message which stated that I needed to go in-person to a branch location and present a valid photo ID in order to verify my identity. A few days later I proceeded to appear in-person at a Schwab branch with my valid drivers license, which was noted in my account by the branch representative that I dealt with. My account access was briefly restored that same day but within 24 hours I began having trouble logging into my account again. Since then Ive contacted Schwab Customer Support by phone on numerous occasions and each time have been told that my case is being reviewed by the fraud department however I still havent heard anything despite it now being over a week since I first presented my valid drivers license in-person. Also during this time when speaking with customer support I was assured that even though my online banking access was restricted, that Id still be able to access the funds in my account when I receive and activate my debit card in the mail. I activated my debit card a few days ago fully expecting to be able to use the card to access the funds in my account but I have been unable to do so despite the reassurances given to me to the contrary by Schwab Support Representatives.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Request for Assistance : Funds Withheld by Blockchain.com Greetings reader, I am writing to request your assistance in resolving a serious issue I am experiencing with Blockchain.com, which I have learned has impacted numerous other individuals as well. 

I have been a verified user on Blockchain.com since XXXX, but on XX/XX/XXXX, I made a {$2000.00} deposit to my account. Immediately after the deposit, I attempted to withdraw the funds, but the platform displayed an error message stating, Dont worry, your funds are safe. The next day, XX/XX/XXXX, I noticed that my account verification status had been inexplicably revoked. 

Since XX/XX/XXXX, I have been trying to resolve this issue daily. I submitted all required documents through their app, including a scanned XXXX passport and my XXXX  REAL ID ( front and back ). After receiving no resolution, I also emailed the same documents directly to their support team as suggested. Despite my compliance, my verification remains pending, and my funds are still inaccessible. 

I have proof of my previous verified status, the submitted documents, and all communications with Blockchain.com. However, the company has failed to provide clear communication or any meaningful resolution, leaving my funds effectively frozen without justification. 

This situation is deeply concerning, particularly because it appears to be part of a broader issue with Blockchain.coms handling of user accounts and funds. Their actionsor lack thereofraise serious questions about their business practices and regulatory compliance. 

I am reaching out to your agency as I believe this matter requires oversight and investigation to protect consumers like myself. I am happy to provide all relevant documentation to support this case. 

I would greatly appreciate your guidance on how to proceed or any steps your office can take to help resolve this matter. 

Thank you for your attention to this issue. I look forward to your response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against Hunter Warfield for violating the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) by excessively and unlawfully contacting me. 
Between XX/XX/XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX, they contacted me eight times : XX/XX/XXXX : Contacted twice. XX/XX/XXXX : Contacted once.XX/XX/XXXX : Contacted five times. Under the FDCPA, debt collectors can not contact consumers more than seven times within seven consecutive days, making this a clear violation of federal law. Furthermore, the excessive contacting has not stopped since this period, adding ongoing stress and inconvenience. This is not my first time submitting a complaint about Hunter Warfield, and I strongly urge the CFPB to thoroughly investigate their communication practices. I also request that this debt be removed from my credit report due to their repeated noncompliance with the law.

My wife usually manages finance, so I thought everything was good and I was busy with settling in, XXXX, and work. 

On XXXX XX/XX/year>, while sitting in my car during lunch, a car repo agent hooked, and repossessed my vehicle. Thats when I first found out that my account has been in delinquency since XXXX or XXXX. I never got any notice or letter of it and it was a total surprise. We think it was because we moved around before settling in and got a new mailing address in XXXX. 

I called Hyundai Finance right away and paid off what I owed plus repossession, late fees, and towing charges when I went to pick up my vehicle. 

I have never experienced this before and I am very concerned that it has negatively affected my otherwise excellent credit rating ( went down to around XXXX from close to XXXX ). 

In my case, Hyundai Finance clearly repossessed my vehicle without a court order or any other notices. I believe that is a clear violation of SCRA. 

Thank you.

XXXX, FL XXXX SSN : XXXX LVNV FUNDING po box XXXX XXXX, SC XXXX XX/XX/year> To Whom This May Concern, I am writing this letter to formally address and dispute inaccuracies within my credit report, as reported by your agency. In accordance with the provisions outlined in 15 US Section 1681i of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I am formally requesting an investigation into these items. I kindly request that you furnish proof of these discrepancies, specifically the contract documentation bearing my signature. In the absence of such evidence, I urge you to promptly update the record to reflect " PAID IN FULL/AS AGREED '' or expeditiously remove this item from my credit report.

The inaccurately reported item, identified as follows, is a critical error that requires immediate attention : LVNV FUNDING LLC & XXXX Despite being classified as a collection/charged-off account on my credit report, I have not received a 1099C for this charged-off debt. I request the issuance of a 1099C to accurately denote this as a charge-off for tax purposes and request an update to my credit report accordingly.

Pursuant to 15 US section 1681i ( 6 ) ( A ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, please provide me with the description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information, to be provided within 15 days of the completion of your investigation.

I am aware that these discrepancies may appear minor, but they carry significant consequences when it comes to major life decisions such as securing a home, obtaining a vehicle, seeking a business loan, or even gaining employment. I respectfully request an expedited resolution to this matter.

Your immediate attention to this issue is greatly appreciated. Thank you for your prompt assistance in rectifying these discrepancies. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative: I had key bank close my account for fraud. After 14 days they opened the account and told me in XXXX weeks I would be refunded what was owed due to the fraudulent activity. The day the refund was supposed to come in, I spoke with the bank and they said I'm all set, my account is open and I was refunded. When I went to the bank to access my account, I was told they had to put a hold on my account again and I cant access it. After bringing fraudulent activity to their attention, they cleared me of the wrongdoing and refunded me only to tell me they are investigating my account further because they think I had something to do with it. I have waited for over XXXX months. I have been given not a single reason why they opened my account and then closed it again. I have no Idea why and what they are accusing me of. All I have been told is that they are investigating my account and I have nothing I can do and no recourse. I feel like I am being robbed. I came to them with a fraudulent charge, I was cleared and told they tracked the IP address that did it and I would be refunded my funds, then the day it was refunded the bank closed my account again and said they believe I have something to do with the fraud but I said, why would I bring it to your attention if I did it? They will not release any information and keep telling me its under investigation through there fraud center. This started the first week of XXXX. I dont know what to do and I have been threatened that if I keep asking they will call the cops on me, Ive been to the bank many times to be escorted out by security simply for asking questions. Anyone I call tells me that its ongoing and they cant answer any questions nor can they even tell me what I am being charged with or what crime I have committed. I still have no idea why they think I committed the fraud when I was already cleared and told it clearly wasnt my fault. They even agreed to refund me my money. However since the day it was due they completely locked me out and said we refunded you but you cant access your account, so I have to wait while my money sits there and I cant even access any future direct deposits which has nothing to do with past issues but I have no way of accessing the account at all or can not receive any information. Please help me, I cant afford a lawyer, the cheapest wants XXXX $ an hour. I have been defaulting on a lot of bills because of this. I cant access my own money and have been put in a really bad situation, for example with my landlord and rent. This has cost me so much more then just the money that they will not allow me to have ; which is my own money that I worked hard for.

Date ] Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, DC XXXX AND LexisNexis Risk Solutions Subject : Complaint Regarding Inaccurate and Defamatory Claim History Report Submitted by XXXX Insurance Dear XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Director/LexisNexis Risk Solutions Representative XXXX, This letter constitutes a formal complaint regarding inaccurate and potentially defamatory information submitted by XXXX Insurance to the Ohio Department of Insurance during the investigation of my insurance claim dispute. 

During a recent insurance claim dispute with XXXX XXXX, I filed a complaint with the Ohio Department of Insurance. In response, XXXX XXXX submitted a claim history report that contains inaccurate and misleading information. Specifically, the report includes claims that : Do not belong to me : Do not match my address of residence : Were not made in my name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX File Number : XXXX Date of Loss : XX/XX/XXXX Loss Location : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, OH XXXX Cause of Loss : Arson or Incendiary Suspicion Paid : Unknown Carrier : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX File : XXXX Claim number : XXXX Date of Loss : XX/XX/XXXX Loss Location : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX OH Reported Loss : Unknown Homeowner property damage XXXX : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX File : XXXX Claim number : XXXX Date of Loss : XX/XX/XXXX Loss Location : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX OH Reported Loss : Unknown Kicked in Front Door XXXX Malicious Mischief Paid : Unknown Carrier : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of XXXX Date of Loss : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX File number : XXXX Claim Number : XXXX Loss Location : Unknown XXXX  OH Reported : Water Damage to Flooring and ceiling insured fell asleep Total Paid : Closed without payment Carrier : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Date of Loss : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX File number : XXXX Claim Number : XXXX Loss Location : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX OH Reported : Water Damage Total Paid : Unknown This inaccurate information is not only misleading but also potentially defamatory as it falsely implies a history of fraudulent insurance claims. Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
My credit report shows a reputed collection account XXXX with TCM INCORPORTED-CORINTH with different opening dates, balances, first date of delinquency, balance due, and/or last date of activities. I have never had an account with this company nor any record of any type of first notice of debt including rights to dispute from this company. And if I, by chance, even though I have no recollection nor tangible record, naively spoke with a representative of this company over the phone about this debt, I was not in

formed by that representative that I had a right to dispute this debt nor a specific timeframe to do so. 15 USC 1692g 809. V
alidation of debts ( a ) Notice of debt ; contents states that within XXXX days after the initial communication with a consumer in connection with the collection of any debt, a debt collector shall, unless the following information is contained in the initial communication or the consumer has paid the debt, send the consumer a written notice containing ( XXXX ) a statement that unless the consumer, within XXXX days after receipt of the notice, disputes the validity of the debt, or any portion thereof, the debt will be assumed to be valid by the debt collector. XXXX XXXX XXXX  definition of the word receipt is- a writing acknowledging the receiving of goods or money ; proof, evidence. I have never signed nor received any type of acknowledgement receipt from a mailing service for any mail from this company. I am familiar with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Had I signed a receipt of notice for the proper and legal documentation from this company, I wouldve immediately responded asking for lawful verification of debt or copy of court ordered judgement well within the lawful 30 days allotted. After receiving my response letter with receipt, this company would have to legally cease from collection attempts and remove the account from my credit reports until their proof of verification is sent back to me. This company has reported to my credit reports without observing the FDCPA laws. My credit has been impacted adversely because of this companys irresponsibility.

My credit reports also show that TCM INCORPORTED-CORINTH has provided this alleged account with inaccurate information. The FCRA requires that all data reported from the credit reporting agencies, creditors, or furnishers on a consumer 's report be 100 % ACCURATE, 100 % VERIFIABLE, and 100 % TIMELY. This means no data can be reported that can't be legally PROVEN to be 100 % accurate. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. My XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX credit reports all show different open dates, balances, first date of delinquency, balance due, and/or last date of activities for this same exact account. Therefore making this alleged account full of inaccuracies. 

This is erroneous and flawed reporting that is listed on my credit reports. Not only did TCM INCORPORTED-CORINTH not follow lawful FDCPA communications protocol, but it has also broken FDCPA False or Misleading Representations protocol as well. A debt collector, in collecting a debt, may not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representation. Specifically, a debt collector may not falsely represent the character, amount, or legal status of the debt, or of any services rendered, or compensation he or she may receive for collecting the debt. A debt collector may not communicate, or threaten to communicate, false credit information or information that should be known to be false, including not identifying disputed debts as such. Each of my 3 credit reports show different information instead of them all showing the exact same information. This is considered a false and misleading representation that this company has submitted to the credit reporting agencies.

The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has begun to aggressively litigate companies who continuously violate consumer laws. According to consumerfinance.gov, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) took action against the nations two largest debt buyers and collectors for using deceptive tactics to collect bad debts. The Bureau found that XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX bought debts that were potentially inaccurate, lacking documentation, or unenforceable. Without verifying the debt, the companies collected payments by pressuring consumers with false statements and churning out lawsuits using robo-signed court documents. The CFPB has ordered the companies to overhaul their debt collection and litigation practices and to stop reselling debts to third parties. 
The CFPB found that XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect debts that they knew, or should have known, were inaccurate or could not legally be enforced based on contractual disclaimers, past practices of debt sellers, or consumer disputes. The companies also filed lawsuits against consumers without having the intent to prove many of the debts, winning the vast majority of the lawsuits by default when consumers failed to defend themselves. These practices violated the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and the XXXX XXXX XXXX Reform and Consumer Protection Act. 

The website also stated that Encore and XXXX XXXX XXXX threatened and deceived consumers to collect on debts they should have known were inaccurate or had other problems, said CFPB XXXX XXXX XXXX. Now, the two biggest debt buyers in the market must refund millions and overhaul their practices. We will continue to take action to protect consumers from illegal and obnoxious debt collection practices.

Just as the CFPB took action against the above companies, I am asking the CFPB to take action against this company as well. Please help me get this account removed immediately and conduct an investigation on this company. As a consumer, Im publicly publishing this descriptive complaint on consumerfinance.gov so that others can learn from my experience and so that this government agency can use this information to help work with other violations and complaints from consumers regarding this company. It is not my duty to provide evidence that this alleged debt is not mine. It is the legal obligation of the debt collector to first prove or provide proof of evidence that they can lawfully collect on any alleged debt before a consumer challenges it, accurately report to the credit agencies, and follow all FC
RA and FDCPA laws. As of today, they have been very unsuccessful to do so.

TCM INCORPORATED-CORINTH XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally complain about recurring issues regarding Citibank 's credit card fraud alert system and the subsequent handling of such cases. 

Despite my diligent efforts to notify Citibank in advance of my travel by placing a travel notice across all of my accounts, my credit card is regularly flagged for fraud, leading to unwarranted freezes on transactions. This repeated failure of their systems to account for travel notices is both inaccurate and disruptive. 

To compound the issue, the contact number provided to resolve such consistently routes me to overseas call centers. While I respect and value diversity, the staff in these centers frequently have limited proficiency in English and heavy accents, which severely hampers effective communication. This adds unnecessary frustration to an already inconvenient situation. 

The most troubling aspect, however, is that these call centers are often closed or otherwise unreachable when needed. The lack of alternative methods to confirm activity or contact Citibank support in such cases is unacceptable and leaves customers stranded without access to critical funds.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Sub-issue: Debt was already discharged in bankruptcy and is no longer owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Debt Validation Request Reference # : XXXX To Whom It May Concern, I am writing in response to your recent co

mmunication regarding an alleged debt you claim I owe. Please take notice that this is not an acknowledgment or acceptance of the debt. I am requesting that you provide validation and verification of the debt under my rights as outlined in the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g.

Under the FDCPA, I am entitled to request the following information within 30 days of receipt of your notice : 1.The name and address of the original creditor 2.Chain of Title or Chain of Assignment 3.The day of the first delinquency 4.The day of the last payment and the amount 5.A detailed explanation of how the amount claimed was calculated, including any fees, interest, or other charges ; 6.Verification of my liability, including any documentation proving that I agreed to pay what you claim I owe. 
XXXX also request that you cease any further collection activity or reporting to credit bureaus regarding this debt until you have provided the requested documentation to verify the validity of the debt. Failure to comply with this request within the time allowed may be a violation of the FDCPA and other applicable laws.

Additionally, please note that under the FDCPA : You are prohibited from contacting me about this alleged debt other than to provide the requested verification or to notify me of your intent to cease collection efforts. 
You must cease all collection efforts, including phone calls, letters, or other communication until you have supplied the requested debt validation. 
If you are unable to provide the requested documentation within the time required, you must cease collection efforts and remove any adverse information you have reported to the credit reporting agencies about this alleged debt Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to receiving the necessary verification of the debt.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Notification didn't disclose it was an attempt to collect a debt
Consumer complaint narrative:
Recently I did an investigation on my credit report and found several items on there to be inaccurate. 
Under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of report Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates.

15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general if, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shalli ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
LexisNexis may have violated specific privacy laws and regulations by sharing your personal information without your consent. Here are some relevant laws that may apply : 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The FCRA regulates how consumer reporting agencies handle personal data. If LexisNexis failed to ensure the accuracy of your information or shared it without permissible purpose, it could be in violation.

Section 604 ( a ) : Specifies the limited purposes for which consumer reports may be shared, requiring explicit consent in most cases.

2. Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) : The GLBA requires financial institutions and entities handling sensitive data to protect consumer information and provide notices about information-sharing practices. 
Privacy Rule ( 16 CFR Part 313 ) : Mandates disclosure and consent requirements for sharing personal data.

3. State Privacy Laws : Depending on your state, LexisNexis may have violated laws like the California Consumer Privacy Act ( CCPA ) or Arizonas Consumer Fraud Act if you reside in these states.

CCPA ( California ) : Gives consumers the right to know what information is collected, opt out of its sale, and request deletion.

4. Unauthorized Use and Consent : Tort Law ( Invasion of Privacy ) : Publishing false or private information without consent can constitute an invasion of privacy, including false light or public disclosure of private facts.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally address concerns regarding my account with your institution. Specifically, despite fully paying off a this account. I believe XXXX XXXX  is violating my rights under federal consumer protection laws. The reported information is inaccurate and should be deleted for the following reasons : 1. Incorrect Balance and Past Due Amount : This account was paid in full. The balance and past-due amounts are incorrect. 2. Incorrect Payment History : The reported payment history rating does not reflect the accounts actual payment record. 3. Misclassification as a Charge-Off/Collection : This account is not a charge-off or collection. It has been fully paid and should be reported as PAID. 4. Incorrect Remarks Field : The remarks field is misleading and inaccurate. Please delete all remarks associated with this account. The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a violation of the FACT Act and the FCRA, which mandate that credit reporting agencies ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the data they report. I am requesting that this account be reviewed and updated to reflect the following changes : I request the immediate removal of this account from all credit reporting agencies. Details of Violations 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : XXXX XXXX  credit card has inaccurately reported my paid charge-off as unresolved to credit reporting agencies. Additionally, the account has not been updated to accurately reflect its paid status, despite my requests to rectify the issue. 2. Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) : Your institution has engaged in practices that may be considered unfair, deceptive, or abusive by failing to ensure accurate reporting and withholding proper resolution information. I request the immediate removal of this account from all credit reporting agencies. I am writing to formally address the tangible losses I have experienced as a direct result of the inaccuracies in my credit report. These violations have led to the denial of loans and higher interest rates, significantly impacting my financial well-being. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am requesting statutory damages of {$1000.00} for each violation. Additionally, I am seeking compensation for monetary damages, including punitive damages, to address the harm caused by these errors.

INFORMATION FOUND Lender : KOHLS/CAPONE Inquiry XXXX I called the credit bureaus and confirmed the credit Fraud Alert in my file requiring creditors to call me at the designated telephone number whenever anyone applies for credit using my name or Social Security Number. They advised me to first contact Kohls and ask them to close the account and investigate how the account had been created, since it was a violation of the Alert.

I attempted to report the fraudulent account to Kohls at XXXX, and XXXX, the number listed for Kohls when a card is lost, stolen, or never received as listed below : ( TABLE INSERTED ) However, Kohls representatives repeatedly refused close the account or have it removed from my credit report. I spoke with " XXXX '' a XXXX in that department, but XXXX refused to even investigate the matter. After a long discussion, he admitted that he was not really in the fraud department but only took new applications, and gave me a different number to call XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX for fraud reports : XXXX. However, the supposed Fraud department only had pre-recorded messages prompting me to make a payment, and if I pressed XXXX the operator failed to answer or cut me off. 

In the meantime, I contacted the credit bureaus again to inform them of Kohls response. They confirmed that the Fraud Alert on my file had the correct phone number of XXXX and explained that the Kohls employee processing that credit application would have easily seen the Fraud Alert with my name and telephone number and instructions to call me before processing the application. They said Kohls Corporate was in violation, and the Bureau would flag the account in my record indicating that there was an issue with that creditor. 

Eventually, Kohls Fraud Department responded, and I spoke with XXXX ( Employee ID # XXXX ). She did find the fraudulent account, but stated that The Account has a restriction on it, which she said meant that she could only disclose information to the person who opened the account. XXXX then said she would have to verify me by confirming my address and telephone number in their file. However, when I gave her my information, she said it did not match the account holders information in her computer. I begged politely, citing the Fraud Alert instructions, but she repeated Kohls Company Policy over and over, raising her voice at me, that per company policy she could only investigate the account or close it with the consent of the person who opened it as identified in her computer. 

When I reminded her that the account had been created by someone pretending to be me, and without my knowledge or consent, in violation of the credit bureau Fraud Alert requirements, she put me on hold for about 10-15 minutes. When she came back, she said that she could agree to close the account, but only if I agreed to pay the balance of {$480.00}. 

I was surprised that there was a balance, since I had already reported the fraud several weeks prior and the credit bureau flagged Kohls as a fake credit card. When I asked XXXX for the purchase history, she refused to disclose any information about how the items were bought or the purchase dates, claiming that Kohls had to protect their customers. of course, that meant, Kohls feels its more important to protect their criminal employees than their unsuspecting innocent customers with good credit scores.

I then asked her if Kohls would work with Federal law enforcement, since it was obvious that their management was not willing to work with the Credit bureaus, and she said They ( meaning Kohls Corporate ) are not interested in pursuing criminal charges against anyone for opening fraudulent accounts. She eventually agreed to file a dispute on the account, and said Kohls would send me a letter in 30-60 days with their decision. 

I contacted the credit bureaus again, and was told that my credit report still reflected the same KOHLS/ CAPONE account, but now with a balance of {$480.00}, which had accrued sometime after I reported the fraud to Kohls . They said Kohls had re-reported it as an active account. 
The INFORMATION FOUND now stated : Lender : KOHLS/CAPONE Date account opened : XX/XX/year> Balance : {$480.00} Account number : XXXX... 

The credit bureaus also stated that they had received no instructions from Kohls to remove the account from my credit file, and suggested that Kohls refusal to investigate or close this account after multiple requests meant that the perpetrator was likely a Kohls Corporate employee.

In view of this new information that Kohls was condoning or ignoring criminal activity within their ranks, I then reported the account as Identity Theft to the Federal authorities informing them of Kohls Company Policies regarding fraudulent accounts. After the Federal filing, I did receive a letter from Kohls stating that they had closed the account but this was already the end of XXXX more than 2 months after I first alerted Kohls of the fraud. 
I was at peace for about 6 weeks, but it was a false sense of security.

Somehow, Kohls again re-opened the fraudulent account just a few days ago, as revealed in a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX of a HARD INQUIRY by KOHLS/ CAPONE against my credit report dated XX/XX/year>. 

XXXX also informed me that my credit score had dropped by another 30 points as a result of the Kohls false credit applications for the THIRD TIME.

When I inquired with Kohls, they gave me the same run-around, insisting that only I could have re-opened the account and that this proved that it was not fraudulent. They accused me of lying and tried to pressure me to make a payment!

Consumer complaint narrative:
Its for accounts ending XXXX and XXXX for now. First I sent a negotiable instrument to the address they have on their credit agreement for negotiable instruments and instead of processing the payment they kept my negotiable instruments and never sent them back but still closed my accounts and now charged them off. And since they were charged off I should have received a warning before they did that which I didnt and that sounds like adverse action against me. 
The laws state they cant take adverse action. On top of all of that they didnt offer arbitration. 
Being a charged off account which means they took it as a loss even though they stole my negotiable instruments which means they profited off of it but didnt give me anything in return, which makes me think they are double dipping. 
Once charged off I should receive a 1099-c which I have not.

They have also been reporting payments as late which according to 15 usc 1666B no payments shall be considered late when dealing with an open ended credit as well as 15 usc 1681a 2 exclusions which states they arent supposed to report transactions and as far as Im concerned payment history is transaction history and shouldnt be reported on my account

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally address several ongoing issues regarding incorrect information on my credit report, which have not been resolved despite multiple attempts over the past two years. 

Account Information : This dispute pertains to my account, Account Number : XXXX Nature of the Issue : The inaccuracies on my credit report include incorrect names and taxpayer information. Additionally, there are debts listed for which I have repeatedly requested validation. Specifically, there is a debt reported by XXXX ( Account XXXX : XXXX ) for the amount of {$890.00}, which I believe to be inaccurate. Despite my requests, no supporting documentation has been provided to substantiate the legitimacy of this debt. 

Timeline : My first dispute regarding these inaccuracies was submitted on XX/XX/year>. Since then, I have followed up numerous times, but the errors remain unresolved. The lack of action on your part has significantly affected my credit score and caused unnecessary stress.

Actions Taken : Submitted multiple disputes with supporting documentation. 
Requested updates and validation of debts, including the specific debt from XXXX for {$890.00}, in accordance with my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
Sought confirmation of corrections, which has not been provided.

Consumer Protection Rights : As a consumer, I am entitled to accurate information on my credit report under the FCRA, which ensures the following protections : The right to dispute inaccurate information and have it investigated within 30 days. 
The right to receive validation for any disputed debts. 
The right to the removal of unverifiable or inaccurate information from my credit report. 
I am requesting an immediate review of my credit report, the removal of all inaccurate information, including the XXXX debt of {$890.00}, and written confirmation of the actions taken to resolve this matter. Please ensure that these corrections are communicated to all other credit reporting agencies to prevent further discrepancies. 
Failure to address these issues in a timely manner may compel me to escalate this matter by filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or pursuing legal remedies.

If additional details or documentation are needed, please contact me promptly. I look forward to your response and a resolution to this matter without further delay. 

Thank you for your attention and cooperation.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute Regarding Inaccurate Information on Credit Report Dear CFPB Team, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to formally address an issue I have encountered with my credit report, specifically with Equifax, regarding the reported child support payments under an incorrect version of my legal name. 

My legal name is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX However, the child support payment record lists my name as XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX which omits my full legal name and designation as " XXXX. '' This discrepancy has caused confusion and has likely contributed to inaccuracies in my credit report. 

Moreover, I believe that the majority of the reported late payments associated with this account are erroneous. Due to this name discrepancy, many of these late payments may not accurately reflect my payment history. In fact, I have already filed a dispute with XXXX regarding this matter, and they sided with me, acknowledging the inaccuracies in their records. 

I kindly request your assistance in reviewing this matter and taking the necessary steps to ensure that Equifax corrects the inaccuracies associated with my credit report. I believe it is crucial for my credit history to accurately reflect my legal name and payment behavior. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
transunion is in clear violation of the law. Under 15 USC 1681 of consumer reports, THE LAW CLEARLY STATES : ( a ) IN GENERAL Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 1 ) In response to the order of a court having jurisdiction to issue such an order, a subpoena issued in connection with proceedings before a Federal grand jury, or a subpoena issued in accordance with section 5318 of title 31 or section 3486 of title 18.

( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

Did I give you written instructions to furnish this on my credit report???

Furthermore, the FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT 15 USC 1681 ( 2 ) ( a ) ( i ) Exclusions from a consumer credit report clearly states : ( 2 ) EXCLUSIONS- except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ). The term consumer report does not include- ( A ) Subject to section 1681s-3 of this title, any- ( i ) Report containing information solely as to transactions or experiences between the consumers and the person making the report. 
Transaction : In business law, a transaction is an event associated with business dealings conducted between two or more parties that involve the formation and performance of an obligation or contract.

THE LAW CLEARLY STATES : Transactions or experiences between the consumer ( me ) and the person making the report is NOT INCLUDED ON MY CONSUMER REPORT.

Delete the above late payment from my consumer report, this agency is in violation of 15 USC 1681. 

The reporting of this account violates multiple provisions under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other consumer protection laws, including but not limited to : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally address concerns regarding my account with your institution. Specifically, despite fully paying off a this account. I believe Discover Bank credit card is violating my rights under federal consumer protection laws. The reported information is inaccurate and should be deleted for the following reasons : 1. Incorrect Balance and Past Due Amount : This account was paid in full. The balance and past-due amounts are incorrect. 2. Incorrect Payment History : The reported payment history rating does not reflect the accounts actual payment record. 3. Misclassification as a Charge-Off/Collection : This account is not a charge-off or collection. It has been fully paid and should be reported as PAID. 4. Incorrect Remarks Field : The remarks field is misleading and inaccurate. Please delete all remarks associated with this account. The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a violation of the FACT Act and the FCRA, which mandate that credit reporting agencies ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the data they report. I am requesting that this account be reviewed and updated to reflect the following changes : I request the immediate removal of this account from all credit reporting agencies. Details of Violations 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Discover Bank credit card has inaccurately reported my paid charge-off as unresolved to credit reporting agencies. Additionally, the account has not been updated to accurately reflect its paid status, despite my requests to rectify the issue. 2. Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) : Your institution has engaged in practices that may be considered unfair, deceptive, or abusive by failing to ensure accurate reporting and withholding proper resolution information. I request the immediate removal of this account from all credit reporting agencies. I am writing to formally address the tangible losses I have experienced as a direct result of the inaccuracies in my credit report. These violations have led to the denial of loans and higher interest rates, significantly impacting my financial well-being. In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am requesting statutory damages of {$1000.00} for each violation. Additionally, I am seeking compensation for monetary damages, including punitive damages, to address the harm caused by these errors.
Company: CAPITAL ONE, NATIONAL ASSOCIATION - GREENWOOD DELAWARE BRANCH

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Inaccurate Information on Credit Report and violation to the Fair credit reporting act. 
Complaint Summary : I am submitting this complaint against TRANSUNION regarding the inaccurate information reported on my credit report, which violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 
On [ Date of Credit Report ], I discovered discrepancies in the following account ( s ) : Account Name : XXXX XXXXACCOUNT Account Number : XXXX Disputed Information : HIGH BALANCE, LAST VERIFLED, DATE OF LAST ACTIVITY, DATE OPENED AND LAST PAYMENT Account Name : XXXX Account NumberXXXX Disputed Information : HIGH BALANCE, LAST VERIFLED, DATE OF LAST ACTIVITY, DATE REPORTED AND LAST PAYMENT Account Name : XXXX  Account Number:XXXX Disputed Information : HIGH BALANCE, LAST VERIFLED, DATE OF LAST ACTIVITY, DATE REPORTED AND LAST PAYMENT Under Section 611 of the FCRA, I have the right to dispute inaccuracies and request prompt investigation. I formally requested a reinvestigation of the account information and cited relevant sections of the FCRA, including : 1. Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) : Requirement for verification of accounts through original documentation.

2. Section 611 : Right to dispute inaccuracies and request investigation.

3. Section 623 ( a ) ( 5 ) : Removal of unverifiable information dont validated for creditor Original.

4. 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures for including information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy Despite my request, TRANSUNION has failed to conduct a thorough investigation or resolve these discrepancies within the required timeframe of 30 days. This negligence has led to the continued reporting of false information, which has negatively impacted my creditworthiness.

In my request, I emphasized that any unverifiable information should be removed from my credit report INMEDEDIATLY within the mandated 30-day period, as established in 15 U.S. Code 1681i. Additionally, I referenced 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), which requires that the procedures forincluding information in credit reports ensure maximum possible accuracy. Furthermore, under 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2, furnishers of information are required to investigate and correct inaccurate information upon notice of a dispute.

Additional Information : Attached documents : driver 's id proof of address social security letter to the credit bureau images of each account with incsartitu
