Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Formal Dispute and Demand for Permanent Removal of Fraudulent Account To Whom It May Concern, I am formally disputing the accuracy and legitimacy of the account listed under XXXX XXXX XXXX which is reflected as a charge-off on my credit report. This account is entirely fraudulent, as I have previously provided comprehensive documentation proving that : 1. The vehicle was never repossessed, as falsely claimed. 2. The vehicle was stolen and involved in fraudulent activity by third parties associated with the dealership, which has been documented and reported. 3. I was never informed of any repossession, rebuild, or resale of the vehicle. Given the overwhelming evidence, XXXX XXXX XXXX is knowingly perpetuating this fraudulent charge-off by allowing it to remain on my credit report. Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) guidelines, it is illegal to report false or inaccurate information on a consumers credit file. I demand the immediate and permanent removal of this account from my credit report. Failure to do so will leave me no choice but to escalate this matter by filing a formal complaint with the CFPB and pursuing legal action to protect my consumer rights. I expect written confirmation of this accounts removal within 15 days of this notice. Civil Court Case Number at my Justice of Peace against XXXX XXXX with XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX T exas Attorney General Office : XXXX FTC Report Numbers : XXXX XXXX XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Transunion^ XXXX XXXX Formal Dispute of Inaccurate Credit Reporting Account XXXX I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate information reported on my credit report regarding the account with XXXX  XXXX, referenced as XXXX The account is listed as a repossession and charge-off , but this information is incorrect due to the fraudulent circumstances surrounding the transaction and the subsequent theft of the vehicle. Details of Dispute : Account Holder : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX Issue : The XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  financed under this account was sold to me under fraudulent circumstances by individuals who later stole the vehicle. These events make the loan terms and subsequent repossession invalid. Resolution Requested : I request that this account be investigated and corrected on my credit report to reflect the fraudulent activity and remove any derogatory marks, including the charge-off and repossession. Supporting Documentation : I have enclosed the following documents to substantiate my claim : 1. A copy of the police report documenting the fraud and theft. 2. A copy of the Court Case Number XXXX. Any additional correspondence with XXXX XXXX regarding the dispute. I kindly request that your agency investigate this matter promptly and remove this incorrect information from my credit report in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Please notify me of the results of your investigation in writing. This has now been settled in a Justice of Peace Court and will be investigated. If additional information is needed to process my dispute, please contact me at XXXX or XXXX I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Violation : If the bank reported the fraudulent loan to credit bureaus and failed to correct the information after you disputed it, they may have violated the FCRA. This law requires creditors to ensure the accuracy of information they report and investigate disputes promptly. 2. Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) Violation : If the bank failed to properly verify the identity of the applicant or disclose the terms of the loan as required under TILA, they could be in violation. Lenders are responsible for ensuring borrowers identities to prevent unauthorized accounts. 3. Identity Theft Laws Violation : If the bank was negligent in protecting your personal information or failed to implement sufficient safeguards to prevent identity theft, they could be held accountable under federal or state identity theft laws. 4. Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) Violation : This law requires financial institutions to protect consumer data. If the bank mishandled your personal information and that led to the fraudulent loan, they may have violated the GLBAs privacy and safeguard provisions. 5. Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) Violation : If the fraudulent account was used to deny you credit or financial opportunities and the bank failed to properly investigate or take corrective action, they could be in violation of the ECOA. 6. Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) - Fraudulent Endorsement or Contracts Violation : Under the UCC, financial institutions have a duty to ensure contracts, such as auto loans, are legitimate. If the bank failed to verify the authenticity of the signatures or loan details, they could be held liable. XXXX. State Consumer Protection Laws Violation : Most states have consumer protection laws that prohibit unfair or deceptive business practices. If the bank acted negligently or failed to respond appropriately to your claims, they may have violated these laws. Possible Bank-Specific Misconduct If the bank failed to investigate adequately, ignored evidence of fraud, or continued collection efforts after you reported the fraudulent loan, they may also have engaged in : Negligence : Failing to take reasonable steps to prevent or address the fraud. Bad Faith : Acting in a way that is contrary to fair dealing and honest practices. XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Formal Demand for Resolution of Fraudulent Loan and Resulting Damages To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally demand resolution of a fraudulent and unethical situation involving the vehicle loan associated with my name, XXXX. The actions taken by XXXX XXXX, as outlined below, have caused me significant financial losses, damage to my credit, and emotional distress. The men who opened this loan knew that because of my age and no prior auto loan history that I was the perfect target to fraudulently obtain and maintain an illegal loan. Summary of Events : 1. I made a down payment of {$3000.00} and paid $ XXXXmonth for four months on a vehicle that was fraudulently sold to me. 2. I paid a total of {$920.00} in insurance premiums during this period. 3. The vehicle was illegally repossessed by the dealership and sold at auction for {$4100.00}, yet XXXX XXXX reported this as a charge-off on my credit report, causing substantial harm for 20 months. 4. XXXX XXXX failed to contact me or address the fraudulent activity until I filed a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). Impact of XXXX XXXX Actions : Financial Losses : A total of {$6000.00} in payments and expenses. Credit Damage : My credit has been negatively impacted for 20 months, leading to financial strain and potential loan denials. Emotional Distress : This situation caused undue stress, leading to depressive episodes and significant emotional hardship. Demand for Relief : T o resolve this matter and avoid further legal action, I am demanding : 1. Reimbursement of all financial losses totaling {$6000.00}. 2. Compensation for credit damage in the amount of {$10000.00}, or an appropriate amount based on your valuation. 3. Compensation for emotional distress in the amount of {$10000.00}. 4. Removal of the fraudulent loan and charge-off from my credit report. All consideration is respected however this matter should be taken seriously before I move forward legally. Response Deadline : I expect a written response to this letter, including your proposed resolution, no later than XX/XX/XXXX If I do not receive an acceptable response, I will have no choice but to escalate this matter further through legal action, filing complaints with regulatory agencies, or both. Conclusion : This matter is urgent and has caused significant hardship. I trust that XXXX XXXX will act in good faith to resolve it promptly. Dear XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, I am contacting you regarding a fraudulent auto loan in my name connected to a XXXX XXXX vehicle. After discovering this account on my credit report, I investigated and uncovered significant evidence indicating that this loan was opened fraudulently without my knowledge or consent. Background of the Fraud : On XX/XX/XXXX, I purchased a XXXX XXXX through a third-party dealership in XXXX, Texas, operated by XXXX XXXX . In XX/XX/XXXX, the vehicle was unlawfully taken under the pretense of repair and never returned. On XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered that XXXX XXXX XXXX reported the loan as charged-off, claiming the vehicle had been repossessed, rebuilt, and resold. This is untrue, as the vehicle was stolen, and I was never notified of any repossession or sale. Action Taken : I have already reported this matter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and have sent a demand letter requesting resolution & monetary relief. Evidence strongly suggests that fraudulent activity between XXXX XXXX, the dealership, and possibly your company facilitated the creation of this account and illegally ran it as a charge off for 20 months without contacting me. There is no proof of communication to me at this time for which my landlord at this address stated he never received ant letters from XXXX XXXX. Request for Immediate Action : I am requesting that XXXX XXXX XXXX 1. Remove the fraudulent account from my credit report immediately. 2. Issue written confirmation that I bear no liability for this loan. 3. Provide any documentation your company has related to the origination and handling of this account. ( For my purposes ) If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will have no choice but to escalate legal action. Evidence of fraud will support my case, including any negligence or willful misconduct by your company in approving this loan without verifying my consent. Please consider this email an urgent notice of dispute under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and respond no later than XX/XX/XXXX. I can be reached at XXXX or XXXX should you require additional information. I look forward to your prompt response. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX All documentation is for your records proving my claim that this is fraud. I am still seeking monetary relief from XXXX XXXX for my financial losses emotional distress and credit damage before I take legal action. I will be forwarding this email to a lawyer of mine who has been informed of illegal activities at hand. Thank you

Under the FCRA, unverified accounts must be removed if you can not provide this proof. Therefore, I insist that the accounts be VERIFIED or REMOVED immediately.

Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : The FCRA regulates how consumer reporting agencies handle personal data. Section 604 ( a ) : Specifies the limited purposes for which consumer reports may be shared, requiring explicit consent in most cases. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : The XXXX requires financial institutions and entities handling sensitive data to protect consumer information and provide notices about information-sharing practices. 
Privacy Rule ( 16 CFR Part 313 ) : Mandates disclosure and consent requirements for sharing personal data. 
XXXX. State Privacy Laws : Depending on your state, LexisNexis may have violated laws like the California Consumer Privacy Act ( CCPA ) or Arizonas Consumer Fraud Act if you reside in these states. 
CCPA ( California ) : Gives consumers the right to know what information is collected, opt out of its sale, and request deletion.

4. Unauthorized Use and Consent : Tort Law ( Invasion of Privacy ) : Publishing false or private information without consent can constitute an invasion of privacy, including false light or public disclosure of private facts.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as a formal notice under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), requiring you to cease all communication with me regarding the alleged debt associated with the account. In the amount of {$2300.00} As stated under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), once you receive this written notice, you are legally obligated to stop all communication with me concerning this matter, except to : Notify me that your further collection efforts have been terminated ; Inform me of any specified remedies that may be invoked by you or the original creditor ; or Notify me of your intent to invoke a specified remedy.

Furthermore, I am formally notifying you that I consider any updates to my credit report as a form of indirect communication regarding this account. If you continue to report, update, or otherwise communicate through credit reporting agencies, I will consider this a violation of the FDCPA. 

If this account is in dispute, I reserve the right to validate or challenge its accuracy, and I expect all collection activity to be suspended as per applicable laws. Any further communication with me outside the outlined exceptions or continued reporting on my credit report will result in formal complaints filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and legal action if necessary. 

Please confirm in writing within 14 days of receiving this letter that you have complied with my request to cease all communication and activity related to this account.

You may only contact me to provide the requested confirmation or if legally required to inform me of one of the exceptions noted above. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request the deletion of an unverifiable account from my credit report under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. Specifically, this pertains to the account identified as a {$720.00} charge-off with XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX 
After disputing this account with XXXX, their investigation was completed on XX/XX/2024. Following the investigation, XXXX deleted this account from my credit report, as the information could not be verified. If XXXX has removed the account due to its unverifiability, I urge you to take similar action and remove this account from my credit report promptly. 
Under the FCRA, all credit reporting agencies are required to ensure that the information on consumer reports is accurate, complete, and verifiable. Specifically : Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies conduct a reasonable investigation of disputed information.

If the disputed information can not be verified as accurate, Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) requires the credit reporting agency to delete it from the consumers credit file.

Furthermore, under Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), furnishers of information must not provide information that they know or have reasonable cause to believe is inaccurate. 
Since XXXX has deemed this account unverifiable and deleted it, I expect the same resolution from your agency. If this unverifiable debt is not removed within 30 days from the receipt of this letter, I reserve the right to pursue further legal action under the FCRA. 
Failure to comply with FCRA requirements may subject your organization to statutory damages, actual damages, court costs, and reasonable attorney fees under Section 616 and Section 617 of the FCRA. Additionally, if willful noncompliance is found, I may be entitled to punitive damages. 
To ensure a clear record of this request, I have attached the relevant documentation, including confirmation from XXXX regarding the deletion of the account. 
Please confirm in writing that this account has been deleted from my credit report or provide a detailed explanation of your investigation findings. I expect a response within the time frame outlined by the FCRA. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Enclosures : 1. Copy of confirmation from XXXX regarding account deletion 2. Copy of my credit report showing the disputed account ( if applicable ) 3. Any additional supporting documentation

Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as a formal notice under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), requiring you to cease all communication with me regarding the alleged debt associated with the account. In the amount of {$1100.00} As stated under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), once you receive this written notice, you are legally obligated to stop all communication with me concerning this matter, except to : Notify me that your further collection efforts have been terminated ; Inform me of any specified remedies that may be invoked by you or the original creditor ; or Notify me of your intent to invoke a specified remedy.

Furthermore, I am formally notifying you that I consider any updates to my credit report as a form of indirect communication regarding this account. If you continue to report, update, or otherwise communicate through credit reporting agencies, I will consider this a violation of the FDCPA.

If this account is in dispute, I reserve the right to validate or challenge its accuracy, and I expect all collection activity to be suspended as per applicable laws. Any further communication with me outside the outlined exceptions or continued reporting on my credit report will result in formal complaints filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and legal action if necessary.

Please confirm in writing within 14 days of receiving this letter that you have complied with my request to cease all communication and activity related to this account.

You may only contact me to provide the requested confirmation or if legally required to inform me of one of the exceptions noted above. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against TransUnion due to their refusal to block fraudulent information from my credit report despite my submission of an official FTC Identity Theft Report, as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). TransUnion has not only misrepresented the validity of the documentation I provided but has also delayed taking action to remove fraudulent inquiries from my credit profile. I am seeking immediate action from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to ensure that TransUnion follows the law and removes these fraudulent inquiries from my credit report. 

Details of the Issue : XXXX. Identity Theft Report Submitted : On XX/XX/year>, I received a communication from TransUnion stating that they could not block the fraudulent information on my credit report because the FTC Identity Theft Report I submitted was deemed invalid. However, this report was officially filed with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) via their website, www.identitytheft.gov, and is a valid, government-certified document. The report includes several identifying features that distinguish it as authentic : Government Seal confirming its legitimacy. Document Number that is unique to the repor
t and can be verified. 
XXXX XXXX from the FTC, along with my wet signature, to authenticate the document. 
Identifying markers located in the top-right corner of the document, proving its authenticity. 
According to Section 605B of the FCRA, TransUnion is required to block fraudulent information from my credit report upon receipt of a valid FTC identity theft report. TransUnions refusal to accept the report as valid is a misrepresentation of the facts and a violation of federal law.

2. Delays in Removal of Fraudulent Inquiries : Despite providing all required documentation through the CFPB portal for swift resolution, TransUnion has failed to act promptly. FCRA Section 605B mandates that credit reporting agencies must block fraudulent information within a reasonable timeframe, usually within 30 days of receiving the identity theft report. TransUnion has failed to meet this deadline and has caused unnecessary delays in resolving this issue.

Furthermore, FTC regulations under 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 require credit bureaus to take prompt action to remove fraudulent information. TransUnions delay in removing fraudulent inquiries and their failure to act in a timely manner constitutes a violation of these federal regulations.

3. State Law Violations : In addition to federal laws, California State Law under California Civil Code Section 1785.16 ( part of the California Consumer Credit Reporting Agencies Act ) mandates that credit reporting agencies must promptly remove fraudulent information when a valid identity theft report is submitted. TransUnions refusal to act in compliance with this law and their failure to respond within the statutory time frame is a violation of my rights under both federal and California state law.

4. Misrepresentation of Documentation : TransUnions misrepresentation of the FTC Identity Theft Report as invalid is particularly concerning. As per FCRA Section 1681i, when a consumer submits a valid dispute, the credit reporting agency is required to provide an accurate and fair review of the information. TransUnion has failed to do so by rejecting an official, government-issued identity theft report, thereby misrepresenting the validity of my documentation.

5. Request for Action : I am requesting the CFPBs immediate assistance to : Require TransUnion to block the fraudulent inquiries from my credit report in compliance with the FCRA and California state law.

Ensure that TransUnion acknowledges and accepts the valid FTC Identity Theft Report as a legitimate document for blocking fraudulent information.

Hold TransUnion accountable for the delay in removing fraudulent items, as required by 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 and California Civil Code Section 1785.16 .

Ensure TransUnion provides timely and accurate communication and resolution of this matter, as stipulated by FCRA Section 1681i.

Supporting Documents : Copy of the FTC Identity Theft Report submitted to TransUnion.

Correspondence from TransUnion rejecting my fraud block request.

Evidence of submission via CFPB portal.

Any relevant state or federal law documents supporting the removal of fraudulent inquiries.

Desired Outcome : I seek the immediate removal of fraudulent inquiries from my credit report, along with proper acknowledgment of the FTC Identity Theft Report by TransUnion, and compliance with federal and state laws regarding the removal of fraudulently reported items.

I trust that the CFPB will assist in ensuring TransUnion complies with all relevant laws and that I receive the relief I am entitled to. 

Additional Information : Consumer Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX File Number : XXXX Date of Complaint : XX/XX/year> Contact Information : [ Your Email Address & Phone Number ] Attachments included in this email as a copy of email from Trans Union on their secured portal Stating government issued identification Government issued FTC identity theft report from ftc.gov Dispute detailing fraudulent inquiries CFPB complaint first complaint issued XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
NOTICE TO AGENT IS NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL NOTICE TO PRINCIPAL IS NOTICE TO AGENT You are furnishing inaccurate and incorrect information to the consumer reporting agencies. The reporting of such inaccurate information has caused severe damage to my character, my reputation, my general mode of living and my ability to obtain credit for personal and house purposes. You and your inaccurate reporting have damaged my livelihood. 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 - Responsibilities of furnishers of information to consumer reporting agencies ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( A ) Reporting information with actual knowledge of errors A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. Duty : a moral or legal obligation ; a responsibility Accurate : correct in all details ; exact. PROHIBITION : a law or regulation forbidding something As Defined by The IRS Even if you didn't receive a Form 1099-C, you must report canceled debt as gross income on your tax return. The IRS Clearly defines a charge off as Gross or Ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT which in fact makes your reporting of this account inaccurate! By Definition The IRS Clearly says a Cancelled debt or Charge off is Income. The reporting of this account as a debt is in accurate. 15 USC 1681 s-2 Says you are a furnisher of information to a consumer reporting agency. You ARE PROHIBITED BY LAW to furnish inaccurate information. I demand you to Cease and Desist the reporting of incorrect/ in accurate information immediately. 15 USC 1681 s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate You are hereby put on NOTICE that you are furnishing incorrect inaccurate information. The lender must file Form 1099-C and send you a copy if the amount of debt canceled is {$600.00} or more and the lender is a financial institution, credit union , federal government agency, or other applicable entity as discussed earlier in chapter 1. The above paragraph is taken directly from the IRS 2021 publication. SEND ME MY FORM 1099-C that you should have sent when you Filled the account as a canceled debt. My Address is listed below! 15 U.S. Code 1681s2 ( a ) DUTY OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO PROVIDE ACCURATE INFORMATION 1 ) PROHIBITION ( B ) Reporting information after notice and confirmation of errors A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if ( i ) the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate ; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. In conclusion I have shown you and you have been put on notice that you are reporting inaccurate information. The information is, in fact, inaccurate. The continued reporting of this inaccurate information is a clear violation of the Law 15 USC 1681 s-2 of your responsibilities as a furnisher of information. You have caused me and my family severe harm due to your negligence and inaccurate reporting. This is a final opportunity to Cure and DELETE This Erroneous, inaccurate account from my Consumer report. YOU HAVE 10 Calendar days to DELETE THIS ACOOUNT FROM MY CONSUMER REPORTS! 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Your initial communication to me in attempt to collect the alleged debt was within 30 days ago. Please be advised that I hereby dispute the validity of the alleged debt listed above in its entirety. Further, I request verification of the alleged debt, specifically, a copy of a contract or agreement. Said contract or agreement must be with the original creditor and signed by all parties involved. You are illegally attempting to collect the above-listed alleged debt and money that I do not owe. Cease and desist all collection activity, including all reporting to consumer reporting agencies. Promptly request deletion of any and all prior reporting made to any consumer reporting agencies. If you comply with my requests above within 14 days, then you are excused from verification. Further more pursuant 15 USC 1692 ( e ) ( 3 ) False or misleading representations A debt collector XXXX not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representation or means in connection with the collection of any debt. Without limiting the general application of the foregoing, the following conduct is a violation of this section : The false representation or implication that any individual is an attorney or that any communication is from an attorney. You XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX have no right under the law to send me any type of communication what so ever. Cease and Desist all communication immediately. Further More You XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Are attempting to collect an alleged debt where the so called original creditor has falsely represent the character other Violations under 15 USC 1692 e that you are implementing your self. Violation : 15 USC 1692b ( 5 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 2 ) ( A ) 15 USC 1692e ( 3 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 6 ) ( B ) 15 USC 1692 ( 9 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 10 ) 15 USC 1692 ( 11 ) This letter is CCed to the Bureau of Consumer Protection Finance as evidence may be provided to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ). The CFPB is authorized to investigate this fully matter and receive any related information herein. Be advised, if you fail to comply with this demand letter, I may turn the matter over to an attorney ). Note I am a very litigious consumer, and I will proceed with legal action for all my consumer rights violations under this subchapter plus all remedies and actual damages as a result of your failure pursuant 15 USC 1692K. If your offices are able to provide the proper documentation as requested in the following Declaration, I will require at least 30 days to investigate this information, during which time all collection activity shall CEASE and Desist. Also, during this validation period, if any action is taken which could be considered detrimental to any of my credit reports, I will consult with my legal counsel for suit. This includes any listing of information to a credit reporting repository/ agency that could be inaccurate or invalidated. If your office fails to respond to this validation request within 10 days from the date of your receipt, all references to this account must be deleted and completely removed from my consumer report, and a copy of such deletion request shall be sent to me immediately. Sincerely, The Following information is required. Please fill out the form below in its entirety. 1. Name and address of Alleged creditor : 2. Name on file of alleged debtor : 3. Alleged Account # : 4. Address on file for alleged debtor : 5. Amount of alleged debt : 6. Date this alleged became payable : 7. Date of original charge off or delinquency : 8. Was this debt assigned to a debt collector or purchased? ____ No ____Yes 9. Amount Paid if debt was purchased : 10. Commission for debt if collection efforts are successful : Please attach copies of the following : Agreement with your client that grants COLLECTION COMPANY NAME the authority to collect this alleged debt. Signed agreement Debtor has made with Debt Collector, or other verifiable proof Debtor has a contractual obligation to pay Debt collector. Any agreement that bears the signature of Debtor, wherein agreed to pay Creditor. All statements while this account was open. Have any insurance claims been made by any creditor regarding this account? o Yes o No Have any Judgements been obtained by any creditor regarding this account? o Yes o No Please provide me the name and address of the bonding agent for COLLECTION COMPANY NAME, in case legal action becomes necessary : Date : ________________ _________________________ Authorized Signature of Creditor You must return this completed form along with copies of all requested information, assignments or other transfer agreements, which would establish your right to collect this alleged debt within 30 calendar days from the date of receipt of this letter. Your Claim can not and WILL NOT be considered if any portion of this form is not completed and returned with copies of all requested documents. This is a request for Validation made pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act. Please allow 30 calendar days for processing after I receive this information. Thank You. cc : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau via fax XXXX cc : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
This letter serves as a formal notice under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and specifically 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), requiring you to cease all communication with me regarding the alleged debt associated with the account. In the amount of {$820.00} As stated under 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( c ), once you receive this written notice, you are legally obligated to stop all communication with me concerning this matter, except to : Notify me that your further collection efforts have been terminated ; Inform me of any specified remedies that may be invoked by you or the original creditor ; or Notify me of your intent to invoke a specified remedy. 
Furthermore, I am formally notifying you that I consider any updates to my credit report as a form of indirect communication regarding this account. If you continue to report, update, or otherwise communicate through credit reporting agencies, I will consider this a violation of the FDCPA. 

If this account is in dispute, I reserve the right to validate or challenge its accuracy, and I expect all collection activity to be suspended as per applicable laws. Any further communication with me outside the outlined exceptions or continued reporting on my credit report will result in formal complaints filed with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and legal action if necessary. 

Please confirm in writing within 14 days of receiving this letter that you have complied with my request to cease all communication and activity related to this account. 

You may only contact me to provide the requested confirmation or if legally required to inform me of one of the exceptions noted above. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Fraudulent accounts were opened in my name without my consent as a result of being a victim of XXXX  XXXX. These accounts include auto loans, credit cards, and collection accounts from various financial institutions. I was coerced into financial arrangements that I could not control, resulting in adverse entries on my credit report. 

Upon escaping the XXXX  situation, I discovered multiple unauthorized debts negatively impacting my credit. On [ specific date ], I contacted the credit bureaus to dispute these accounts and began the process of clearing my credit profile. I also worked with XXXX XXXX, a federally recognized organization assisting survivors of XXXX  XXXX, to verify my victim status and obtain supporting documentation. 

Despite my efforts, the disputed accounts have not been fully removed or corrected. On I filed an identity theft report with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and submitted documentation to TransUnion requesting the removal of fraudulent accounts under 12 C.F.R. 1022.142. Additionally, I requested copies of all account statements and evidence of debt legitimacy from the creditors involved.

As of now, the following unresolved fraudulent accounts continue to affect me : Auto loan from XXXX XXXX, opened on XX/XX/XXXX with a balance of {$45000.00}. 

Multiple XXXX  XXXX credit card accounts, opened on XX/XX/XXXX, with balances totaling {$3400.00}. 

XXXXXXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, opened on XX/XX/XXXX, with a balance of {$1900.00}. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, one with a balance of {$770.00} and another charged off at {$32000.00}. 

XXXX XXXX auto loan, disputed for incorrect payment records. 

XXXX accounts from XXXX XXXX ( balance of {$330.00} ) and XXXX XXXX ( balance of {$2200.00} ). 

These fraudulent accounts have severely impacted my credit, preventing me from obtaining housing, employment, and financial services. I am requesting the CFPB to facilitate the immediate removal of these accounts and to ensure compliance with regulations protecting victims of XXXX XXXX 

Thank you for your attention to this matter and for supporting survivors like myself in regaining financial stability.

According to 15 USC 1681 5, they are supposed to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In general, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

According to 15 USC 1681s-2, they are supposed not to furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Good day! 
I am reaching out regarding several concerning accounts in my credit report that require investigation for a lawful resolution. Upon review, I identified inaccuracies and inconsistencies that violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The violations I have noted include : Violation of Timely Payments Regulations Violation of Finance Charge Determination Violation of United States Code Law ( TILA 15 U.S. Code 1666 ( b ) billing error ) I request that you provide proper evidence showing that I was late on this account, in compliance with Section 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) Ai, 15 USC 1666b, and 1637 ( b ). If you can not supply the required evidence, you can not deem payment as late, which constitutes a violation of Section 15 USC 1681s-2. Please update the account as " PAID '' or " PAID AS AGREED. '' Additionally, I am filing this complaint due to the multiple inaccuracies in my report, which have negatively impacted my ability to secure credit. The violations that need prompt attention are : FCRA Section 616 - Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance FCRA Section 603 ( 4 ) ( 2 ) ( A ) - Obligations with Respect to Disclosures of Personal Information FCRA Section 623 ( a ) ( 3 ) - Furnishing Deceptive Forms Violation of Credit Report Permissible Purposes Privacy Act violations U.S.C 552a ( g ) ( 1 ) ( A ) USC 1692e I demand verifiable proof, specifically the original consumer contract with my signature, for the accounts listed. Under the FCRA, unverified accounts must be removed if you can not provide this proof. Therefore, I insist that the accounts be VERIFIED or REMOVED immediately.

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

This letter serves as formal notice regarding the above-referenced account listed on my XXXX credit report. I dispute the validity of this alleged debt and request that your agency cease all communication with me regarding this matter. Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), you are required to validate this debt before further collection activity. 

Please provide the following : Evidence showing that I am responsible for this debt, including the signed agreement or contract with XXXX XXXX XXXX 
The itemized breakdown of the debt, including how the {$410.00} balance was calculated. 
Proof that your agency has the legal right to collect on this debt. 
Until the above information is provided, I require that you immediately cease all attempts to collect this debt. Failure to comply with this request will be reported to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and the Attorney Generals office in my state. 

Additionally, I request written confirmation that any negative information regarding this alleged debt will be removed from all credit reporting agencies unless the debt is verified in compliance with federal laws. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I expect a response within 30 days. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
Here is a revised letter with specific references to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and language that strengthens your case without including anything that might harm your chances of success. Ive removed unnecessary details and focused solely on the request for the complete removal of the ONEMAIN account. 

Subject : Formal Complaint and Request for Removal of ONEMAIN Account from Credit Report To Whom It May Concern at the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am filing this formal complaint regarding the inaccurate reporting of an account by ONEMAIN on my credit report. The debt associated with this account has been sold to XXXX XXXX XXXX, who have since removed their reporting of the debt. However, ONEMAIN continues to report this account, which violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and creates a misleading and inaccurate portrayal of my credit obligations. 

Details of the Issue Creditor : ONEMAIN Account Number : XXXX Problem : ONEMAIN is reporting a debt they no longer own. Since the account has been sold to XXXX XXXX XXXX, it should no longer appear on my credit report. 

Relevant Statutes Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : The FCRA requires credit reporting agencies to maintain accurate and up-to-date information. Reporting a sold debt as active or open violates this requirement.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Furnishers of information, such as ONEMAIN, are required to conduct investigations and correct or delete inaccurate information upon notice of a dispute. 

Request for Resolution I respectfully request that the CFPB require ONEMAIN to : 1. Completely remove the account from my credit report, as they no longer own the debt, and its continued reporting is both inaccurate and harmful.

I provided documentation proving that this account was fraudulently opened, yet XXXX XXXX and Indigo Bank has failed to remove it from my record. As an XXXX XXXX member, this neglect violates protections under the Servicemembers Civil Relief Act ( SCRA ). I request immediate action to remove these accounts. I have not only provided the required reports for removal I have also been stationed in Texas for XXXX  years and was XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX for the XXXX year in XXXX! I serve this country with my life yet these companies have no issues making it abhorrently hard to remove information as the are required to do my law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I looked at my credit report on XXXX XXXX, and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. According to the FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT, whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual to whom the report relates. These accounts [ XXXX XXXX XXXX - Account # XXXX - XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX Account # XXXX ... ], are not complete and accurate, and also showing up on my report as negative items and I would like for them to be deleted and removed from my credit report immediately. According to 15 USC 1681s - 2, A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. According to 15 USC 1681e ( b ), the open date, /date last active is not accurate. - DELETE ACCOUNT IMMEDIATELY FOR VIOLATION OF 15 USC 1681s - 15 USC 1681e ( b )

Subject : Complaint Regarding Unauthorized Inquiries on Credit Reports To Whom It May Concern : I am filing this complaint against XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion regarding unauthorized inquiries on my credit reports that I have repeatedly attempted to address without resolution. This formal complaint concerns unauthorized inquiries appearing on my credit report, made without my consent and lacking a permissible purpose under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). These inquiries are negatively impacting my credit profile and do not meet the FCRAs requirements for accessing a consumers credit report without express authorization. 
Details of Disputed Inquiries : The following inquiries are disputed, as verified by the creditors, who confirmed they were conducted without my knowledge or authorization : Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX ( Repeat for each disputed inquiry ) Legal Basis for Removal : Under the FCRA, specifically Section 604 ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ), access to a credit report is only permissible when explicit consumer consent or a clearly permissible purpose exists. The listed inquiries do not meet these legal requirements. Additionally, under Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ), any unverifiable information must be promptly removed from the credit report. 
I have attempted to resolve this matter directly with the credit bureau by submitting a formal dispute letter on [ XX/XX/XXXX ]. However, I have not received an adequate response or the removal of the unauthorized inquiries, which I believe constitutes non-compliance with FCRA provisions. 
Supporting Case Law for Removal : Legal precedents reinforce the need for removal of unauthorized inquiries in the absence of a permissible purpose. In XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ), the XXXX XXXX ruled that accessing a credit report without explicit consumer consent or a legitimate purpose constitutes a violation of the FCRA. Furthermore, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX ( XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) reaffirms that credit bureaus are obligated to remove all inaccurate or unverifiable information.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally address and request immediate correction of a critical error in my consumer report that represents a clear violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This letter serves as an official notice that I expect your compliance in removing any references to child support Account # : XXXX obligations from my consumer profile, as these obligations do not constitute a consumer credit transaction under federal law.

Background of Legal Standing and Precedent The FCRA defines credit as the right granted by a creditor to a debtor to defer payment of debt or to incur debts and defer its payment. As confirmed by the legal precedent in Miller v. Trans Union LLC, child support obligations do not involve an extension of credit nor a deferred payment structure granted by a creditor. Consequently, these obligations do not meet the statutory definition of credit under the FCRA. In Miller v. Trans Union LLC, the court determined that reporting child support obligations on a consumers credit report was impermissible, as such obligations are not rooted in a consumer credit transaction but are, rather, statutory requirements that bear no relevance to a consumers creditworthiness in the context intended by the FCRA.

Violation of Consumer Rights and Potential Liability Given the legal basis established by Miller v. Trans Union LLC, your inclusion of child support obligations in my consumer report constitutes an overreach and misinterpretation of the FCRAs scope. This misreporting infringes upon my rights and has caused unwarranted damage to my consumer profile, impairing my access to credit and creating undue hardship based on information that legally should not be reported. As the FCRA does not mandate or even allow for the inclusion of non-credit obligations, your continued reporting of such information subjects your bureau to liability for damages caused by this wrongful action.

Furthermore, under the FCRA, consumer reporting agencies are mandated to maintain accurate and relevant information on consumer profiles. By including non-credit-related obligations, such as child support, you are in direct violation of these statutory requirements, undermining the accuracy of my consumer report and exposing your bureau to liability for negligent or willful non-compliance.

Demand for Immediate Correction and Compliance I hereby demand the following : 1. Immediate Removal : Remove all references to child support obligations from my consumer report without delay.

2. Written Confirmation : Provide written confirmation that this information has been permanently removed from my credit file and will not appear on future reports.

This letter serves as a formal notice of my intent to pursue all available legal avenues to ensure my consumer rights are protected.

Additionally, be advised that if you fail to comply with the FCRA by continuing to report non-credit obligations on my profile, I am prepared to take all necessary legal actions, including pursuing statutory and punitive damages for willful non-compliance. I am confident that any court reviewing Miller v. Trans Union LLC would uphold the same principles in my case, as the statute clearly protects consumers from irrelevant and damaging reporting of non-credit obligations.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally request the deletion of an unverifiable account from my credit report under the provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. Specifically, this pertains to the account identified as a {$720.00} charge-off with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
After disputing this account with XXXX, their investigation was completed on XX/XX/year>. Following the investigation, XXXX deleted this account from my credit report, as the information could not be verified. If XXXX has removed the account due to its unverifiability, I urge you to take similar action and remove this account from my credit report promptly. 
Under the FCRA, all credit reporting agencies are required to ensure that the information on consumer reports is accurate, complete, and verifiable. Specifically : Section 611 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA mandates that credit reporting agencies conduct a reasonable investigation of disputed information. If the disputed information can not be verified as accurate, Section 611 ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ) requires the credit
reporting agency to delete it from the consumers credit file.

Furthermore, under Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ), furnishers of information must not provide information that they know or have reasonable cause to believe is inaccurate. 
Since XXXX has deemed this account unverifiable and deleted it, I expect the same resolution from your agency. If this unverifiable debt is not removed within 30 days from the receipt of this letter, I reserve the right to pursue further legal action under the FCRA. 
Failure to comply with FCRA requirements may subject your organization to statutory damages, actual damages, court costs, and reasonable attorney fees under Section 616 and Section 617 of the FCRA. Additionally, if willful noncompliance is found, I may be entitled to punitive damages.

To ensure a clear record of this request, I have attached the relevant documentation, including confirmation from XXXX regarding the deletion of the account. 
Please confirm in writing that this account has been deleted from my credit report or provide a detailed explanation of your investigation findings. I expect a response within the time frame outlined by the FCRA. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX Enclosures : 1. Copy of confirmation from XXXX regarding account deletion 2. Copy of my credit report showing the disputed account ( if applicable ) 3. Any additional supporting documentation

This dispute is made in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related regulations, which require furnishers of information to provide timely and accurate notice to consumers regarding negative information.

Violation of Notice Requirements Pursuant to Section 623 of the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ) and 12 C.F.R. 1022.7, a financial institution must provide notice to the consumer no later than 30 days after furnishing negative information to a credit reporting agency ( CRA ). Specifically : After providing the initial notice, the institution is not required to send additional notices if subsequent negative information is reported about the same account or transaction. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to comply with this requirement. I did not receive proper notice within 30 days of the negative information being furnished to XXXX and TransUnion. This failure to follow federal law has resulted in inaccurate and unfair reporting on my consumer credit file.

Request for Immediate Action I demand that XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX. Remove the 30-day late payment for XX/XX/year> from XXXX and TransUnion. 
XXXX. Provide evidence that the notice of negative information was sent to me in compliance with 12 C.F.R. 1022.7 and 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 7 ). 

Failure to comply with this request will result in further action, including filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and pursuing remedies under the FCRA. 



Conclusion XXXX XXXX XXXX failure to adhere to federal law has caused significant harm to my creditworthiness. I request immediate rectification of this matter to prevent further damage.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint to address severe inaccuracies and violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) caused by XXXX and the three major credit bureaus ( TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX ). The reporting of my XXXX account is not only riddled with inconsistencies but also reflects a failure to adhere to the legal standards required under federal law. The errors in question have caused undue harm to my financial standing, and I am demanding the complete removal of the account and associated reporting. 

Key Issues with the Reported Account : Inconsistent and Erroneous Reporting Across Bureaus : TransUnion and XXXX report the account as Collection/Chargeoff with a {$0.00} balance but a past due amount of {$38000.00}, indicating conflicting conclusions about the status of the account. 
XXXX, however, reports the account as Late 120 Days with a past due balance of {$3600.00}, entirely inconsistent with the other two bureaus.

This level of inconsistency violates the FCRAs mandate for accuracy and completeness in consumer reporting. The discrepancies alone are sufficient grounds to demand full removal.

Inappropriate Use of 1099-C Language : The account comments reference profit and loss write-off and similar terms, yet there has been no lawful validation or issuance of a 1099-C ( Cancellation of Debt ).

Under IRS guidelines, a 1099-C signifies the discharge of a debt, which, if issued, would legally indicate the account is no longer collectible. Reporting this account as active, derogatory, or delinquent while potentially treating it as canceled is contradictory and violates my rights under both the FCRA and the guidelines for accurate tax and credit reporting.

Failure to Verify Data : XXXX and the credit bureaus have failed to conduct reasonable investigations into the accuracy of the reported data. As required by the FCRA, furnishers and credit bureaus must ensure that reported information is accurate, verifiable, and complete. The conflicting statuses and balances demonstrate a clear lack of verification and due diligence. 
Misrepresentation of the Accounts XXXX XXXX : The account has been marked as charged off, yet the reporting across bureaus does not align with the actual events or transactions tied to the account. This creates a false and misleading representation of my financial history, further damaging my credit profile. 
Good Faith Reporting Obligation Ignored : Both XXXX and the credit bureaus have an obligation under the FCRA to report consumer information in good faith. However, the gross inaccuracies and discrepancies in this case highlight a pattern of negligence or willful disregard for their legal obligations. 

Legal Basis for Complaint : The inconsistencies and misreporting violate several key provisions of the FCRA, including but not limited to : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies must follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy in reports.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Furnishers of information are required to conduct a proper investigation when notified of disputes and must correct or remove inaccurate information promptly. 

Additionally, XXXX XXXX Trans Union LLC establishes that inaccuracies stemming from negligent or willful reporting are actionable under the FCRA. In this case, the errors and contradictions regarding the XXXX account mirror those recognized in the courts findings. 

Specific Demands : Immediate and Permanent Removal : I demand the complete removal of this account from my credit reports across TransUnion, XXXX, and XXXX. This includes all references to derogatory remarks, past due balances, and charged-off statuses.. 
Good Faith Correction : As part of your oversight, Im requesting the credit bureaus to implement procedures to ensure good faith reporting and compliance with FCRA standards for all consumers. 
Investigation and Accountability : Compensation for Damages : Given the harm caused by this misreporting, I reserve the right to seek compensation for damages, and financial harm caused by this inaccurate reporting. 

The continued reporting of this account is unlawful, misleading, and harmful. Your immediate attention to this matter is critical, as these inaccuracies have caused undue hardship and financial damage.

These accounts are causing significant damage to my financial reputation and overall well-being. It is evident that the inclusion of these fraudulent items violates 15 USC 1681b regarding permissible purposes, as the credit bureaus have no legitimate reason to report them without my explicit consent. Please refer to the attached file detailing these items I am disputing.

The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S. Code 1681 ) says ( 1 ) The banking system is dependent upon fair and accurate credit reporting. Inaccurate credit reports directly impair the efficiency of the banking system, and unfair credit reporting methods undermine the public confidence, which is essential to the continued functioning of the banking system. Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against TransUnion for failing to comply with federal laws governing the handling of disputes under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and related consumer protection statutes. Transunion has refused to properly investigate or remove fraudulent accounts reported to FTC Identify Theft on my credit file, causing significant harm and violating my rights. 

Background : On XX/XX/XXXX, TransUnion informed me that 7 of the fraudulent accounts I reported on XX/XX/XXXX to the FTC Identity Theft as fraud accounts were " verified '' per the debt collector, despite being flagged as fraudulent. This response came after 36 days of delay, resulting in an inconclusive decision and allowing the fraudulent accounts to remain on my credit report. 

CRAs Failure to Comply : Despite my clear and lawful dispute, Transunion either failed to perform an adequate investigation or improperly verified the accounts with the original creditors/debtors without validating their legitimacy. 
This constitutes a violation of my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ), which requires the CRA to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information and delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable items.

Harm Caused : The continued reporting of these fraudulent accounts is negatively impacting my credit score and financial well-being.

Additionally, I have spent considerable time and resources attempting to correct this issue, only to encounter further delays and noncompliance by Transunion.

- Laws Violated - Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) : Transunion failed to meet its obligation to reasonably investigate my dispute under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ). 

Transunion continued to report unverifiable and fraudulent information, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), which mandates accurate reporting.

Transunion willful noncompliance with its obligations constitutes a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681n, which provides for civil liability for willful violations, including damages, attorneys fees, and punitive damages.

Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1692 ) : Transunion improperly relied on a creditor or debt collectors unverified claims without ensuring the accuracy of the account, potentially facilitating abusive debt collection practices.

This constitutes a violation of 15 U.S.C. 1692k, which provides for civil liability for violations, including actual damages, statutory damages, and attorneys fees.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against TransUnion due to their refusal to block fraudulent information from my credit report despite my submission of an official FTC Identity Theft Report, as required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). TransUnion has not only misrepresented the validity of the documentation I provided but has also delayed taking action to remove fraudulent inquiries from my credit profile. I am seeking immediate action from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) to ensure that TransUnion follows the law and removes these fraudulent inquiries from my credit report. 

Details of the Issue : XXXX. Identity Theft Report Submitted : On XX/XX/year>, I received a communication from TransUnion stating that they could not block the fraudulent information on my credit report because the FTC Identity Theft Report I submitted was deemed invalid. However, this report was officially filed with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) via their website, www.identitytheft.gov, and is a valid, government-certified document. The report includes several identifying features that distinguish it as authentic : Government Seal confirming its legitimacy.

Document Number that is unique to the report and can be verified.

Digital Signature from the FTC, along with my wet signature, to authenticate the document.

Identifying markers located in the top-right corner of the document, proving its authenticity. According to Section 605B of the FCRA, TransUnion is required to block fraudulent information from my credit report upon rec
eipt of a valid FTC identity theft report. TransUnions refusal to accept the report as valid is a misrepresentation of the facts and a violation of federal law. 
XXXX. Delays in Removal of Fraudulent Inquiries : Despite providing all required documentation through the CFPB portal for swift resolution, TransUnion has failed to act promptly. FCRA Section 605B mandates that credit reporting agencies must block fraudulent information within a reasonable timeframe, usually within 30 days of receiving the identity theft report. TransUnion has failed to meet this deadline and has caused unnecessary delays in resolving this issue.

Furthermore, FTC regulations under 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 require credit bureaus to take prompt action to remove fraudulent information. TransUnions delay in removing fraudulent inquiries and their failure to act in a timely manner constitutes a violation of these federal regulations.

3. State Law Violations : In addition to federal laws, California State Law under California Civil Code Section 1785.16 ( part of the California Consumer Credit Reporting Agencies Act ) mandates that credit reporting agencies must promptly remove fraudulent information when a valid identity theft report is submitted. TransUnions refusal to act in compliance with this law and their failure to respond within the statutory time frame is a violation of my rights under both federal and California state law.

4. Misrepresentation of Documentation : TransUnions misrepresentation of the FTC Identity Theft Report as invalid is particularly concerning. As per FCRA Section 1681i, when a consumer submits a valid dispute, the credit reporting agency is required to provide an accurate and fair review of the information. TransUnion has failed to do so by rejecting an official, government-issued identity theft report, thereby misrepresenting the validity of my documentation. 
XXXX. Request for Action : I am requesting the CFPBs immediate assistance to : Require TransUnion to block the fraudulent inquiries from my credit report in compliance with the FCRA and California state law.

Ensure that TransUnion acknowledges and accepts the valid FTC Identity Theft Report as a legitimate document for blocking fraudulent information.

Hold TransUnion accountable for the delay in removing fraudulent items, as required by 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 and California Civil Code Section 1785.16 .

Ensure TransUnion provides timely and accurate communication and resolution of this matter, as stipulated by FCRA Section 1681i. 

Supporting Documents : Copy of the FTC Identity Theft Report submitted to TransUnion. 
Correspondence from TransUnion rejecting my fraud block request. 
Evidence of submission via CFPB portal. 
Any relevant state or federal law documents supporting the removal of fraudulent inquiries. 

Desired Outcome : I seek the immediate removal of fraudulent inquiries from my credit report, along with proper acknowledgment of the FTC Identity Theft Report by TransUnion, and compliance with federal and state laws regarding the removal of fraudulently reported items. 

I trust that the CFPB will assist in ensuring TransUnion complies with all relevant laws and that I receive the relief I am entitled to. 

Additional Information : Consumer Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX File Number : XXXX Date of Complaint : XX/XX/year> Contact Information : [ Your Email Address & Phone Number ] Attachments included in this email as a copy of email from Trans Union on their secured portal Stating government issued identification Government issued FTC identity theft report from ftc.gov Dispute detailing fraudulent inquiries CFPB complaint first complaint issued XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX To whom it may concern : I am responding to the letter you sent dated about a debt you are trying to collect. Be advised this is not a refusal to pay, but a notice sent pursuant to the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act 15 USC 1692 ( g ). This claim is being disputed and a debt validation is requested. I also have reason to believe that you are in violation of 15 USC 1692e. False or misleading representations as defined ( 3 ) The false representation or implication that any individual is an attorney or that any communication is from an attorney. This is NOT a request for verification or proof of my mailing address, but a request for VALIDATION made pursuant to the abovenamed Title and Section. The account listed below : XXXX Per Code US Code 1681 e ( b ) Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates. PLEASE DELETE OFF MY REPORT I respectfully request your offices provide me with competent evidence that I have any legal obligation to pay you. You contacted me by mail, on and identified the alleged debt as being the original creditor. Please supply the information below so that I can be fully informed : Why you think I owe the debt and to whom I owe it, including : The name and address of the creditor to whom the debt is currently owed, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed. 
If this debt started with a different creditor, provide the name and address of the original creditor, the account number used by that creditor, and the amount owed to that creditor at the time it was transferred. When you identify the original creditor, please provide any other name by which I might know them, if that is different from the official name. In addition, tell me when the current creditor obtained the debt and who the current creditor obtained it from. 
Provide verification and documentation that there is a valid basis for claiming that I am required to pay the debt to the current creditor. For example, can you provide a copy of the written agreement that created my original requirement to pay? 
If you are asking that I pay a debt that somebody else is or was required to pay, identify that person. Provide verification and documentation about why this is a debt that I am required to pay. The amount and age of the debt, including : A copy of the last billing statement sent to me by the original creditor. 
State the amount of the debt when you obtained it, and when that was. 
If there have been any additional interest, fees or charges added since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each added amount. In addition, explain how the added interest, fees or other charges are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or are permitted by law. 
If there have been any payments or other reductions since the last billing statement from the original creditor, provide an itemization showing the dates and amount of each of them If there have been any other changes or adjustments since the last billing statement from the original creditor, please provide full verification and documentation of the amount you are trying to collect. Explain how that amount was calculated. In addition, explain how the other changes or adjustments are expressly authorized by the agreement creating the debt or permitted by law. 
Tell me when the creditor claims this debt became due and when it became delinquent. 
Identify the date of the last payment made on this account. 
Have you made a determination that this debt is within the statute of limitations applicable to it? Tell me when you think the statute of limitations expires for this debt, and how you determined that. Details about your authority to collect this debt. 
I would like more information about your firm before I discuss the debt with you. Does your firm have a debt collection license from my state? If not, say why not. If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 
If you are contacting me from a place outside my state, does your firm have a debt collection license from that place? If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the name, address and telephone number of the state agency issuing the license. 
I have asked for this information because I have some questions. I need to hear from you to make an informed decision about your claim that I owe this money. I am open to communicating with you for this purpose. In order to make sure that I am not put at any disadvantage, in the meantime please treat this debt as being in dispute and under discussion between us. 
PROVIDE ME WITH THE FOLLOWING AS WELL : 1. FULL DISCLOSURE I WAS NOT TOLD THAT YOU WERE ACTUALLY CREATING THE CREDIT WITH MY WET INK SIGNATURE 2. EQUAL CONSIDERATION THEY BROUGHT NOTHING OF VALUE TO THE TABLE AND HAS NOTHING TO LOSE 3. LAWFUL TERMS AND CONDITIONS BECAUSE YOURS WERE BASED ON FRAUD 4. THE WET INK SIGNATURES OF BOTH PARTIES I AM WRITING TO INFORM YOU THAT IM NOT IN DISPUTE WITH ANYTHING BUT I DEMAND THE FOLLOWING LISTED ABOVE BE PROVIDED IN ORDER FOR ME TO BE ABLE TO MAKE PAYMENT. 
PLEASE RESPOND BACK WITHIN 10 DAYS OF THIS CERTIFIED LETTER. 
IF YOU DO NOT RESPOND I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT TO BE FULLY DISCHARGED AND I WILL NEED IT IN WRITING SINCE YOU DID NOT RESPOND BY THE STATED ABOVE TERMS TO PROVIDE THE NECCESSARY EVIDENCE OF A LAWFUL DEBT WITHIN THE REASONABLE PERIOD OF TIME PROVIDE, I WILL CONSIDER THE DEBT IS FULLY DISCHARDED.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Hi. I was putting it off for a long time, but finally decided to sumbit this claim. I've applied for the BankAmericard Secured Credit Card on XX/XX/2024, but was denied for the BankAmericard Platinum Plus Mastercard ( a business unsecured credit card ) and eventually have gotten a hard inquiry in vain since I haven't gotten my secured credit card that I should've gotten. I've contacted Bank of America several times as well as mailed three letters to all the three major credit bureaus asking them to remove this hard inquiry from my credit reports. Everything was in vain. Bank of America didn't care at all and didn't want to resolve this. All the three bureaus responded that I authorized Bank of America to access my credit report ( in general ) and they didn't care that I haven't authorized BoA to access my credit report regarding the BankAmericard Platinum Plus Mastercard because I didn't apply for that card, but BankAmericard Secured Credit Card. They suggested me to resolve this issue with the bank itself, but the bank didn't care, so eventually I gave up trying. 
I'm having the html file of the page from the Bank of America website with application ID 's and dates that states that I applied and got denied for a secured credit card as well as two denial letters that state a denial for that Platinum Plus Mastercard. The reference numbers from the html file and denial letters match. Yes, I applied twice since I couldn't believe they rejected my application for a secured credit card since I was ready to put my money there and I had no credit history at that point. 

So, it's clear that they just confused the cards while reviewing my application and it's resulted in a denial + a hard inquiry on my reports and they didn't want to resolve this as well as the bureaus didn't take any actions to at least clarify something. 


I'd like you to take measures regarding this incompetent service that left me with a hard inquiry and no secured credit card in return. 

I'm happy to provide any additional information or evidence I have once you reach back. 

Thank you and have a good one!

Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
