Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau Complaint Against Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . 
Subject : Formal Complaint Against Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . for Violations of Federal Consumer Financial Protection Laws, Breach of the FTC Holder Rule, Fraudulent Transfers, Non-Compliance with the XXXX XXXX, and Coercive Collection Practices Related to Private Student Loans Originating from Wachovia Bank I. Overview of the Complaint This complaint highlights Wells Fargo Bank , N.A . 's systemic violations of federal consumer protection laws, the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Holder Rule, XXXX XXXX requirements, Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) obligations, and its continued participation in fraudulent debt collection practices stemming from private student loans originated by Wachovia Bank in XXXX. 

Despite multiple enforcement orders from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and ongoing federal oversight, Wells Fargo continues to engage in deceptive, unfair, and coercive practices, perpetuating fraudulent debt tied to a defunct and discredited institution, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, which was shuttered for predatory practices and fraud in XXXX under the ownership of XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ). 

Wells Fargos failure to comply with basic legal requirements during the sale and transfer of its private student loan portfolioincluding its inability to provide chain-of-title documentation, XXXX compliance logs, and verifiable ownership recordsdemonstrates a pattern of willful misconduct, negligence, and contempt for federal regulations. 

II. Key Facts and Timeline Origination and Transfer History : In XXXX, a private student loan was originated by Wachovia Bank for education at XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 
In XXXX, Wells Fargo acquired Wachovia and assumed control over its student loan portfolio. 
In XXXX, Wells Fargo sold/transferred its private student loan portfolio to XXXX XXXX XXXX a subsidiary of XXXX ) XXXX 
Fraudulent Institution and Predatory Practices : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX owned by XXXX ) was found guilty of predatory and fraudulent lending practices that led to its closure in XXXX. 
Wells Fargo knowingly continued to collect on loans tied to this institution, despite the clear evidence of fraud, misrepresentation, and coercion in loan origination. 
FTC Holder Rule ( 16 C.F.R. 433.2 ) : The FTC Holder Rule mandates that any holder of a consumer credit contract is subject to all claims and defenses that the debtor could assert against the seller of the goods or services obtained with the proceeds of the credit. 
Despite clear evidence of fraud and misconduct by XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, Wells Fargo has failed to honor borrower defenses against repayment under this rule, instead choosing to transfer and perpetuate these illegitimate debts. 
XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX et seq. ) : Wells Fargo has failed to provide verifiable XXXX compliance documentation, including timestamps, IP logs, or audit trails showing borrower consent for electronic signatures. 
Promissory notes marked " Electronic Signature on File '' lack supporting evidence of legitimate compliance with the XXXX XXXX. 
Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq. ) : Wells Fargo failed to provide clear and conspicuous disclosures regarding loan terms, repayment schedules, and borrower obligations. 
This lack of transparency violated TILA requirements and undermined borrowers ' ability to make informed financial decisions. 
Chain-of-Title and Ownership Gaps : Wells Fargo has failed to produce clear chain-of-title documentation demonstrating legal ownership of the loans from Wachovia through Wells Fargo to XXXX XXXX. 
Documentation gaps and ambiguities create serious doubts about Wells Fargos legal authority to service, transfer, or collect on these loans. 
Failure to Comply with Existing CFPB Orders : Wells Fargo remains under CFPB-enforced court orders and sanctions for financial misconduct. 
Despite these orders, Wells Fargo has continued to demonstrate a blatant disregard for compliance obligations, particularly in the realm of private student loan servicing. 
III. Specific Violations by Wells Fargo FTC Holder Rule ( 16 C.F.R. 433.2 ) : Wells Fargo failed to honor borrower claims and defenses against fraudulent loans originating from XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 
The Holder Rule applies explicitly to Wells Fargo, as they were a subsequent holder of these contracts and knowingly facilitated the continuation of fraudulent debt collection. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX, 15 U.S.C. 7001 et seq. ) : Failure to provide verifiable proof of electronic consent, including audit logs and compliance records. 
No evidence demonstrating that electronic signatures met federal compliance standards. 
Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq. ) : Failure to provide accurate and clear disclosures on loan terms and repayment obligations. 
Failure to ensure borrowers understood key terms at origination and during subsequent servicing transitions. 
Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA, 12 U.S.C. 5531, 5536 ) : Engaging in unfair, deceptive, and abusive acts and practices ( UDAAP ) through fraudulent loan transfers, improper disclosures, and coercive collection tactics. 
Misrepresenting their legal authority to collect on debts and violating multiple consumer protection mandates. 
Failure to Maintain Accurate Chain-of-Title Documentation : Wells Fargo has failed to produce valid assignments or original promissory notes showing uninterrupted ownership rights. 
This creates a legal ambiguity about Wells Fargos standing to service or transfer these debts. 
IV. Consumer Harm and Broader Implications Fraudulent Debt Perpetuation : Borrowers are being forced to repay fraudulent and unenforceable debts tied to a defunct institution with a proven track record of fraud. 
Coercive Collection Tactics : Wells Fargo and subsequent servicers continue to harass borrowers with collection threats, despite lacking the legal standing to enforce repayment. 
Systemic Financial Harm : Borrowers have suffered irreparable financial damage, reduced credit scores, and emotional distress due to Wells Fargo 's systemic failures. 
Breach of Consumer Trust : Despite being under CFPB enforcement orders, Wells Fargo has repeatedly violated consumer protection laws with impunity. 
V. Relief Sought Immediate Investigation and Audit : A full investigation into Wells Fargo 's loan origination, transfer, and servicing practices related to Wachovia-originated private student loans. 
Document Production : Compel Wells Fargo to provide : Original promissory note Complete chain-of-title records XXXX compliance audit logs Immediate Suspension of Collection Activities : Halt all collection activities and adverse credit reporting related to these loans until full compliance is verified. 
Financial Restitution : Order Wells Fargo to provide full financial restitution to affected borrowers. 
Enhanced Oversight and Accountability : Increase CFPB oversight, mandatory compliance audits, an

d executive accountability measures on Wells Fargo. VI. Consumer Call to Action If you have been impacted by Wells Fargos p
rivate student loan practices : File a complaint with the CFPB, Contact the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), Reach out to your State Attorney General, Engage with consumer advocacy groups : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

VII. Conclusion Wells Fargo 's continued violations represent a staggering breach of consumer trust, financial law, and regulatory compliance. Their failure to produce required documentation, uphold borrower rights under the FTC Holder Rule, and comply with federal laws underscores a pattern of systemic fraud and misconduct. 

The CFPB must take swift and decisive action to ensure borrower protections, financial accountability, and corporate transparency.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Last 4 of SSN : XXXX Hello. I am contacting the CFPB today to detail my recent experience with Apple and the Apple Card. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I filed a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) regarding a fraudulent credit card account opened in my name with GS Bank USA ( Apple Card ). Two days later, I received a response from Apple stating that I was somehow found liable for this account. The response included the instruction, If not already submitted, submit the following documents if you would like this decision to be reconsidered. For your reference, I have attached Apples email, a screenshot of the CFPB complaint ( # XXXX ), and the initial documents submitted with the complaint, including the FTC Identity Theft Affidavit. 

My concern lies in the timeframe of Apples investigation. In just two days, a determination was made that this account is mine, despite my submission of multiple identity theft reports and supporting evidence. Apple has not disclosed the methods used to verify the accounts ownership, which leaves me questioning how this conclusion continues to be reached given the extensive evidence I have provided. It appears that Apple, along with XXXX and XXXX, has failed to thoroughly review the information submitted. 

This fraudulent account has had a severe and lasting impact on my credit report. In an attempt to resolve this issue, I even paid the balance on the accountdespite not being liablehoping this would prompt a deeper review of my case. However, I am still facing the consequences of someone elses wrongdoing. 

After researching the appropriate legal steps, I am formally requesting that Apple Card, under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 605B ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), block this fraudulent information on my credit report resulting from identity theft. According to this statute, this action must be completed within four business days of receiving this complaint. I have again provided all relevant details and documentation for the affected accounts below for your review. 

GS BANK USA Acct No. : XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX I dont recognize this account. I did not authorize this and because of an evil roommate, I have to suffer for his terrible actions. This account was not made, opened, or initiated by me. Unfortunately, they are the result of identity theft and fraud. I have attached a copy of FTC Identity Theft Criminal Complaint # ( XXXX ), along with the other numerous FTC Affidavits I have submitted to XXXX, as proof from the US Federal Trade Commission that the account mentioned above is the result of identity theft and fraud. I have been reporting this account to the FTC for almost a year now and Apple refuses to take me seriously.

This company bough my Loan from XXXX XXXX and are breaching my contract for prepayment. 
See emails below : From : XXXX XXXX XXXX Sent : XXXX, XX/XX/year> XXXXXXXX XXXX To : Support XXXX Subject : Fwd : Error in extra payments. Loan XXXX Hello. Per your request Im sending from my registered email account. 

Ive submitted extra payments and they were not applied correctly. Please fix as per my contract agreement any extra payment goes towards principal. Im requesting proper adjustment of any extra interest improperly calculated to be refunded. 

My loan is XXXX In XXXX I submitted a {$1000.00} payment, all should go towards principal Please see below of all extra payments that needs to be addressed. 

*IMAGE OF BILLING STATEMENT WITH MARKERS OF INACCURATE BILLING* Ive also noticed that my scheduled monthly payments were deleted when I scheduled the extra payments for XXXX. Please fix to have my scheduled monthly payments remain uninterrupted from my extra payment. 

Thank you XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- -- On XX/XX/year>, at XXXX, Support XXXX wrote : Dear XXXX, This email is to inform you that have made multiple scheduled payments and all of which have been posted successfully. However, this is causing the due date to shift forward, resulting in no autopay being charged because the due date shifts forward before autopay due date. We would request you to make payments on the schedule due dates so that autopay can be charged along with any additional payments if made any. 

Furthermore, the payments are first applied to the due amount. Once the due amount is satisfied, any remaining payments are allocated to the principal. From the payment history, we can see that many payments have been applied to the principal after the due amounts were satisfied. Similarly, the {$1000.00} payment was first applied to the due amount for XXXX, and once the due amount was satisfied, the rest was allocated to the principal. 

Slice by FNBO is 100 % digital - all account activity and information are available online within the XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX. This is a mobile friendly site and is accessible via mobile browser. 

Please refer to below FAQ link for more information ; XXXX XXXX XXXX This request will be closed at this time. Please contact us if you have new information to provide. 

Contact us with any additional questions at XXXX. Our email support team is available Monday Sunday XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( except major holidays ). We will be glad to assist you! 

Email Security : Financing provided by First National Bank of Omaha. Protecting your privacy is FNBO 's priority. If you are concerned that you have received a fraudulent email or would like to report a suspicious email, please forward the email to XXXX.

I never deleted any auto payment, for a matter of fact I cant. If your system did : That is your SYSTEM 's fault. As well the due amounts are satisfied monthly and charging extra interest is inappropriate and illegal. I will request you assign a CPA or someone qualified to manually- if needed- to fix this billing statements. 
I should see my interest payments be reduced, not increased on my monthly payments. 
I will also remind you that it is your financial duty to assure ALL and not most of my extra payments go towards PRINCIPAL as per my contract, failing to do such will be a breach of contract and I will be in need to report your company to Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) and the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, as well as potentially seeking legal action towards this billing dispute. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX -- -- -- - They called me XX/XX/XXXX and left a voicemessage.

I didn't agree to this so she stated XXXX would call me back tomorrow.

Product: Checking or savings account
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXL branch of Chase Bank to open a new account. Every one was professional and courteous. I opened a three month CD and a savings/ checking account via checks drawn from my XXXX XXXX  account. 
A requirement for the Total Checking account at Chase is either direct deposits by an employer or government agency. I commented that it would not be a problem because I receive social security benefits and I would transfer the direct deposits from XXXX XXXX to Chase. 
What occurred is the basis of my complaint. 
That following Monday, I contacted Social Security to change my benefits from being deposited to XXXX XXXX Chase. I was alarmed to learn that it had been done already - by the bank. I sent an email to the branch manager and the gentleman who opened my accounts inquiring as to who did this transfer. The day passed with no response. That gave me concern. The following day I called Chases fraud department inquiring who had done the transfer. They could not give me that information, but it apparently is a service the bank provides. 
Now maybe this was mentioned to me when I was at the bank, but without signing a document giving the bank explicit authority to do the transfer, I did not think it would be possible, but apparently it is. I believe this practice is a red flag for possible fraudulent transfers. 
For example, I could not change my dividend deposits, which involve a much smaller amount than my monthly social security deposits, without putting the request in writing and returned to XXXX. 
As a consumer and an XXXX, I believe this practice at Chase needs to cease. I believe a risk management procedure, something akin to having an express written approval form for authorizing any such transfers be used for the future. If such a form was included in the disclosures I signed at the bank, I did not receive a copy, nor was I aware that this would be done without my calling social security first to authorize. Any paper work following the phone call, if needed, could be provided by the bank. 
Please note that in a few days, I did receive a polite and professional phone call from the banker to discuss and I learned this is a practice provided by the bank as a courtesy. I believe this should be reconsidered. 
Thank you.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Account XXXX Dear LVNV Funding LLC, I am writing in response to your recent communication regarding the account referenced above. Pursuant to my rights under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request that you provide the necessary documentation to validate the debt and establish your authority to collect it. 

Specifically, I am requesting : Proof of Ownership of the Debt : A complete and unbroken chain of assignment showing all transfers of the account from the original creditor to your agency. This should include copies of all assignment agreements, purchase agreements, or other documents evidencing each transfer. 

Account-Level Documentation : A detailed account statement showing the full history of the account, including the original balance, itemized charges, fees, and payments made. 

Documentation from the original creditor confirming the validity of the debt, including the original agreement or contract that created the obligation. 

Verification of Amount Owed : A breakdown of the current balance, including the principal amount, interest, fees, and any other charges. 

Proof of Your Authorization to Collect : Documentation demonstrating that your agency has been authorized to collect this debt and that you are acting within the scope of this authorization. 

Until I receive this information, I respectfully request that you cease all collection activities related to this account. Additionally, if you are unable to provide the requested documentation, please confirm in writing that you will cease collection efforts and notify all credit reporting agencies to which you have reported this account to delete it from my credit file. 

Please be advised that this letter is not an acknowledgment or acceptance of the debt, nor is it a refusal to pay. It is a request for information and validation as allowed by law. I expect your prompt response to this matter and look forward to receiving the requested documentation within 30 days. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please direct all future correspondence regarding this account to the address listed above. 

Sincerely, [ XXXX ] XXXX XXXX XXXX Without Prejudice

Subject : Formal Complaint Against XXXX XXXX XXXX and Associated Law Firms for FDCPA and FCRA Violations Dear CFPB Complaints Division, I am submitting this formal complaint regarding multiple violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) by XXXX XXXX XXXX and the law firms acting on their behalf. Below, I outline the details of their actions, the legal violations, and the relief I seek. 

Background of the Dispute On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a collection letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX, c/o XXXX XXXX XXXX , regarding an alleged debt. I exercised my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) and disputed the debt in writing via certified mail, requesting proper validation. Proof of delivery is included with this submission. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to provide legally sufficient validation of the alleged debt. Instead, they supplied incomplete and vague documentation that does not meet the requirements of proper validation. Specifically, the documents failed to include : A signed contract or agreement proving I owe this debt. 
A chain of title showing ownership of the debt if it has been sold or transferred. 
A full and detailed account history substantiating the amount claimed. 
Despite their failure to validate the debt, XXXX XXXX XXXX escalated the matter by involving multiple law firms, subjecting me to continuous harassment and violations of federal law. 

Prior Complaints Closed Without Resolution I have previously filed several complaints against XXXX XXXX XXXX regarding their failure to provide proper debt validation and their continued collection efforts. These complaints were closed without XXXX sending the correct details to resolve the matter. 

The complaints are as follows : Complaint ID XXXX Complaint ID XXXX Complaint ID XXXX It is unacceptable for these complaints to be closed without a full resolution. I request that this matter remain open until XXXX XXXX XXXX provides all legally required information to validate the alleged debt or confirms in writing that the matter has been resolved and closed. 

Law Firms Involved in Unlawful Collection Activity The following law firms have been involved in the unlawful collection activities associated with this alleged debt : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX Actions : Failed to validate the debt after I disputed it and ceased collection activity on XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Actions : Attempted collection without addressing my validation request. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Address : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Actions : Transferred the account without addressing my dispute. 
XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX Address : XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Actions : Attempted collection without resolving prior disputes. 
Hayt , Hayt & Landau , P.L . 

Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Actions : Sent a collection letter on XX/XX/XXXX, continuing collection activity without prior validation, violating 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ). 
Violations Continued Collection Without Validation 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) : Prohibits further collection activities without validating the debt. 
Harassment Through Unlawful Collection Practices 15 U.S.C. 1692d : Prohibits harassment and abuse in debt collection activities. 
Misrepresentation and Unfair Practices 15 U.S.C. 1692e : Prohibits deceptive and misleading representation of debt. 
15 U.S.C. 1692f : Prohibits unfair and unconscionable means of collection. 
FCRA Violations 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Requires accurate credit reporting and investigation of disputes.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX at XXXXXXXX XXXX a telephone call from client XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX to settle the payment with their client XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX location. I explained why I filed the dispute against their client because the Administrative Assistant charged my credit card without my consent, when I was on vacation while I was in another state on XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX. It was XXXX, XXXX XXXX when I scheduled to make a payment for service completed on that morning, there was a disagreement with the balance due amount. Their client said she would call me back after the disagreement but did not, so I had those funds that were issued by the insurance company back into my savings account. After speaking with their client about the payment disagreement, we agreed to resolve after I returned from my vacation to discuss but that did not happen because their client XXXX charged my credit card twice while I was out of town in another state without my consent. The client Manager asked what he can do to make this better. I asked him to submit his document through the dispute process, he said no and will put me in collection and place a lien on my property. 
I was trying to communicate this to the Collection Attorney associates on XX/XX/XXXX, but they were talking aggressively over me and said you just do not want to pay, called me a XXXX  and are going to file XXXX  XXXX  against me and they hung up. I was trying to come to a resolution but I could not. I did not expect that type of XXXX  and harsh experience from the Collection Attorney. The XXXX  Attorney then called back but I did not not answer after how they talked to me. 

So, after that abuse and harsh telephone call from the XXXX Attorney, I wrote the tracking letter on XX/XX/XXXX, that was schedule to be delivered to their address on XX/XX/XXXX to proceed any future communication in writing regarding a final settlement offer for their client XXXX for the insurance approved amount and just move on. 

The XXXX Attorney disregarded my request to only communicate to me in writing but instead called me on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX to accept the settlement offer for their client XXXX for the insurance approved amount {$1800.00}. Since the XXXX  Attorney told me verbally over the phone that he and his client wanted to finally settle for the agreed amount of {$1800.00} and move on. 

I wrote another tracking letter on XX/XX/XXXX, that scheduled to arrive at the XXXX Attorney address on XX/XX/XXXX in response to the phone conversation that was on XX/XX/XXXX that he and his client wanted to final settle for {$1800.00}. I ask in the written letter that the XXXX Attorney to put the final settlement agreement in writing and then I will be happy to pay them the settlement amount that was approved by the insurance company. This will give me a sound mind. 

After writing to the XXXX Attorney to put the verbal final settlement agreement in writing ; they refused to do so and instead continued to call and send emails saying that they did not agree to a settlement over the phone. Since the XXXX Attorney email communication became problematic and stressful, I asked them to communicate to me in writing. The XXXX Attorney called on XX/XX/XXXX at XXXX. 

The client XXXX XXXX I did not want to pay. The reason I have not paid is because they have not put the final verbal settlement agreement in writing. The XXXX Attorney and their client will put a lien on my property and ruin my credit after I ask that they put the settlement agreement in writing. I believe because of their position as Attorneys, they know how to work the system and to make it more difficult for me with resistance not to put the settlement agreement in writing and move on.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : XXXX XXXX XXXX First Tech Federal Credit Union Unlawful Recording and Unprofessional Conduct Dear XXXX, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to formally file a complaint against an employee of First Tech Federal Credit Union, XXXX XXXX, regarding his unlawful failure to disclose that he was recording a phone conversation and his subsequent unprofessional behavior. I am also requesting that you assist in ensuring the preservation of all related audio recordings and documentation, as they are essential to an ongoing legal matter. 

Incident Details : On XX/XX/year>, I spoke with XXXX XXXX, a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX at First Tech Federal Credit Union, regarding a financial issue I am facing with the credit union. During the conversation, XXXX XXXX failed to inform me that the call was being recorded. It was only after approximately three minutes of conversation that XXXX XXXX abruptly stated, " I want to let you know that you are being recorded, if thats okay. '' At this point, I expressed my clear objection, stating, Wait, what? No! I do not give my consent. XXXX XXXX apologized, claiming that he had not had enough time to inform me within the first few minutes of the call. I believe this explanation to be insufficient and untrue, as I did not hear any prior disclosure regarding the recording. 

Unprofessional Behavior : In addition to his failure to disclose the recording, XXXX XXXX conduct was also highly unprofessional and disrespectful. When I attempted to address the matter and ask for clarification, XXXX XXXX responded in an aggressive and dismissive manner. His tone was rude and combative, and he refused to answer reasonable questions about the nature of the recording, particularly when I inquired if I could record the conversation for my own records. His behavior further escalated when he abruptly hung up on me without offering any resolution to my concerns. 

Request for Preservation of Evidence : Given the circumstances and the potential legal implications of this incident, I am formally requesting that First Tech Federal Credit Union preserve all audio recordings of this phone conversation. The conversation is of significant importance to my ongoing legal matter, and I want to ensure that the recordings are not tampered with, altered, or deleted in any way. 

Violation of Law : The failure to inform me of the recording before the conversation started and XXXX XXXX 's refusal to allow me to record the call constitutes a violation of Californias Informed Consent Recording Law, specifically California Penal Code 632 ( a ), which requires that both parties give consent to the recording of any confidential conversation. If XXXX XXXX had intended to record the call, the disclosure should have been made at the beginning of the conversation, before any discussion took place.

Additionally, his rude and unprofessional behavior may be in violation of consumer protection and fair dealing laws under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), as well as the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), which mandates that financial institutions treat consumers fairly and professionally. 

Request for Resolution : I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate this matter and ensure that the following actions are taken : Investigate the actions of XXXX XXXX XXXX and First Tech Federal Credit Union for failing to disclose the recording of the phone call as required by law. 
Preserve the audio recordings of the phone conversation between myself and XXXX XXXX, including any other relevant communications, in relation to the ongoing litigation. 
Ensure that First Tech Federal Credit Union take appropriate corrective action to prevent this unlawful and unprofessional conduct from occurring in the future. 
If this matter is not resolved promptly and appropriately, I will have no choice but to consider taking further legal action to protect my rights and address the damages caused by the mishandling of this situation. 

Thank you for your attention to this urgent issue. I look forward to your prompt response and assistance in ensuring that my rights are upheld. 

Sincerely, Harvest Davidson Penal Codes & Violations : California Penal Code 632 ( a ) : Prohibits recording confidential conversations without the consent of all parties involved. Violations of this law can result in civil penalties, including damages for invasion of privacy. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : Regulates the conduct of debt collectors and mandates fair treatment of consumers, including restrictions on harassment and abuse.

Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) : Ensures that financial institutions engage in fair and transparent practices when dealing with consumers.

Product: Student loan
Issue: Dealing with your lender or servicer
Sub-issue: Need information about your loan balance or loan terms
Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Complaint Against Nelnet ( Firstmark Services ) and XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. 
Complainant : XXXX XXXX Loan Details : Private Student Loan, Originated by XXXX ( XXXX ), Transferred to XXXX XXXX, Currently Serviced by Firstmark Services ( a Nelnet subsidiary ) Institutions Involved : Nelnet , Inc. ( Parent Company of Firstmark Services ) Firstmark Services XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. 
Date of Complaint : [ Insert Date ] 1. Overview of Complaint This complaint addresses systemic violations, fraud, and misconduct in connection with the servicing and ownership of a XXXX private student loan initially originated by XXXX, acquired by XXXX XXXX, and currently serviced by Firstmark Services ( a Nelnet subsidiary ). 

Both XXXX XXXX and Nelnet/Firstmark Services have repeatedly failed to comply with federal laws governing loan servicing, debt validation, and electronic signature compliance under the ESIGN Act, Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Despite previous formal complaints to the CFPB, both institutions have continued deceptive and fraudulent practices. This complaint demands escalated oversight, enforcement action, and immediate investigation into the ownership, servicing, and documentation of this loan. 

2. Key Allegations Against XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX. 
A. Failure to Produce Valid Promissory Note and Compliance with ESIGN Act Conversations with XXXX XXXX, Escalation Manager at XXXX XXXX, revealed that XXXX XXXX may not possess proper documentation of the original promissory note or evidence demonstrating compliance with ESIGN Act ( 15 U.S.C. 7001 et seq. ) requirements. 
ESIGN mandates : Explicit consumer consent to use electronic records. 
Retention of a valid electronic audit trail ( timestamps, IP addresses, and consent confirmation ). 
XXXX XXXX has failed to provide clear documentation demonstrating valid consent or retention of the original promissory note. 
B. Violation of Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq. ) XXXX XXXX failed to provide clear, accurate, and conspicuous disclosures at the origination of the loan, including : Accurate Annual Percentage Rate ( APR ). 
Total repayment cost. 
Explicit terms and conditions of the loan agreement. 
These violations impede the borrowers ability to make informed financial decisions and render the contract potentially unenforceable. 
C. Ongoing Violation of CFPB Court Orders XXXX XXXX is currently under CFPB-mandated court orders for widespread mismanagement across various financial products, including student loans. 
Despite these mandates, XXXX XXXX has failed to implement adequate oversight, internal compliance protocols, or corrective measures for legacy private student loan portfolios. 
3. Key Allegations Against Nelnet , Inc. and Firstmark Services A. Fraudulent and Predatory Servicing Practices Firstmark Services ( Nelnet Subsidiary ) continues to engage in predatory and coercive collection tactics despite documented evidence of loan irregularities. 
These include : Refusal to provide validation of debt upon formal request. 
Obscuring chain-of-title documentation ( XXXX XXXX XXXX Firstmark Services ) . 
Evasive, inconsistent responses to formal inquiries and disputes. 
B. ESIGN Act Compliance Failures Firstmark Services has failed to provide verifiable audit trails or documentation proving compliance with ESIGN requirements, including : Timestamp logs. 
IP address records. 
Explicit evidence of consent to electronic records. 
The loan documents currently state Electronic Signature on File, but supporting records validating this are conspicuously absent. 
C. Violation of UDAAP ( Unfair, Deceptive, and Abusive Acts and Practices, 12 U.S.C. 5531 ) Firstmark has misrepresented its authority to collect on this debt without adequate documentation. 
It has failed to provide transparency regarding loan ownership and servicing authority. 
These acts violate UDAAP principles as outlined in the Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ). 
D. Systemic Transfer and Servicing Errors During the transition from XXXX XXXX XXXX Firstmark Services, critical documentation appears to have been lost, destroyed, or deliberately withheld. 
Errors include : Misapplication of payments. 
Inconsistent reporting to credit bureaus. 
Lack of clear debt ownership validation. 
E. Failure to Address Prior Complaints Multiple formal complaints were filed with XXXX XXXX , including requests for documentation validation and compliance records. 
Nelnet acknowledged the existence of fraudulent activity but failed to take corrective action. 
F. CFPB Findings Against Nelnet ( XX/XX/XXXX Report ) The XX/XX/XXXX CFPB Supervisory Highlights Report documented systemic failures in Nelnet 's servicing practices, including : Deceptive billing statements. 
Mismanagement of documentation during loan transfers. 
Improper denial of repayment plan applications. 
Lack of adequate call center staffing, leading to unresolved borrower concerns. 
These findings align directly with the issues raised in this complaint. 
4. Legal and Regulatory Violations Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act ( ESIGN Act, 15 U.S.C. 7001 et seq. ) Failure to provide audit trails and electronic consent validation. 
Truth in Lending Act ( TILA, 15 U.S.C. 1601 et seq. ) Failure to provide accurate disclosures during origination. 
Unfair, Deceptive, and Abusive Acts and Practices ( UDAAP, 12 U.S.C. 5531 ) Ongoing deceptive servicing practices. 
Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA, 12 U.S.C. 5481 et seq. ) Violations of federal consumer protection laws. 
Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA, 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq. ) Failure to validate debt when formally requested. 
5. Relief Sought from the CFPB Immediate Investigation : Comprehensive investigation into XXXX XXXX and Nelnet/Firstmarks loan documentation and servicing compliance. 
Debt Validation : Mandatory production of original promissory notes, audit logs, and ESIGN consent records. 
Corrective Action : Enforcement orders to prevent continued deceptive practices. 
Penalties and Fines : Civil penalties against both institutions for repeated violations of federal laws. 
Borrower Relief : Suspension of adverse collection actions and credit reporting until compliance is achieved. 
6. Final Remarks This complaint highlights systemic fraud, predatory lending, and servicing failures spanning multiple institutions. Both XXXX XXXX and Nelnet/Firstmark Services have demonstrated blatant disregard for regulatory requirements, borrower rights, and CFPB mandates. 

This matter must be escalated to the highest levels of oversight within the CFPB, with appropriate enforcement actions, fines, and legal measures pursued to ensure accountability. 

XXXX XXXX, as it seems customary for these institutions to send delinquency notices during the holiday season while failing to meet their most basic legal obligations. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Date : XX/XX/year> Subject : Complaint Against Exeter Finance LLC for Non-Response to Rescission of Signature To Whom It May Concern, I am filing this formal complaint against Exeter Finance LLC regarding their failure to respond to my rescission of signature notice within the legally required timeframe under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) and associated federal regulations. 

Background Information XXXX. Rescission of Signature Submission : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX a Rescission of Signature to Exeter Finance LLC regarding a contract associated with my account [ Account Number or Reference ]. This rescission was tendered under my rights outlined in the Truth in Lending Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1635 ) and Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC 2-207, 3-603, and 3-306 ) due to the discovery of itemizations and contractual irregularities.

2. 20-Day Non-Response Period : Under federal law, Exeter Finance LLC was required to respond to my rescission within 20 calendar days of receipt, either acknowledging the rescission or providing a written explanation rejecting the rescission along with supporting legal justification. To date, no response has been received.

Complaint Details 1. Failure to Respond : Exeter Finance LLC has failed to provide any acknowledgment, acceptance, or rejection of my rescission of signature within the required timeframe. This constitutes a violation of the Truth in Lending Act and potentially other federal regulations governing consumer credit transactions. 


XXXX. Request for Notice of Non-Response : As part of this complaint, I am providing a Notice of Non-Response to Exeter Finance LLC, effectively declaring the contract void and unenforceable unless Exeter Finance LLC can provide evidence of their response to my rescission of signature within the legally required timeframe. 


XXXX. Request for Documentation : I formally request that Exeter Finance LLC provide written documentation detailing : Their response to my rescission of signature, if any.

The specific legal basis, statutes, or terms that justify their response ( or lack thereof ).

Resolution Requested I am seeking the following resolutions through this complaint : 1. A full and detailed response from Exeter Finance LLC regarding their failure to address my rescission of signature within 20 days. 


XXXX. A declaration that the contract is void and unenforceable due to their non-response, in accordance with applicable federal laws. 


XXXX. Compensation for any damages or adverse actions resulting from their failure to comply with the statutory requirements of the Truth in Lending Act. 



Supporting Documentation I have included the following documents with this complaint : A copy of the original rescission of signature letter submitted to Exeter Finance LLC. 

Proof of delivery showing the date Exeter Finance LLC received the rescission. 

Copies of any related correspondence or communications with Exeter Finance LLC. 


Conclusion This complaint is submitted in good faith and with the expectation that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will investigate this matter and ensure that Exeter Finance LLC complies with federal law. I respectfully request timely acknowledgment of this complaint and a response outlining the next steps in this matter.

Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Credit Reporting by BMW Financial Services Discrepancies in Credit Report Balances and Improper Reporting Practices Account # : XXXX My auto loan with BMW Financial Services was charged off as of XX/XX/XXXX. 
Despite this charge-off, BMW Financial Services reopened the account on XX/XX/XXXX, and reported XXXX missed payments. 
2. Discrepancy in Reported Balances : The balance reported across the three major credit bureaus is inconsistent : XXXX : {$0.00} balance and listed as charged off. 
XXXX : {$19000.00} balance, listed as charged off. 
XXXX : {$38000.00} balance, listed as charged off. 
XXXX. Issues Identified : Account Reopening : BMW Financial Services reopened a previously closed account and reported additional delinquencies, which appears to be an attempt to retroactively harm my credit score.

Balance Inconsistencies : The balances reported across the three credit bureaus do not match and fail to align with the accounts charged-off status.

Potential Violation of State and Federal Laws : Under Missouri state law, improper practices in debt collection or credit reporting may constitute unfair and deceptive practices. 
Federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), require accurate and consistent reporting.

4. Request for Investigation : I request that the CFPB investigate BMW Financial Services for these irregularities.

The reopening of a charged-off account and the reporting of inconsistent balances are damaging to my creditworthiness and may constitute unlawful reporting practices.

5. Attachments : Screenshots of credit bureau reports showing the discrepancies in balances and reporting details. 


This account was closed as of XX/XX/XXXX. I have no documentation indicating that the account was reopened legitimately or why new negative information is being reported. Reopening a charged-off account and reporting new derogatory information appears to be a false representation of the accounts status, potentially violating the Missouri Merchandising Practices Act ( RSMo 407.020 ). Under this law, it is unlawful to engage in unfair or deceptive practices that harm consumers financially.

Violation of Missouri State Law The actions described may also constitute unfair or deceptive practices under Missouris consumer protection laws. The inaccurate reporting of late payments and the reopening of a charged-off account without proper basis are misleading and cause undue financial harm. I reserve the right to escalate this matter to the Missouri Attorney Generals Office if the inaccuracies are not corrected promptly.

Requested Action I kindly request that you : 1. Investigate the BMW Financial Services account and verify its reporting accuracy.

2. Remove any inaccurate late payment history that occurred after the charge-off date ( XX/XX/XXXX ). 
3. Confirm whether the account was reopened legitimately or close it with the original charge-off date reflected. 

I have attached supporting documents to assist with your investigation, including : A copy of my credit report highlighting the errors. 
BMW Financial Services correspondence. 

Please conduct your investigation in compliance with the FCRA and state laws and provide me with the results within the required timeframe. If you find the information to be inaccurate, I request that you update my credit report to reflect the corrected details. 


Requested Resolution : Remove the inaccurate reporting from all three credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX ). 
Investigate BMW Financial Services reporting practices to ensure compliance with FCRA and Missouri state law.

However, XXXX XXXX XXXX repeated attempts to collect this debt through different agencies violate my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Consumer complaint narrative: I recently received a phone call from a representative at wells fargo escalation department from a very rude and unhelpful person by the name of XXXX XXXX. I was frustrated and upset. I also have a sever XXXX  that limits my interaction with people. She had no patience and was very condescending towards me. She advised me that my complaint was not valid and would not be handled. It would be responded to and closed. No investigation. No nothing. Apparently she doesn't have a care in the world for the bank she works for or the government wich oversees it. Nice to know that these institutions can do what ever they want with no regards to the very people that keep it stuffed full of money.

Sub-issue: Confusing or misleading advertising or marketing
Consumer complaint narrative: on XX/XX/XXXX 2024, I reached out to XXXX XXXX XXXX on behalf of a Consumer Credit Transaction and establishing a line of credit via XXXX XXXX  15 USC 1605. I was directed to Carvana where I picked out a XXXX XXXX XXXX. I was hindered in the midst of the transaction because the system required a copy of a Driver 's License in which I do not own or possess due to the fact that I am not a U.S. Citizen which is described as a Federal Corporation via 28 USC 3002 ( 15 ) ( a ). I am a Private XXXX XXXX who identifies as a Tennessean, and I am not engaged in commerce hence why I don't need a driver 's license to " travel ''. I am XXXX or older, a competent individual, However I been discriminated against and treated as a minor without the legal capacity to enter into contracts and engage in credit transactions via 15 USC 1691 ( a ) ( 1 ) / 12 CFR 1002.2 ( z ), as well as my National Origin due to the fact I was told by Carvana 's agents that the U.S. Passport is accepted in other States but not Tennessee. According to 12 CFR 1002.2 ( aa ) the term " State '' means any District of Columbia, the XXXX of XXXX XXXX, or any territory or possession of the United States so a U.S. Passport is accepted in all states as a form of identification. Carvana did not have anything on their website saying the passport cant be used prior to me providing them my personal information including my Principals security.

Consumer complaint narrative: Purchased items on XXXX that I need on XX/XX/2024 and got a message from XXXX XXXX that my debit card was declined because I exceeded a " transaction limit ''. I called Direct Express and spoke to both a customer service person and on XX/XX/2024 to a supervisor. Both could not tell me what my " transaction limit '' was and what I could do to free up my card. The supervisor told me the transaction limit was a " feature '' of my card and I could not request it be removed. He also told me there was nothing I could do or how long the " transaction limit '' hold would apply and when I could expect to use my card again at stores. Both Direct Express customer service person and supervisor suggested I use " an alternative form of payment '' or go to an ATM and withdraw cash as needed. I told them my social security was my only income and the Direct Express card was my only " form of payment ''.

Student loan
Sub-issue: Loan opened without my consent or knowledge
Consumer complaint narrative: I was told that all loans were federal loans and that I had a fixed interest rate. After finding out that was not true, I tried to consolidate the loans into a fixed rate and was told I could not transfer of change the terms of my loans. This happened over several years and I did not find out until after I graduated what I would be paying. I found over XXXX loans from Navient that I did not agree to during my education. I asked multiple times for copies of my signature on any loan forms and was never provided a copy with my actual signature. There were loan papers that had an electronic signature that did not match the spelling of my last name.
